I called Panasonic customer service, and so far they have been the worst Customer Service experiences I've ever had. Don't know what I will do next, but someone suggested the BBB which seems like the only option at this point...

Reviews.Title: Awesome Gaming/Man Cave TV!
Reviews.Author: Stellicopter
Reviews.Content: I have this thing mounted on a customized entertainment stand I have in my office and primarily use it as my main computer monitor connected to my desktop.  I plan on soon adding game consoles to the setup as I am very pleased how it performs as monitor for gaming.  I run it strictly on game mode to bypass all the processing junk in the TV and let my graphics card on my computer do that instead.  It's connected via HDMI directly to the graphics card and I use the disk drive on the computer for movies.  It's also paired with my amazing 24" Asus LED monitor which does tend to have slightly better color.I've seen plenty of other critics write about how this model is lacking in a few departments.  The only flaws I recognize from the reviews are minor things such as the packaging (it does really suck, to say the least).  I'm guessing that I may have received one of the newest models off the line as the packaging had "Proud sponsor of the Olympic Games" depicted on it, and this about 2 weeks before the 2012 Summer Games.  It seems as though they may have fixed the issue with the manufacturing quality of the medal around the frame as it doesn't seem so cheaply built compared to the one I inspected in a store showroom.  This could be my imagination, but I can attest that the horrible quality packaging was wrecked during the not so careful shipping process that got it here.  However, there were absolutely no cosmetic damages, dings, or dents in the frame around the TV and there were also no signs of screen white bleeding.  This could have just been luck, but I still feel as the quality has been improved over the older show model that I saw in a store.  BTW I begged and offered to pay extra to Amazon to ship it inside of a larger, well-made shipping box, but they declined.  Just a small gripe, it would have been great if Panasonic would have just included the proper mounting screws for the TV and saved me a tech support call along with a trip to the hardware store (FYI, not the friendliest people of India when it comes to tech support)I was told time after time by salesmen and other TV enthusiasts to go plasma for what I was using this TV for, and I stand firmly with confidence behind my decision to go the complete opposite direction with an LED.  I needed/wanted a TV that would work just as well in total darkness as with wide open windows with sunlight while also weighing under 40lbs allowing me to easily/safely mount and un-mount it as needed.  I didn't want 3D and all the over the top fancy gizmos like 640trillion hz because I knew I had no use for them always being in game mode.  The blacks are still black enough for my liking and the picture really couldn't get much better for someone who is literally less than 3 feet away from it during all use.So all you die hard Samsung lovers can keep'em as I've worked in the consumer electronic industry and have seen how Samsung produces more lemons than anyone else.  And as for plasma's, I much prefer something that is lighter, brighter, and doesn't internally explode if I lean it too far over.  My Panasonic LED picture is simply awesome for my needs.

Reviews.Title: Overall I'm pleased, but components were DoA
Reviews.Author: Review_Ninja
Reviews.Content: The picture is great, the sound is mediocre but that wasn't an issue as I have it going to a receiver and 5.1 surround.Why I didn't give this 2-3 stars like other people:Some people have complained about the red light, and I will admit it is distracting at worst. SIMPLE SOLUTION! It's a black frame, Cut a 0.5"x0.5" piece of black electrical tape and cover it... it's literally a 1 cent solution and doesn't obstruct the remotes function in the slightest- I'm more baffled people haven't thought about it. While were on the subject of asinine reviews from others: the "soap opera" effect on the screen is a feature called tru-motion (or similar based on various manufactures branding), just turn it off in the settings- problem solved.All and all I love the TV, it's exactly what I wanted as a gaming screen and entertainment screen and have no qualms with the picture quality, aspect ratios using the PC/alternative devices, refresh rates, or image bleeds. This is a solid TV which just gets down to business without the fancier bells and whistles that manufactures use to justify an obscene markup.

Reviews.Title: Great TV.  Digital everywhere.
Reviews.Author: Truk
Reviews.Content: I bought the 47" while it was on sale for $750.  This TV has turned out to be much better than I ever expected.  I just wanted to jot down a few things that I a have noticed.PERFORMANCEIt is not the prettiest of TVs in terms of its frame, but the picture is outstanding.  I have used it for watching hdtv and blurays, as a computer monitor, and playing console games; this unit has not missed a beat.  My unit has little to no bleeding issues and terrific black levels.  While it is not as good as Panasonic's new plasma televisions in terms of overall picture, it is certainly close.  To tell you the truth I was leaning more towards a plasma after seeing them side by side at BB, but the price was too good to pass up.PACKAGINGI was worried after reading about how the packing could lead to damaging of the unit, however I see no such issues.  Unless one of the delivery men is hating his life that day and takes it out on the box, your unit should make the trip just fine.GENERAL USEI have found that game mode looks and performs the best out of the box.  I have not attempted to manually set the picture settings, I will probably never do this since the Game setting is awesome.APPSI have only used the Amazon instant video app on this unit.  Performance was great and I was able to stream at HD resolutions with no problems.  The interface for the app portal is also very responsive, even while watching tv.PC USEIf you are planning on using this as a computer monitor @ 1920x1080 be sure to set the HD size to "Size 2" (Picture -> Aspect Adjustments -> HD Size).  If this is not set appropriately you will observe screen cropping.AUDIOAs others have stated, the speakers are not that great.  This is really not a big deal since speakers should always be used with a TV like this.  Does not have a 3.5 analog audio out jack, or any form of analog audio out for that matter.  I realized this after attempting to hook up a pair of PC speakers.COMPLAINTSI truly do not have anything negative to say about this TV.  I have always loved Panasonic TVs and this unit is up to the quality that I expect from them.

Reviews.Title: Great price for an Excellent LED TV
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for two weeks. I use this TV for my room. It is a good size but just a bit undersized for an average living room.Quality----------------The picture quality is EXCELLENT. I personally adjusted the picture setting by increasing the Sharpness to 85. I felt it improved the picture quality even more. The details are so vivid that if any show or movie was not filmed for HD 1080p you will notice the difference immediately.Performance----------------The performance is exceptional. The ONLY problem that I ran into was the "Soap Opera Effect" (basically, frame rate lag). You notice the "Soap Opera Effect" especially when you watch sports or action movies. You will begin to see instances where parts of the screen are not keeping up with the rest of the show or movie (lag). After a bit of fiddling I was able to resolve this issue. This can be EASILY FIXED by doing the following:1. Press Menu - (Top left hand side of the remote)2. Go to Picture - (Hit OK on Picture)3. Go to Advanced Picture - (Press the up arrow twice and hit OK on Advanced Picture)4. Turn off Motion Picture Setting - (Go down to Motion Picture Setting and click the right arrow until it is OFF)5. Exit - (hit the Exit button on the top right hand corner of the remote)Design----------------Sleek and very thin like any other high end LED TV. Wish there were HDMI ports on both sides but it was only on the left side.Overall----------------The quality of the TV is superb and I am very thrilled with my purchase. I bought this at $700 and it was a great price especially since there was no sales tax for Amazon.com orders.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, need to change factory settings
Reviews.Author: M. Clarke
Reviews.Content: I just received my TC-L42E50 from Amazon.com for $599 on Friday (7/6/12) with free shipping. I took ShinobiX's (thank you!) settings from AVS Forum and tweaked them myself.Currently I have Comcast HD, and an LG BD-390 all running through a Onkyo TX-SR605 receiver via HDMI cables then out to the Panasonic via HDMI Input 1. This is my second Panasonic (first was a plasma) and I've heard/read not to use any filters since your receiver should be doing most of that for you. So my settings so far (and they aren't perfect) are:Picture Mode: StandardBack light +85Contrast +80Brightness +75Color +60Tint -15Sharpness +85Color temp. - NormalColor mgmt. - OffA.I. picture - OffC.A.T.S. - OffVideo NR - OffAdvanced picture:Block NR - OffMosquito NR - OffMotion Picture Setting - WeakBlack level - Dark3:2 Pulldown: OffEco Power Settings - StandardSo far I'm loving the TV. I have a PureAV stabilizer and the power saving alone make this TV worth the price. Before I pulled over 85% of my capacity running the plasma. Now I can't get above 17%. At $0.075/KWh thats some real savings!

Reviews.Title: Let's be honest: a GREAT deal for a "budget" LCD-LED tv!
Reviews.Author: sixsteps
Reviews.Content: SUMMARY: I have to give this TV "only" 4 stars :). The blacks on it are washed out & shadow detail is not great. BUT this TV is under $800 for 47"! Great deal!!I purchased this TV on June 24, 2012 and chose No-Rush Delivery delivery because I didn't need it right away, and why not get $1 free mp3s? At $749, it was cheaper than any other store online or in-store!!So at this price point, I cannot bring up the complaints that CNET had (2.5 stars, OK rating). Surely, if I want beautiful deep blacks and consistent bright colors, I would be required much more than this. But I surely cannot afford that. My budget was $700-750, and this Panasonic was a better deal than competing Samsung models--but those were 42" models.Thus, I am very happy with my purchase. The colors on this VIERA are beautiful at almost any angle; 47" is more than big enough for my apartment.NOTE: I am not sure if any generic USB Wifi dongle will work & will test this later. I surely don't want to pay so much extra for the Panasonic TY-WL20U Wifi adapter (currently $52.49 direct from Amazon).POSITIVES:*120hz*LED*IPS display = great viewing angles, like your iPad.*Colors are great IMHO*SmartTV "Smart Viera" via built-in Ethernet or Wifi dongle (sold separately).*Lots of Connectivity: 4 HDMI inputs, 2 USB connectors, hybrid component/composite adapter, Ethernet.*Slim design!*Price = great deal! 47" for the price of a 42"NEGATIVES:*Wifi-ready, but Wifi dongle not included & must buy separately.*Color: Blacks are soggy & muted :(*Media Player built-in can only play MP3s & not M4As from iTunes.EDIT: It does play M4A files, but it doesn't read the audio track's info properly, and artist/song name shows up as asterisks.COMPARABLE TVs:$819.99 Samsung UN46EH6000 46-Inch 1080p 240 CMR LED HDTV  = more expensive, and colors bad in their own way; CNET 3 stars.$719.99 Toshiba 46L5200U 46-Inches 1080P/120HZ LED TV  = cheaper, but no Smart apps or connectivity; CNET 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: just ok
Reviews.Author: Oklanawan
Reviews.Content: I waited in eager anticipation for it to arrive only to find 2 dents in the back of the panel(you have been warned...this is not packaged well).  I was a bit perturbed but thought I'd give it try.  The panel is very bright but blacks are not that great as expected.  I did notice vertical banding(dark gray/black lines on light gray to dark gray background).  I understand that all LCD/LED's suffer from screen uniformity issues so I decided to use color slides to see if this was also on my 6 yr old sony lcd monitor for comparisons sake and also on my panasonic st30 plasma but it did not appear on those sets.  If it weren't for this, I would have kept the set.  For the money and without the banding, this would be a good value.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful looking TV with some missing features
Reviews.Author: weikang
Reviews.Content: Here are some personal Pros and Cons I've foundPros:-IPS is exactly what you'd expect. Crisp images from every viewing angle.  Greatly impressed.-Sometimes I game (XBox 360) on this TV, and there is a noticeable, though very slight, lag due to the IPS technology (5ms is the quoted time).  Most of the time it's not apparent, and changing the TV to Game Mode really helps reduce delay and remove artificial enhancements (i.e. "soap opera effect").  In fact, I use Game Mode for every input on the TV because I generally dislike the enhancements modern TVs make.-Panasonic has some really good apps for the Viera internet suite.  I am quite happy with Netflix, Youtube, Pandora, and the like on this TV.  The TV can also connect via DLNA to play music/videos from my computer over the network.Cons:-This TV does not have any audio output except for Optical (TOSLINK) out.  This means you will need to purchase an audio signal converter if you want to use computer speakers or a sound system with RCA audio.  I recommend this little guy (though be warned, it cannot convert every signal from the TV.  Digital broadcast channels in my area do not work, but analog channels, HDMI, and Xbox all work):FiiO D3 (D03K) Digital to Analog Audio Converter - 192kHz/24bit Optical and Coaxial DAC-The HDMI ports stick out sideways from very close to the edge of the TV, so you will see cables running out the side.  Small issue, though.-Note for Android Users, the free Viera remote app is pretty flawed since it relies on auto detection rather than an option to input IP addresses manually.  Since I live in an apartment with no wireless router, detection becomes impossible.  Fortunately my Windows Phone third-party app works just fine.

Reviews.Title: Worth every red cent!
Reviews.Author: dougdorda
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that i had done over a months research before landing on this particular television, and i could not be happier with it. My aim here is to skip over jargon, and technological mumbo-jumbo that can be found in abundance in previous reviews(i do sincerely thank those people though).T.V. - the back-lit panel is simply stunning, there is no getting around that. The Led lit screen pops with intense colors, and resonates with phenomenal picture - AFTER A LITTLE TWEAKING! You may have read about poor black level perfomance(which is just something you will have to sacrifice with a current led tv), but i am here to tell you that it is more than adequate so long as the tv picture is set correctly. The "soap opera effect" is real as well - again, something that is remedied by simply setting up your own picture settings. Below is what has worked very well for me...(These settings may not be ideal for your setup, but they should provide a good base for you to jump off of)Backlight - 18Contrast - 85Brightness - 60Color - 45Tint - 3Sharpness - 50Color temp - normalColor mgmt - offAI picture - offc.a.t.s. - offVideo NR - autoUnder the advanced picture settings -Block NR - autoMosquito NR - AutoMotion picture setting - offBlack level - dark3:2 pulldown - offYou may have also notice the claim that this is a smart tv - Simply put, it is not, which is why i purchased it. It has the potential to be a smart tv if an auxiliary purchase of a wireless adapter is made, and that adapter then hooked to the television. Do yourself a favor, just use a blu-ray player or other streaming device to get the internet content that you may desire. On the note of blu-ray, their picture quality on this television is simply astounding. I might also add that the Mediabrige HDMI cables that are sold on amazon are of incredible quality and will work just as well as higher dollar monster cables.In summation: Personally, i feel the television meets and exceeds the modern standard of picture quality that is to be expected of an led tv. Blu-ray and high-def content are stunning. The television is not smart, but is packed with all the picture customization features that will make any picky videophile happy. There are ample connections, so hooking up all of your gadgetry will not be a concern. At this price point the set is worth its weight in gold.A Quick note on packaging - If you don't have prime, purchase prime - its as simple as that. Other reviewers remarked that the set was shipped in only its original box and quite beat up when it arrived. Shipped from Amazon, my television arrived in not only its own box, but another that surrounded it. Between the two boxes was a sort of packing material i had never seen before, but it more than sufficiently cushioned the package beyond any worry of transit-damage. If you were worried about shipping, put that worry to rest.

Reviews.Title: Great, Tested 100% with Macbook Pro TV-Out, Netflix, Internet, Contrast
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV based on the wonderful honest reviews on Amazon - great price and great shipping options.  In contrast to some others, the TV arrived in mint condition with the box intact.  Tried Macbook Pro TV out via HDMI (with adapter from Monoprice) and the picture quality is fantastic and worked instantly after connection and changing the TV source.  Also, tried Netflix and it works flawlessly (I simply used a white network cable for connectivity, also from Monoprice).  As others have pointed out, I was able to get rid of the Soap Opera Effect via the following menu items: the setting to turn off the Soap Opera Effect is under Advance Picture->Motion Picture Setting->Off.  The blacks and contrast have been excellent.Pansonic is an absolute winner with this TV in comparison to its rival companies, AND this TV was cheaper than comparable models.  Simply amazon.The word is out, Panasonic > Samsung in 2012.

Reviews.Title: Next best thing to plasma
Reviews.Author: Jeremy A Lloyd
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV for a great price. I have a 2010 Panasonic G25 with amazing contrast and PQ, far superior to any of my friends' LCD TVs. I didn't want to buy an LCD but I also was not going to spend $1000 for a bedroom TV that I will only watch for 1hr a night before falling to sleep. I took a leap of faith with Panasonic, based on my satisfaction with their plasmas, and was rewarded.The IPS LED backlit display on this TV is good, it's amazing when you consider that it only cost $600. The display was not like this out of the box though. When this TV arrived I was actally pretty upset with the picture, the contrast was off and there was serious motion blur (soap opera effect). I connected my blu-ray player Panasonic DMP-BD85K WiFi Enabled Blu-Ray Disc Player (Black) and loaded the AVCHD calibration disk from avsforum.com to adjust contrast, brightness, and sharpness. I then disabled CATS, AI picture, Color Mgmt, and overscan. After that I have to say that the picture is pretty amazing, close to that of my plasma.This TV also has all of the "smart" TV options of my more expensive plasma (Hulu Plus, Amazon, Netflix, Pandora, and YouTube) plus the ability to use your iPhone as a remote and game controller. I was initally shopping for the E5 Panasonic TC-L42E5 42-Inches 1080p LED-LCD TV but went to look at my dad's and found that it only had a limited number of apps, not the full Viera Connect store. That and the fact that the lesser E5 is currently priced $80 more than the E50.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic TC-L55E50 55-Inch LED TV is Excellent!...so far
Reviews.Author: Indiapapa
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a replacement for our ~16 year old rear projection TV. We are not gamers nor are we interested in 3D display. We chose this Panasonic product after lengthy research into other brands, models and sizes. We almost opted for another, less expensive Vizio model, but by the time we were able to dispose of our old TV, the Vizio model was out of stock. We had seen several Panasonic HDTVs and had never been disappointed with the Panasonic, so it was next on the list.We received the HDTV about 5 days after ordering through Amazon. After assembling the TV stand, we unpacked the TV. There is a diagram on the side of the box, that the HDTV is shipped in, that has artwork on one side of the box indicating the unpacking procedure. The procedure is very easy for two people. There are 4 plastic latches that allow the top section of the box to be lifted away from the monitor. We chose to mount the monitor on the pedestal, as opposed to a wall mounting. The mounting procedure is clearly indicated with an exploded diagram found in the owner's manual. The assembly screws are found in 2 different plastic packages. There are 2 different screw sizes used for mounting the monitor to the pedestal. One size screw (4 each) attaches the bracket to the base. The other size screw (4 each) attaches the monitor to the bracket. The bracket fits precisely into a slot in the monitor and when the monitor has been seated on the bracket the screws line up perfectly. The assembly procedure is easy to follow and well engineered.There is a characteristic that the purchaser will want to know about. The base has a raised integral mount that the bracket attaches too. This raised integral mount is apparently designed to yield slightly and pitches slightly with the weight of the monitor. Since the model we purchased has a 55-inch monitor, and is naturally top heavy, this presents a bit of unease with monitor stability. We found the azimuth orientation we preferred for the monitor and haven't moved it. There is no swivel to the base, so azimuth orientation means moving the entire base.After attaching the cabling, which is also clearly indicated in the owner's manual, we powered on via the remote and followed eHELP, which is essentially a built-in manual that is always available and performed a first time set-up.One thing that I have noticed about the remote is that I unintentionally keep reformatting the display. The format button is immediately above the number buttons, and I am connected to cable TV, so I have not yet trained myself to tactilely discriminate between these buttons.We love the picture display, and the audio is acceptable. We will edit this review to provide more set-up information in the near future. We are currently using the HDTV, although we haven't settled on the set-up yet.

Reviews.Title: excellent tv
Reviews.Author: Ned Rothenberg
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this purchase - 42 inches gives a good viewing experience without dominating the room.  Connectivity with this set is excellent - 4 HDMI ports, PC port still there (phased out on comparable models) and if you really want to get around the internet fast going from a computer is still much faster than the onboard internet capabilities of any of these tvs.  Quite light for its size and an excellent picture.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: pleasantly suprised
Reviews.Author: dougH
Reviews.Content: I purchased this particular television because of its size class, smart TV functions, the multiple positive reviews it received and price.  I have never had a smart TV before, or a TV this size. I was concerned about the packaging as many reviews said it was inadequate and the TV ended up with minor damage on occasion.  I did not have this problem as I used Amazon Prime, and it was delivered within 2 days by a specialty carrier and was hand carried by two delivery personel.  The packaging was perfectly intact.  I highly recommend that you go this route....otherwise, your TV will likely be in transit for days and days, and no telling what it will go through.I purchased the Panasonic sound bar with this TV as the reviews again suggested that the TV speakers left a little to be desired.  I have to be honest, this TV has amazing sound on its own.  You do NOT need to buy additional audio capability unless you just plan on jamming to the multiple music apps available on this smart TV.  I purchased the Dish wall mount installation package because I was concerned that since this was my first big smart TV that I might be a little bit technologicaly impaired.  The service was first class, however in hindsight, I could have easily installed this thing with just a helping hand to pick it up, not because its heavy, its just so big that it would be very awkward for one set of hands to do it alone.The picture is absolutely outstanding.  And much like the many reviews that I read, its so intense that it does in fact have the soap opera effect when in vidid mode.  Just put it in game mode and it "smooths" it out very effectively.  The internet capablity is very simple, the apps are very navigable, and I am already streaming music and movies.  I have also connected it to my computer via a LAN cable and HDMI cable.  I did not want to deal with the additional "dongle" that is available for purchase that got poor reviews, and a LAN cable is around 7 bucks for a 15 footer, plus with the LAN cable, its plug and play, no setting or configuration to deal with.Great TV for the price...I just couldnt find anything else in this size with these capablities at this price.Now the BAD news.  The TV had a low level screeching noise immediately upon plugging it in.  I could only hear it when the sound was low or off.  But this TV comes with concierge service.  I called them, and had a tech at the house within a couple of days.  Turned out it was a bad transformer on a circuit board.  They ordered the part and once it arrived they came back and installed it within minutes.  Just a part of modern electronics in my opinion, some times things go wrong.  But Panasonic was on it and im happy with the results.  This is the ONLY reason I did not give it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: 60Hz or 120Hz
Reviews.Author: A. GODWIN "godey"
Reviews.Content: Love this TV. do not have any complaints about it. While buying it it states 120Hz but now the title has changed to 60Hz which makes me wonder if it was falsely advertised.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Robert Brant
Reviews.Content: I really wanted something a little bigger then this. In the end I decided to sacrifice size and go for a higher quality tv and boy am I glad I did.  47" is plenty large enough for my living room and it completely dwarfs the 37" Panasonic it replaced. The picture quality is amazing. The smart tv features while unnecessary for me are pretty cool and easy to use. I can only find a few things about this tv that I can criticize and they are just minor things. First like all slim LEDs the speakers are awful. I lasted 2 days before I had to run out and get a sound bar. I was expecting this however. Second I wish there were more composite connections in the back. The TV has plenty of HDMI ports but I have a few components in which dont use HDMI (or more likely Im too cheap to buy the HDMI connector for) so I was only able to hook up one of them. The last thing in which I find slightly annoying is that the tv itself doesn't swivel on its base. Its a very minor thing but it does annoy me. All and all I couldn't be happier with the tv. Im glad I got it on sale but honestly I would have paid full price for this tv. Oh yah one last thing that annoys me about this tv is that the picture quality is so nice that my 5 year old seems to think that it is a giant iPad and he keeps getting his grubby little fingerprints on the screen.  :)

Reviews.Title: Good for the Price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "RG"
Reviews.Content: This review is for the Panasonic VIERA TC-L47E50 47-Inch 1080p Full HD IPS LED-LCD TV.With any TV it is a trade off between price, size and performance.  You can get the best performance in any size provided you're willing to pay for it.  If not, then there must be some compromises.Amazon has been listening to customer complaints about shipping damage and my set was delivered double boxed in a considerably larger box which had loose cardboard type stuffing.  A note of caution, this is a large purchase in terms of size and would be a pain to return.  I would STRONGLY advise paying the extra $4 for next day Prime shipping.  The less time it spends with FedEx or UPS, the less chance of damage.PROS:1.  In Plane Switching (S-IPS) Panel which is ideal for off-axis viewing.  LG and Sharp manufacture most of these panels and I believe Panasonic sources the panel from LG, though I am not 100% certain on this model.2.  The black levels improve considerably when you calibrate this set using various calibration test patterns from:X-Rite i1Display 2 Color Calibrator for LCD, CRT, and Laptop DisplaysSpears & Munsil High-Definition Benchmark Blu-ray Disc Edition [Blu-ray]3.  The colors are quite good and pleasing when watching from most HD sources, but be aware that it is important for the source to broadcast correctly.4.  The 120 Hz refresh hasn't caused me any issues yet.  On 1080p material the Soap Opera Effect (SOE) can be turned off, but it doesn't bother me right now.5.  The edge lit LED uses less power and I do not notice this set getting hot in my cabinet.  The manual states power useage is about 120 Watts.6.  Built-in RJ-45 ethernet port allows you to hook up to your home network for Netflix, Hulu and YouTube. It also allows you to use a USB wireless LAN adapter, but it has to be a Panasonic one.7.  4 HDMI ports, which is really nice.8.  The remote is not bad, but I could see some people not be use to it and accidentally pressing the wrong buttons and waiting to get out of a menu.9.  Thin and relatively light weight makes this set ideal for wall mounting.CONS (all of these cons combined are in my opinion enough to take away one star):1.  There is back light bleed around the edges and in my unit, which was not damaged at all in shipping, has noticeable bleed on the upper and left side parts of the panel which affects the picture quality.  If you watch movies with dark scenes, then this is irritating. You can reduce the back light intensity and contrast to control the back light bleed, but it may be detrimental to picture quality in other ways.  Some people have noticed the Mura effect or "clouding", but I did not see this.2.  The stand is somewhat weak and this set can not be rotated in azimuth.  It works for what it is.3.  At 47" diagonal, this set is not ideal for home theater use and more suited for general living room, basement and gaming use.  So, I would expect the speakers to be a bit better. Yes, you can get a sound bar, but for $5-$10 more Panasonic could have put in better speakers.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, but skip the WiFi for Netflix
Reviews.Author: A Thinking Man
Reviews.Content: Have had this television for a few months. Have really enjoyed it. The picture quality is exceptional, and there are many modes and various customizations you can play with. The modes seem to be right on the money for describing their best uses... Game mode for video games, Cinema mode for movies. It's fun to tweak on the fly and see what works best.I'm mostly writing to caution people about the wireless adapter. As you've probably discovered, the TV is WiFi-ready but you have to buy a separate adapter for around $55 or $65. I purchased the adapter but returned it and paid a little more for a smart Sony Blu-Ray player which accomplishes all of the same things. Why? The way Panasonic handles Netflix streaming is absolutely annoying. I have a very good internet connection and my router is feet from the television. And yet, when using Panasonic's Netflix app, the picture will inevitably and frequently blink to black in the middle of a presentation. As I understand, this is due to "adaptive streaming": that is, Netflix intelligently changes streaming quality on the fly rather than screeching the show to a halt as streaming battles bandwidth. Panasonic's way of dealing with adaptive streaming is to blink black between streaming changes. Sony and other companies' way of dealing with adaptive streaming is to make the picture low-res for a little bit, and then sharpen it up. No blink.I don't know about most people, but I certainly prefer a tiny bit of standard-res video to a black blink, which drived me nuts. What will mostly happen on Netflix using my Sony player is that the show's first 5 or 7 seconds will start out standard-res, then the picture will seamlessly go high-res and look great for the rest of the show. Only rarely do I get a brief standard-res change in the middle of the show, and even then, no black blink. Using Panasonic's Netflix, a half-hour show will blink probably 8-10 times as res changes. This to me is simply unacceptable.I wrote to Panasonic about this specific issue, and they suggested generic unhelpful things like "reset your router." Hah.In summary, beautiful TV, but if you're a heavy Netflix user like myself, do yourself a favor and skip their wireless adapter for another company's smart player.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: thebrakeman
Reviews.Content: We moved our Panasonic 32" S1 1080p TV downstairs to make room for this 42".  I'm not sure if it's the better backlight, refresh rate, or what, but this unit is so much clearer than the 32".  My wife actually asked me if I'd tricked her and sprung for the 3D model, the foreground just had that much pop & clarity.  We used the $100 promo to get the Panasonic Wi-fi built-in Bluray, and could not be happier.Note:  My dad bought a similar unit (42E5) which has identical connections (input/outputs).  He was wanting to use his older Aiwa stereo, which only had the white/red composite inputs.  These recent TV's have no composite outputs anymore (only composite/component INPUT adaptor), so he's forced to think about a new stereo before he was ready.  That understandable, as time marches on.  With this TV, you want a better stereo (think HDMI).  But if you are in that boat, be aware.

Reviews.Title: Vidiya Games!
Reviews.Author: Adam J Wenzl
Reviews.Content: I'm not particularly adept at noticing things like colour acuracy or contrast levels, but I have had little to no issue with the picture quality.  I have noticed a small amount of motion blur, but I think I can make it go away for the most part by modifying the settings.  As far as as the motion processing, it will give you the "soap opera effect" if you have the advance motion processing on while watching film-based content, but it's easy enough to turn off.  I haven't had a chance to try out the smart-tv features because you have to buy an additional part to pick up wifi signals and I don't feel like routing an ethernet cable over my living room floor.  I have an xbox for that which great and I didn't buy it for that anyway.  What I did buy it for and where this tv excels is video games.  I've tried a few fancy flat screens tvs before I settle on this one and input lag was a huge issue (even when in their game-mode).  Panasonic must have paid special attention to the problem of input lag because in game mode the lag is imperceptable.  This tv is a breath of fresh air to anyone who has ever been frustrated by input lag on another tv.  I can't say enough about how satisfied I am with this tv's gaming preformance.  I've noticed that tv reviews rarely spend any time on this critical aspect of television preformance and to find information on this issue, one has to be prepare to sift through fairly muddled forum posts.  In addition there is quite a lot of misleading information out there.  For instance, I had originally purchased a Sharp Aqous marketed with a .016 ms lag time.  I'm not sure where they got that statistic, but it didn't refence the set's lag relevant to gaming.  The set was horrible and made gaming frustrating and unenjoyable.  If you are a gamer and want an excellent set the first time without wasting hours sifting through muddled and often misleading information, this is the set for you.

Reviews.Title: I love this TV and Amazon's Warehouse deals!
Reviews.Author: Paul Bonaddio(Castropa531) "PrB"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this LED TV from Amazon's warehouse deals in "like new" condition.  I was a little apprehensive by not getting it new.  It came repackage in a very heavy duty box with custom formed foam.  The box did have a 3" puncture on the side but it was the side with back of the TV ( thanks UPS).  The TV was brand new, all the original factory protection still applied and all the supplies, except the batteries.  I'm glad Amazon chose to repackage the TV as most of the factory boxes are very thin.  The TV itself is really great!  The picture is amazing and very clear ( Direct TV HD singnal) The picture's color and contrast are very good and look almost 3D.  I did read about the lighter black levels on this TV but in real life viewing, it's not really noticeable.  The back light bleed is very minimal and not noticeable unless you're looking for it.  The online content is very good and work very well and fast i.e. Netflix, Amazon Prime videos etc.. I paid almost half of retail thanks to Amazon's warehouse deals and would buy again

Reviews.Title: Perfect right out of the box - Gotta love HDMI connections
Reviews.Author: Kevin & Deborah Cleveland
Reviews.Content: We had the Panasonic VIERA "TC-L47E50 47-inch HDTV delivered via UPS from Amazon within (2) days of ordering it off there web-site. Right from the well packaged box this Panasonic HDTV appeared to be quality. Packaged very well, protective coverings on all surfaces, neat and orderly - it just gives you and indication of a well planed out product that is concerned about today's shipping force. Without actually reading the manual, plugging it in and (1) HDMI cable, we were watching cable TV! No mess, no fuss, no confusing cables - what a great manufacturing process to develop such and easy to setup HDYV and, did I mention the quality of picture - Holy Cow, it is wonderful, absolutely wonderful, crisp, clear - spot on. I am glad the days of a three-inch grouping of monster cables are finished - HDMI is the shit now. We also bought the Panasonic "TY-WL20U" wireless adapter and "APTMM2B" Cheetah HDTV mount, everything worked flawlessly. Amazon is amazing honestly; you are treated like a real customer and your concerns are listened to and resolved with in an hour. It sure beats the heck out of the driving the parking the walking the "I'll get someone who knows" answers or the mini scientist trying to talk you into the 3D world of HDTV - to funny. Most box store people just care about when there next break is. All in all, you would be silly to shop anywhere else, it's all here and Panasonic is a quality product.

Reviews.Title: Slim, Great viewing angle,"well" connected
Reviews.Author: Harish "Engineer, Photographer and Electr...
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV from Sears when they had an additional award card of $200 (effective price: $849+taxes-200 = $735). This TV wasn't on my radar until the day that I bought it (which was the last day for the gift card). I was looking at a Sony EX645. Not many TVs seem to support Amazon Video any more. I am not sure who is at fault here but that was a need-2-have since I happen to be a prime member.Out-of-the box, the TV was super-simple to install. The colors were very consistent at various angles and heights (IPS does give you that advantage). However, overall picture looked a little washed out. I started tinkering around with the picture settings and got the picture to my preference very quickly. The audio was definitely on the lower side. Go to the advanced audio settings, bumped up certain settings and I was all set. 480i signal did not look right initially. Changed the refresh rate and that looked better (or I got used to it!).The TV does NOT come with a wiFi adapter and purchasing one is costly. I knew about it from the onset. Nevertheless, I think HD content stutters with WiFi and it significantly more stable with a wired connection. I'd already planned for this. With a wired connection, which the TV appropriately recognized without problems, I checked out Amazon Instant video and it worked (woo hoo!). So did netflix. There are other apps as well but I haven't tried them all. I also streamed movies using a DLNA server (1080P about 8GB for a 2.5 hour movie) and that played without a hitch. I haven't tried other formats yet but will keep the review posted as I do.I did read some reviews about some issues (vertical banding) and have not experienced that (fortunately).Overall, a highly under-rated TV and for the price is a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Great Decision
Reviews.Author: Converted Samsung Guy
Reviews.Content: I was debating between this and the Samsung 6100 series.  I have had Samsungs in the past, so I was certain I wanted another.  I decided on the Panasonic and I am very happy with my decision.  I saved $250 and got an almost equivalent TV.  Same features and a great picture.  Maybe the Samsung's picture is slightly better, but I couldn't tell much of a difference in the store.  Good deep blacks and no noticeable "light bleeding".  I'm glad I went with the E50.

Reviews.Title: Excellent LED/LCD TV
Reviews.Author: AmazonGirl123
Reviews.Content: I purchased this a few months ago when this TV was being sold for $600. SUCH AN AWESOME DEAL for this awesome TV.- The packaging was awful. My TV came with a huge dent in the back. I contacted Amazon about this right away (via online chat), and I was helped right away.  They offered a replacement as soon as they received it back OR 20% off!! I went for the 20% off because the dent was on the back - it didn't affect anything.- The audio isn't the greatest. I sometimes have to turn it up to volume 90 and the sound still doesn't project correctly. I'm not sure if it's the TV, or if it's the Hulu Plus app I watch. It'll be an easy fix with an external pair of speakers or soundbar.On to the good...- The quality of the image is SO clear. I have zero complaints about that.- The wifi ready USB connection is awesome. I didn't order cable because I just watch TVs and movies on Hulu Plus and other apps.- It's super super thin so it takes up no room.- It just looks nice. It's aesthetically pleasing.I love my TV. Period.

Reviews.Title: Great Bang for Buck
Reviews.Author: Super Sweet Sale
Reviews.Content: I'm very impressed with this set (TC-L47E50).  I have it in a bedroom with dark blue walls.Here's my night-viewing picture settings:--Picture menuPicture mode: CinemaBacklight: +46Brightness: +51Contrast: 83Color: +55Tint: +1Sharpness: 0Color Temp: WarmColor mgmt: OffAI picture: OffCATS: OffVideo NR: Off--Aspect adjustments submenuScreen size: FullHD Size: Size 2H size: 1 [grayed out]-- HDMI settings: [no change from default]--Advanced picture submenu3D Y/C filter: Off [grayed out]Color matrix: HD [grayed out]Block NR: OffMosquito NR: OffMotion Picture Setting: OffBlack Level: Light3:2 pulldown: OffProps to CNET for the settings, as I only tweaked them a bit for my taste.  My only con with this set are the lackluster black levels, but I'm comparing it to my 60" Panasonic ST30 Plasma, so obviously it's not going to hold a candle to that.  And for the price, the black are plenty good overall.Thanks Panasonic for yet another beautiful set in the household.  :)

Reviews.Title: Very good TV
Reviews.Author: S. Kozik "S Ko"
Reviews.Content: First of all, this is the best TV I have ever had the pleasure of owning. The picture is great, sound is decent, features are rich and it has virtually everything I was looking for in an HDTV.  For those looking for a new TV, this is a 1080P LED-LCD, 120 Hz, Non-3D, Internet-enabled Smart TV. The picture is great, colors are vibrant & black levels are very good.  I did notice a little jitter when watching football, but that's my only picture complaint in a month or so of viewing. Smart Features - this TV has a preset array of applications that include Netflix, YouTube, Hulu, Facebook and several others. This is my first experience with "Smart" features and I enjoy having them. I was slightly disappointed that there is no generic browser capability, but not a deal breaker.  So far there are enough HDMI inputs (4) & USB (2). This TV only has Digital Optical Audio Out, so if you have an older Analog Stereo Receiver, you'll need to get a Digital-Analog converter to connect your TV to stereo sound. (or upgrade to a new digital receiver). I would recommend buying a USB Wireless keyboard to type in movie titles, YouTube searches, etc as it is kind of a pain to type using the TV remote.  I personally bought a Logitech K400 Wireless Keyboard & it works perfectly with this TV. The last point I want to make is that this TV is only Internet-Enabled, meaning that it has a network input to plug in a physical internet cable, but if you want to utilize wireless then you'll need to buy a Panasonic USB Wireless Adapter (Price ~ $50).  Overall, I'm very satisfied with this TV and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Ads!
Reviews.Author: James Rees
Reviews.Content: This TV pops ads up on the screen when you turn it on and when you adjust the volume. These ads are inserted by the TV itself, not by the program source. For me nothing else matters, I'm not going to use a TV that does this.

Reviews.Title: TC-L47E50 From Amazon ($561.74 & free ship)
Reviews.Author: John "John"
Reviews.Content: Nice picture quality and a super buy from Amazon.Pros:  Easy setup.  Plenty of HDMI outlets.  Great 47 inch picture.  Solid base, would be hard to tip over.Cons:  NO S-video plugs.  My Panasonic Home Theater uses S-video and RCA plugs.  Sound is only fair.  I like the red power on LED on the front, our old Sony did not have this and we would leave it running for  days - thinking the set was turned off and NOT.My big issue with this set is the packaging.  It is only a miracle that our set arrived without damage.  It was about to drop through the bottom of the box.  The top of the box looked like it had been ripped open and then taped over.  The styrofoam supports were broken into pieces.  For an item of this expense, it is VERY POORLY PACKAGED.  Be there when it is delivered to check it out.  Panasonic should "beef up" the box & supports, or Amazon should double box.I would hesitate to buy another big box item after this.  This was shipped UPS but do not know if old damage or not.

Reviews.Title: The Amazon Warehouse deal is terrific.
Reviews.Author: Christopher Skotzke
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a basement television in the $500 price range.  Had purchased a different Panasonic 47" (the ET5 smart tv), a more expensive model, about 6 months ago for $750.  Loved it.  We didn't need the bells and whistles for the basement, and decided to purchase this model.  We were on a strict $500 budget (had a $500 gift card) so when the Amazon Warehouse price for the "good condition- USED" model dipped to $495, we jumped on it.The box arrived in excellent condition.  I searched high and low for scuffs, scratches or other flaws which accompany the description of this "used" product.  We didn't see anything...not even a light scratch.  The set started flawlessly and displays a bright, vivid, sharp picture.  It's a terrific set and a great value.There's nothing "used" about this set. I'm pretty sure this is Amazon discounting some of the dented cardboard boxes that invariably occur during handling in the warehouse.I see where the used price jumped about $60 in the last couple of days.  Wait it out...it will settle back under $500 in a week or two...then go get yourself one.  You won't find a superior 47" LED-LCD for less.

Reviews.Title: This tv is 120 hz not 60 hz!
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: Please fix your ad! TC-L47E50 is a 120hz model! TC-L47E5 is the 60hz model! You keep confusing customers. I love this tv but get the right specs up!

Reviews.Title: Safe excellent choice for HDTV
Reviews.Author: BookWorm620
Reviews.Content: We have been using this TV for four months now and it really has been a relief to find it was a very solid purchase.Both the Netflix and Amazon Instant Apps that come with the TV are used alot in my house and they are easy to navigate, stable and look great. We use the ethernet port provided in the back and have not purchased the wifi dongle.Football and Hockey are also heavily watched and they are shown in perfect crystal HD. No Ghosting or blurring. Blu ray and DVD also are fantastic.We have noticed no lines or banding or bleed through that some others have reviewed with. In fact the viewing angles are large with crisp picture and color saturation, every seat in the den offers the same picture and even if I'm standing off to the side of the tv.The most surprising thing was the sound is not as awful as we expected and even though it sometimes has to be turned up almost full volume to hear dialogue or sports announcing, the surround effects on the tv speakers are a bit better than the soundbar we purchased.In other words I would say you can still enjoy the tv if you want to shop around or save up for a home-theater speaker set-up. You will be able to get by on the TV speakers.The final major reason we chose this tv over a smart samsung is the number of ports. Their are alot of media boxes out there so the SD card reader, VGA port, and 2 USBs are not as important (just extra nice) but it has FOUR HDMI outputs and I honestly don't know how people only make due with 1 or 2. We have a Bluray/DVD player, an Xbox, a satellite box, and a laptop taking them all up. I guess other people switch them in and out, but what a pain. I love that we don't have to mess with our setup.That covers everything I can think of but believe me I did ALOT of research before making this purchase so feel free to ask me any questions.

Reviews.Title: Bang for the buck?  This one's got that covered.
Reviews.Author: R. Piazza
Reviews.Content: I ordered this in 55-inch right before the Super Bowl and I wanted to reserve judgment for a few weeks to view the TV in many different ways.  I really wanted a 60" and considered brands like Samsung and Vizio instead.  Ultimately the deal i received on this tv was too good to pass up ($850 plus $50 for the WiFi adapter).  Plus the problem Vizio has had with audio and their panels made me look elsewhere.  Even with the peace of mind of a Square Trade Protection Plan, who wants to deal with an expensive 60" paper weight hanging on your wall?Which ironically brings me to my first point.... the first delivery i received had a defective panel.  Pixels about the size of a nickel in the middle of the screen were dim.  Amazon was fantastic about the exchange and delivered the new one inside of a week via CEVA and the delivery men assisted in the removal of the old tv off the wall and installation of the new tv.At first i regretted my purchase.  Having a 50" Samsung plasma prior to this, i was used to much deeper blacks and an overall sharper picture.  It just so happened that my grandmother just bought a 55" Samsung (non Smart) for $900 and my parents bought a 46" Samsung Smart in the same month as me.  I had the luxury of viewing both of their tv's last week and I'm happy to report that even after tweaking their pictures, I like this Panasonic the best.  Samsungs UI for the Smart features is much better than Panny's but that's a small trade-off.Ultimately i chose an LED over Plasma for a few reasons.  Glare in a bright room, overall weight of the unit and power consumption.  I would definitely recommend purchasing this model if you get a solid deal.

Reviews.Title: Picture is only OK.
Reviews.Author: Sasquatch
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I relied very heavily on the reviews on Amazon.  But, I think they were a bit generous with the accolades for picture quality.  Even though it is 120 Hz, I don't feel the refresh rate is very good.  Lots of pixelization during fast action.  The analog port doesn't work (found that out too late).  The frame is very thin and has a slight curve, and the thin metal looks crinkled/bent.  Don't get me wrong, I am a loyal fan of all things Panasonic.  But, I'm kind of kicking myself for not considering Samsung or even Vizio.  I feel this set is way overrated.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Viera
Reviews.Author: Jscott
Reviews.Content: Im normally a Samsung guy buy this deal was too good to pass up. Very pleased with the quality of the picture and notice no difference in the quality vs my Samsung

Reviews.Title: An incredible TV
Reviews.Author: Raymon Ohmori
Reviews.Content: This TV is truly an amazing deal. I don't really know why it is so cheap. The colors are wonderfully rich, it being an IPS panel, and the design is unobtrusive. The display is very bright, and while the blacks could be better, you won't be finding an LCD panel with better blacks for less than three times the price. The picture quality of this TV is a world of difference from budget brands like Visio, going toe-to-toe with much more expensive brands like Samsung and even besting them with the IPS panel.The SmartTV features are great (we watch Youtube on it all time time). The motion interpolation mode is fun to use for cartoons and anime, and you can turn it off for movies to enjoy them as they were intended.Do turn off A.I. picture though, sometimes it works but when there is a blinking bright spot in a dark picture the results can be.. unpleasant.Panasonic is a relatively less famous brand than Samsung or Sharp, but the quality of their product is awesome. Take advantage of that.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: I love this TV.  I became interested in this TV because a great deal came along.  I read the reviews and decided to give it a try.  I do NOT regret it at all.  The picture is very sharp.  As everyone else has stated, the sound is horrific.  I bought a sound bar and it sounds perfect now.  I despise the motion picture setting, but that is easy to switch to low or off.  I find that fast moving films or actions don't perform well with this setting.  It gets too jittery...which seems to go against its claims.  It works well for pictures that involve a lot of dialogue only.  You have to play around a lot with the color to make it to your liking...and I'm still not thrilled....but its good enough, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Wide-screen LED TV
Reviews.Author: Carol the Dabbler
Reviews.Content: We purchased the Panasonic Viera TC-L47E50 1080p LED TV back in May from Amazon and we are very happy with it.  It is just the right size for our living room.  We have it on top of our TV/Hi-Fi cabinet, with a Safety-First Prograde Flat-screen TV lock support arm connected between it and the wall behind it to prevent our cats from knocking it down.  The FedEx home delivery was seamless and the TV arrived in great shape.  Setup was easy and the picture is gorgeous in its color representation and high definition.  We bought this TV based on a great Consumer Reports rating of its predecessor.  Watching sports and movies on this TV is pure enjoyment.  We don't get cable TV or satellite TV, but we're very happy with the broadcast reception we get from the Terk HDTVi amplified portable antenna, even though we are 40+ miles from TV transmitter towers.  This is a great TV and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Okay tv for the price
Reviews.Author: 43N79W
Reviews.Content: Have this tv hooked up to an indoor antenna (Mohu leaf) with separate amplifier (PCT) to pick up 5 HD stations in our area.Also have it connected to an Asus RT-N10+ router with dd-wrt setup as a bridge repeater.I haven't used any of the apps with the exception of YouTube where it has problems playing HD videos (always plays fine for the first 10 seconds or so and then appears to have buffering issues from that point on).I have a 20 Mbs connection which should be fast enough and have tried plugging the TV directly into the main router but I get the same problem. Viewing the same video through a PC connected to the HDMI port works fine.It seems like a problem with the YouTube app itself...pretty disappointing.The picture quality is very good but wouldn't have purchased this TV had I known about the YouTube problem prior to the return period.

Reviews.Title: Great looking TV, problems connecting PC via VGA cable
Reviews.Author: James Wallet
Reviews.Content: For the price you can't beat this TV!However, when I plug in my laptop via, VGA - VGA, I'm stuck in 1024 resolution!  Moreover, display options in Windows 7 do not reveal 1080p as a valid option.  My laptop is capable of outputting 1080p.  I have a 46" Westinghouse that works like a champ!  Here, when I try to select another output resolution (say, the biggest resolution available, 1600 x 1200) the screen goes blank and I have to wait until the laptop automatically reverts to original resolution.In conclusion, the problem is I don't see 1920 x 1080 as a resolution option AND no resolution besides 1024 seems to be working.  Any suggestions?

Reviews.Title: You get a lot for your money!
Reviews.Author: Helios
Reviews.Content: This is great TV! I was looking for something similar to a 46" Samsung LED LCD TV several of my friends owned. Here's what I found out now that I've got this 47" Panasonic unpacked and working.Pros: Highly adjustable picture. Some complained of the Soap Opera Effect (SOE) which essentially makes everything look too lifelike (loses its cinematic appeal). With the latest software update this TV allows you to adjust (in the advanced picture setting) the SOE from none/weak/medium/strong. I found the weak setting to work well without being noticeable enough to annoy. You can also use this TV as a media hub where all your HDMI devices can be connected and shutoff based on selected preferences. There are a strong set of options to allow a good deal of customization for your home theatre setup. The IPS technology should be familiar to most smartphone users. It essentially allows someone from the kitchen to watch the same show (at an angle) and get exactly the same picture colors as someone on the coach. It's great for sports or watching the news if you don't really want to be right on front of the TV to get the best view. The stand that comes with the TV is great! It is heavy duty where it needs to be and looks good once assembled. It can also be taken apart for moving purposes. I highly recommend using the internet features (via a WiFi USB stick or an ethernet cable). It can be updated via the internet and does have some useful features I still need to explore more.Cons: The 'power on' light is a red square LED. It does not really bother me (the worst would be a blue LED), although some might find it distracting. A Sharpie should tone it down nicely if it does bother. This TV does not really get a regular TV signal. Get a good antenna if you want to pick some channels up the old fashioned way.Recommendation: It's awesome, a great value, buy it!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Picture & Great Viewing Angle
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: We've owned this TV for about a month now. It is a great value in that it offers a lot for a bargain price. The picture quality is excellent. Very sharp and with lots of options for tweaking the picture. The viewing angle is as good as advertised. Both from at the TV from the sides or below seems to have minimal impact if any on the picture quality.The styling is excellent. It's thin and has a small frame around the edges so that the TV doesn't stick out.Audio quality is on par with other HDTV's - not good, but no worse than others.I love the on screen menus - the volume and input menus that pop up are in the corners, out of the way, so that they do not distract from the picture.Although Panasonic brags about using the motion smoothing technology to bump its 120 refresh rate to 360, I highly recommend turning this off. It often makes images in motion distracting. The TV handles motion well with its actual 120HZ rate.The TV has Panasonic Smart Apps built in. This means we can stream using Hulu Plus, Amazon Instant Video, Netflix, Cinema Now, Vudu and others. In the month we've owned the TV Panasonic has already updated the internet interface once to include a new app. The TV has a built in ethernet port, which we are using. Or you can purchase a wireless adapter.The TV has four HDMI ports, but it has only one port with an external adapter that works with either component or AV cables. So if you have a Nintendo Wii (which doesn't use HDMI) and any other device requiring component or AV cables, you can't use both at once. Everything is moving to HDMI so I doubt this is an issue for anyone, but be aware.We bought it at $720, but I see it's now $599. All I can say is buy this TV!

Reviews.Title: Mine didn't last even a year.
Reviews.Author: Milton Austin
Reviews.Content: My panel stopped working within the warranty period.  Unfortunately, they don't seem to have any parts to repair it with.  Waiting is all I have done, and I paid 1400 for essentially a 11 month TV rental.  Look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic IPS TV
Reviews.Author: Nerd Alert
Reviews.Content: When my last TV broke, I decided to go with an LED backlit TV, landing on an LG because it was the cheapest for the size.  My previous TV was so old that I assumed any modern LED TV would be vastly superior and I did not want to waste money.  I was wrong.  The LG TV was blurry, even after changing the settings, and had poor viewing angles and motion.  It also had a malfunction that caused me to return it, which was a blessing in disguise.  I decided to rethink my approach and get a better TV rather than a bigger TV.  That led me to this Panasonic VIERA TV (TC-L42E50).FEATURESThere is no 3D capability or built-in wifi, which helps keep this version of the VIERA relatively inexpensive.  The latter can be remedied with a wifi dongle, but for that price you may prefer a Roku anyway.  Regardless, it does have media features built in, including two conveniently located USB ports.FINISHThe bezel is not as thin as some competitors, but the TV looks very nice and understated.  The thickness of the unit is tiny compared to my old TV and would look very fancy with a flush wall mount.  To keep things thin, the plug is not the standard PC type, which for me means taking off the wall mount to switch from the old type.  I think it is worth the hassle, though.PICTUREWow.  The colors are rich and the viewing angles are super wide, as expected with IPS.  Blacks will not match the top end Plasmas, but look great for an LED TV.  I am continually impressed with this TV.MOTIONMotion looks great on this TV.  It has optional motion interpolation that works very nicely, though we have been trained to think of 24 fps as being correct for movies.  Thankfully, the option is easy to change depending on preference.  I decided to embrace it and now really like the less choppy look.  It works even better with content actually rendered in higher frame rates, such as video games.OVERALLI am very happy with the TC-L42E50, with its excellent picture, viewing angles, and motion presentation.  While it skimps on the features to keep the price lower than other models, it still has the feel of a premium TV where it counts.

Reviews.Title: Had To Go Back To Plasma
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased the 55" Costco version of this set over the summer while it was still priced at $1,299.  I have had a Panasonic plasma since 2009 and have always enjoyed the excellent picture it provides.  I was hesitant to go with an LED/LCD after the endless hours of research I had done.  Given the four HDMI inputs and the advertised great viewing angles of this IPS set, I decided to give it a try.  There was a lot I liked about the set: thin profile, low power consumption, bright picture, number of HDMI inputs, and the Panasonic name.  What I didn't like about the set and what ultimately had me switch it out, were the following.  First, it had a very noticeable lip sync issue that I've read about others having on this model as well.  I contacted Panasonic about it, and they were as close to useless as one could imagine.  I have basic cable, so my connection goes directly into the set via the coaxial.  The rep wanted to blame it on my cable box, but was then stumped when he found out I didn't have one.  If it was just a problem with the cable, I could have probably lived with it, but it also affected my Roku player via HDMI and even my Sony Blu-Ray player via HDMI as well.  It literally manifested itself like a late night, old school karate flick.  It was very noticeable not only through the set's speakers, but also through my Harman Kardon surround system hooked up via Toslink.  I updated the software via the online connection and ultimately reset the panel completely, losing all of my settings, but the problem persisted.  Beyond the lip sync issue, I was also disappointed in the off axis viewing angles.  This is advertised as one of this panel's strong points, but as soon as I was even 15-20 degrees off center, the contrast and color saturation took a noticeable hit.  Being an edge lit set, the uneven light bleed in dark scenes even with the brightness and backlighting turned down was a problem also.  The last issue that did it for me was the handling of motion.  I tried the various increments of the motion setting, but none of them can compete with the picture on a plasma.  Once you get above medium, you attain smoothness, but you also have a very unnatural affect.Costco had a great deal on the 60" LG 1080P plasma, so I ended up going with that.  I would have obviously preferred a Panasonic, but at the price they're offering the LG at, it's an unbeatable value.  On a side note, none of the problems listed above are an issue with this LG, including the lip sync.  Regardless of the set's speakers or my surround system, the lip sync is perfect, as it is on my Panasonic plasma.  Overall, I liked a lot about the Panasonic E series, but in my opinion, plasma is extremely hard to beat in overall picture quality and performance at the price.

Reviews.Title: Never upgrade firmware of Panasonic LED TV VIERA
Reviews.Author: liushaw
Reviews.Content: http://www.5-9-8.com/index.php?option=com_kunena&view;=topic&catid;=16&id;=3&Itemid;=152Hi everyone,Never upgrade firmware of Panasonic LED TV VIERA TH-L50E6A :(I upgraded the firmware recently and found out the picture quality are significantly worse then previous version. especially when you play lower resolution media files. before there is a software enhanced picture, now it's gone!reported to Panasonic support and no solution and no reverse!you are warned.

Reviews.Title: Decent TV, terrible customer support
Reviews.Author: compwhiz540
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to love this TV.  The TV itself is extremely attractive and the picture was quite good.  It's a really thin TV with Netflix very conveniently integrated.About 2 months in, the picture started to become distorted.  I called customer support and dropped it off at the repair shop.  It's been over 2 months and the replacement part the repair place needs is still backordered.  So my TV is 4 months old and it's spent 2 months in the shop.  I've called a dozen times and every time they've been extremely unhelpful :(  I'm considering small claims court at this point.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Luis Omar García
Reviews.Content: I sold my panasonic 42 inch 720p plasma and recently bought the 47 inch version of this tv and it's amazing, needed to tweak and play with the settings but the results were incredible.  Some backlight bleed but it's not noticeable while watching a movie and this is common in LEDs.  I have used it for games, bluray movies, streaming and as a pc monitor.  Panasonic is my favorite brand for now on.P.S. amazon fixed the package issue by double boxing it, I'm glad they did because I read other people's comments and saw some complaints about it being in scrappy packaging.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV with great picture and features
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: this TV is amazing, before buying this TV i was using Samsung Smart TV UN46EH5300 which we had to sell during our out of state.  i was looking for an alternate TV which can give me the sameviewing experience but this time i was looking for a TV with much smaller budget. i was not so keen on buying a TV which had built in Wifi as i had provision for directly using Ethernet cable for connecting my TV to internet.i found this TV on Amazon and going by the number of Reviews and i thought this TV met my requirement and also was within my budget.its been now two week since we purchased this TV and so far we are very much impressed with the quality of this TV.Picture quality is excellent, i must admit that the default setting which came with TV was not so good and with default settings movies looked horrible. as many of people had already told about this on there reviews i knew about it and changed the settings based on values suggested by fellow reviewers.Viera Apps are great, NetFlix, YouTube YuppTV,Pandora works really great. all Apps are fast and have good user interface.NetFlix in particular which we use heavily is quite quick and UI interface is good,  feature of automatically playing next episode from series is great. my old Samsung Smart tv somehow had not so great NetFlix experience and often had connectivity issues with netflix due to some strange issue TV Date/Time issue. Panasonic TV App for NetFlix is very easy to use.i highly recommend this TV to others.

Reviews.Title: Gorgeous TV
Reviews.Author: unclespoon
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be happier with this purchase.  I've never paid over $500 for a TV, and for that price, this absolutely blows away all the other TV's I've owned.  The design is sharp, the picture is crisp, and the connection options are great.  I even have it plugged into my router so I can access Netflix and other apps without having to purchase the wireless adapter.What a great TV!

Reviews.Title: What a TV
Reviews.Author: deputydan
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace a DLP tv. I already had a Panasonic Plasma and I love the picture quality on it. That made my natural choice another Panasonic. Amazon had a great pre super bowl price and I bought it. Set the picture controls to Cinema, and in the advance setting 'MOTION PICTURE SETTINGS' to "OFF".  This will take care of the cheap look they refer to as SOAP OPERA EFFECT.This tv has plenty of options for connections, even connect by digital camera and ply pics and videos on it.

Reviews.Title: Does what it says on the tin
Reviews.Author: Adelie Manchot
Reviews.Content: I am breaking this review into sections.Amazon service: The order for this TV got lost in the shuffle somewhere between Amazon and UPS. This is the first time ever that I have had a shipping error in over 10 years as an Amazon customer. When I observed that the order had not moved after two days I called Amazon, explained the situation and they apologized profusely, cancelled the original order, wrote a new order and sent it next day air free of charge. Not only that they also monitored the whole shipping process, sent me emails confirming its location for every step on the way to ensure that everything went as it should and it arrived when it should have, too. Fantastic effort and fantastic customer service!The TV:First of all I will mention that I am using this TV to watch video, not gaming or anything else of that nature. I dumped my cable TV service a month after I bought a Roku box a couple years ago so I cannot speak on how well it works with cable/satellite TV systems. You are on your own there. My computers all run Windows 7 so if you are using Apple products you are on your own there, too.It was a breeze to set up and connect. Took me all of 20 minutes from opening the box to having it fully functional. I did have all my componets ready to be hitched up to it though.-if you do not have those prepared beforehand it will take you a bit longer.1. Picture quality: I have a very bright living room-one wall is all windows. The picture is bright and crisp in full daylight with my blinds/curtains at their normal positions-I did not close them. Yes, there is some reflection but it is not as bad as some make it out to be. I did not have to make any adjustments whatsoever from the factory defaults to enhance the picture quality. Very little to no pixilation-the only noticeable pixilation I observed was in running "The Hobbit' off of Amazon Prime and it was for a few seconds on the scene where they were zoomed in on the map and that was VERY minor. Considering the manner which the movie was shot I had expected this and expected more pixilation but there was none after that. I am well pleased.2. Audio quality: I have a 14x17 foot living room and the sound quality is excellent. Mind you, if you are expecting the same audio quality and loudness as a $1,000/1,000 watt home theatre system out of the TV's built in speakers you will be a bit disappointed but you are a fool if you expected that in the first place. My brother in law was here and we had to jack up the audio so he could hear it (he is deaf in one ear) and at 50% he could hear everything along with scaring the bejabbers out of the pets and making my sister and I deaf. I set the TV to 20% and my sister and I could hear everything just fine. I did not have to change any of the settings from the factory defaults.3. VIERA Connect and Internet: Had absolutely NO problems connecting. My modem/router sits right under the TV on the TV stand so instead of buying the Wi-Fi dongle I hooked it up using an Ethernet cable. Hulu/Netflix/Amazon Prime streaming works as it should. YouTube app via VIERA connect works smoothly and the picture quality is excellent even on videos that I know are 360p maximum quality. The 1080p YouTube videos are crisp, sharp and as they should be. BTW The YouTube sync app works with Kindle Fire HD. Pandora and all the other apps work as they should. The only complaint I have with VIERA connect is that they do not have the selection that Roku has but that is to be expected and am sure it will get better with time.3. Roku Box: I already owned a Roku LT box before buying this TV-it is the low end one that only cranks out 720p. I had an old Sony Wega so needed no more than that. I hitched it up using an HDMI cable and my only complaint with it is that the video level seems to be a bit low but not unwatchable-audio is fine. Considering that everything else looks fine I figure that it is a problem with the Roku box and not the TV. I intend to upgrade to Roku 3 because I am giving my old TV/Roku box to a friend. I am sure once I upgrade that problem will be solved. BBC world service does look a bit funky but am guessing that it is because it is being converted from PAL to NTSC-it is watchable, though.4. USB/SD: I have many videos on my computer that I wanted to watch on my TV which is part of the reason why I bought this particular TV. Most of these videos are in .flv (flash) or MP4. Some of the programs I have are segmented because I edited out the commercials and before I got this TV I used to watch them on my computer using RealPlayer. These videos were already organized into individual folders on my computer and I highly suggest you do the same if you intend watching video on this TV from a USB device otherwise you will be wading through alot of 'stuff' to find your pony ifyouknowwhatimean. I loaded all of them up on a 32 gig USB stick and plugged the stick into the TV. Worked flawlessly but I did have to rename some of the programs in order to make them easier to sort. The segmented programs already existed in their individual folders and will play in sequence if you turn off the autorepeat feature in the menu.I also loaded up a bunch of pictures/music (in their own folders) and tried out the slideshow function. Worked as it should but for some reason it will not show some of the pictures even though they are all .jpeg. I think this might be because of the way some of them are named so I am going to try renaming some of them. Will edit this review to let you know if that worked. Another point is that even though the slideshow function will randomize the pictures it will not randomize the music-it plays the music in the order it was loaded onto the stick. If you want to have the music to be 'random' instead of playing entire albums create your own 'random' order when loading the music into its folder.5. DVD player: Works as it should. The Sony 5 DVD carousel player is hitched up with an HDMI cable, the Magnavox DVD burner is hitched up with composite video/audio cables using the adapter provided by Panasonic. Most of the DVD's I have are of old movies/TV programs that were not produced in anything that resembles HD thus there really is no reason to buy them on Blue Ray even if I could get them on Blue Ray. I really do not intend to buy a Blue Ray player because I will just buy the digital downloads of the movies I want and either watch them off of the cloud or load them up onto stick drives or SD cards. BTW the 3:2 pulldown works as intended.6. Computer: I have a Toshiba Satellite laptop that I am using with this TV. it is connected using an HDMI cable though I can throw video/pictures etc. to the TV via my home network. I am not using that function because I loaded all that stuff on the USB stick plugged into the TV and using the TV's software to run them. The main function the computer is being used for is to watch BBC and ITV programs from their websites using either BBC iPlayer or ITV Player. Video and audio is broadcast standard. I am thinking of getting a wireless keyboard and using it to browse the internet but (at the moment) I do not really think I would use that much. If I am doing gaming or heavy internet usage I will just use my computer set up in my computer room.Overall impression: I would buy this TV again in a heartbeat. it does everything I want it to and more.

Reviews.Title: An excellent TV that falls slightly short of its potential
Reviews.Author: Gabe
Reviews.Content: First, let me say straight of the bat that this is a really excellent TV. Panasonic really made it not only beautiful to the eye, but easy to set up and use. The second I took it out of the box, I was amazed by how thin it was.I'm going to break this down piece by piece:Packaging.It came in a very compact box, but had enough protection that I was sure it could never be damaged in shipping unless it was dropped from a building. It comes with all the standard things you would expect - remote, batteries for the remote (Panasonic brand of course), a full manual, a quick-start guide, a cable for attaching component cables, and even a large, reusable ziptie for cable management. Not shabby.Setup.Could not have been much easier. There was a little bit of confusion as to which screws go where, but with a little common sense you can figure it out. It took about 5 minutes to have the TV completely assembled.Picture.Absolutely stunning. The refresh rate appears to actually be much faster than 60Hz, since I get the soap opera effect. (SOE). I actually prefer the smooth motions, but if you don't then you can change the picture to GAME mode, and it will look "normal".
