The viewing angles are great - the colors looks true at ANY angle (which is what an IPS panel advertises).Sound.Not the best. But it is affections for the average consumer. I personally think I shouldn't have to be at the 80-90% range of max volume to hear clearly. Obviously I will have to be pairing this TV with a sound system to have any respectable sound. I'm not exactly dissatisfied with the sound, mainly because the TV is so thin that I understand how the sound can't really be that good.Internet Capabilities / SMART TV.Okay, so here is one of the places where this TV fell short for me. First of all, it does not have wi-fi built in, it is WiFi READY. Meaning that you have to either purchase an expensive proprietary wifi dongle, OR hook up an ethernet cable from your cable box to the TV (if you even have a box capable of doing it...I have U-Verse and was able to do it). I even tried plugging in my Xbox wifi dongle to the USB port in the TV and it did not work. Bummer. But it did work with an ethernet cable. However, even though it is plugged in with an ethernet, the TV will STILL run an internet test every time you want to access the internet features like Netflix. Very annoying waste of time. Netflix works great though, and did I mention it has a dedicated Netflix button on the remote?One last gripe about the internet capabilities - Skype. I was excited about the concept of using video chat on my TV at first. But quickly realized it wasn't going to work. I have one of the most common webcams in the world from Logitech, and when I plug it in, Skype says they cannot recognize it. Not sure if it is my fault, but I'm not going to put myself through a headache just to get a picture for skype.So again, the TV is excellent overall. I'm extremely pleased with my purchase, and would not trade it for any other TV, UNLESS it came with built-in WiFi and wireless speakers.

Reviews.Title: Have had no problem at all so far
Reviews.Author: gs
Reviews.Content: Some people have expressed disappointment with product quality, but I have had no issues at all. I readily admit to not being an over the top person needing new electronics all the time as they are developed, but this is far superior to the older 22 inch HDTV I had had for a few years. And initially, I was a bit concerned that its picture quality was not quite vivid enough for my tastes, but the built-in trouble shooter was simple to call up on-screen and follow directions to get the picture quality exactly as I wanted it to be. So no problems so far.*UPDATE* Still quite happy with the TV....no follow-up issues after several months either. However, originally I set it up to play through a fairly simple but good quality home theater system, so I was not aware of how the TV speakers sounded. Sound was so good that, for the first time in 8 years living in my upstairs apartment, my neighbor downstairs complained she could hear the TV, and wasn't too happy about it. If nothing else, I am a considerate neighbor, and now use the TV speakers for the majority of viewing, and only use the home theater system certain times. And yes, I agree the TV speakers are fairly weak, as many others have commented. It is okay for me, since it is a smaller apartment, and to keep peace in the building, but it might be a considerable disappointment for others. But still am really enjoying picture quality on all levels, and consider it an excellent value. And yes, the packaging was not great, but UPS didn't do it any favors in delivery. Maybe I got the UPS guy that threw that Christmas package over the fence into the yard last Dec...:)

Reviews.Title: GREAT PICTURE
Reviews.Author: Margie M Preston
Reviews.Content: The picture is great.  Unfortunately mine (used) was a bit more scratched and dented up than I expected and it was missing critical screws.  I purchased the missing screws from a local hardware store.  To my less than favorable review, the seller stated that they would have replaced the screws if I had notified them--but who had a week to wait to see if the darn thing would play.  Talk about closing the barn door after the horse ran away.  Dare I suggest the seller should have performed a quality check, to ensure all promised parts were included--before shipping!!  Who would have thought the customer's needs include the convenience of watching the game (Superbowl) on the new console.  The seller's response included "that was why the TV was discounted" Really? ?...while reasonable priced, it wasn't that discounted...buyer beware of this sellerll

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Dhawal Parekh
Reviews.Content: Overall a very nice product and everything as advertised. Took away one star as have to buy a wireless panasonic connector extra for it to connect to the internet. That $60 piece should be included or mentioned.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: AL
Reviews.Content: Bought the 55 inch off amazon, because after a lot of research on the current led smart tv market this stood out as the best deal out there at the time. Tried to get Best Buy to price match it and they wouldn't do it. They said Amazon undercuts the prices too much, they actually said that i should just buy it off Amazon for that price (849.99 + free ship). So I went ahead and ordered it even though i was a little worried about the shipping. When it arrived though it was in perfect condition powered up and worked flawlessly.Pros - Picture is great! Probably the best you can ask for in a led/lcd. Smart TV Apps all work fine although the Netflix app's interface is a little less impressive than Xbox's. But either way it still works fine. Viera Link is an awesome feature. I hooked up my Sony Home theater system to it via a single HDMI cable and the TV automatically recognized it, turned off it's internal speakers and allowed me to control the volume on the home theater system with the tv remote.Cons - Sound. Like with most super thin led tvs you're really gonna need at least a sound bar of some sort if you want to enjoy decent sound. Wireless, If you need Wifi you have to buy an adapter. This wasn't really a problem for me though as my router sits under the tv anyway, so i just ran an ethernet cable to it. No 3D if you want 3D (which I did not) then this is not for you.

Reviews.Title: Good tv for the price
Reviews.Author: john g waier
Reviews.Content: Experienced some issues with changing descriptions of item bought from when I bought it to when I received it and they changed again after I notified amazon. Everything has been straightened out I think. Ive been buying Panasonic brand stuff for 15 years and it's always good.  The description of the tv should be correct now. I am very satisfied with amazons service. Thanks.....I'll continue to buy here.

Reviews.Title: False advertising!!! until recently was advertised as 120Hz ...
Reviews.Author: IBS LTD
Reviews.Content: I bought quite few of these TVs and they do look great and have a decent image but they were advertised as 120Hz and now they are posted as 60Hz.I paid a lot of money on these TVs. The price is good if they were 120Hz but for 60Hz TVs I feel cheated and soured like I got LEMONS.Please Amazon, have the right description on the product next time.I think this false advertising is opening the door for a class action lawsuit. I got too many of these TVs and I will jump on this one.

Reviews.Title: Amazon previously listed this product at 120Hz, and i bought it believing that.
Reviews.Author: Chad Puckett
Reviews.Content: Pros:  Lots of neat features  The bezel is quite prettyCons:  Refresh rate was advertised falsely  Picture is only ok  Doesn't come with a wifi adapter  Still haven't been given my $100 credit by AmazonI bought this product for $530 with the promise of a $100 back promotional credit from amazon. I bought it immediately upon seeing it thinking it was a steal of a deal, and even bought a year of amazon prime since it was only a few dollars more than the shipping for it. Little did I know amazon had the refresh rate listed incorrectly. The picture on this tv is ok, nothing great, but it gives a horrible soap opera effect out of the box, you have to turn down the motionview setting to fix this. If i had wanted a 60 hz tv i would have just bought a cheap one from a local brick and mortar store. Now I'm stuck with a tv i wouldn't have bought knowing the real refresh rate, a year of amazon prime I would not have bought otherwise, and have yet to receive my $100 credit from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: One major flaw
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: The following comments were added on 4/25/14: as the title says: this TV has one major flaw. For some reason, Panasonic chose to put all of the HDMI jacks on the left side edge of the television. Because of this, they are constantly getting loose. After a year and a half of loosing picture and / or sound for a given source, I'm thinking of getting rid of it. Too bad because otherwise, it's a great TV.Here is my original review:I would be hard pressed to not rate this TV 5 Stars considering Amazon's super low price and free 2 day Prime shipping. The picture is beautiful (better than a Sony in another room), the design fabulous (border is shiny black with narrow-thin clear border, the setup is very easy, the controls are user-friendly, the built-in surround sound is crisp, and the overall quality is typical Panasonic excellent. All this for less money than you'd spend for an off brand 42" TV at the brick / mortar stores. And, with an Amazon Prime membership, delivered to your door in 2 days for free! Amazing.Aside from all this good stuff, I can report  3 minor issues. Be aware that this TV does NOT HAVE BUILT-IN Wi-Fi. It is pre-loaded with the Panasonic Viera internet apps but requires either a $50 Wi-Fi adapter or hard-wired Ethernet cable to connect to a network. The second issue is that all of the HDMI jacks are mounted on the side of the unit. Ergo, they tend to get loose on their own. Finally, there is only one component input for your non-HD devices. So, if you have an older dvd player and a VCR,  you're out of luck.These issues are all relatively minor, however, and do not detract from an overall great product.

Reviews.Title: Above and Beyond
Reviews.Author: Brandon J Tibbitts
Reviews.Content: I have been impressed with this TV since it's arrival.  Excellent picture (once configured) and excellent sound (again, once configured).  To address the sound issue, under audio settings, you can adjust the level of output.  Since doing so, I have been well pleased.  Internet access is very good, only the occassional flicker when watching netflix (and I have <5mbps internet speed).  Strongly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased With This TV, But Not So "Smart"
Reviews.Author: Poogy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Panasonic 42-inch LED TV after a trip to my local big box store, where I viewed an array of options.  Frankly, I didn't find that exercise too helpful except to educate me about pricing; the images themselves seemed very similar, after accounting for the different specifications and angles of view and settings, which can be changed at home.I also read reviews on Amazon and elsewhere for many of the TVs I was considering.  After reading one of the top reviews for this TV that described in extraordinary detail, continuing for dozens of comments, the unfortunate owner's nightmarish experience trying to fix the one he purchased, I was hesitant to buy it.  But there being so many positive reviews, and the price being one of the lowest for any name-brand TV with these specs, and Amazon offering free shipping to my location of this particular item (unlike most third-party venders selling some contenders), and Amazon (at least at the time) throwing in a hundred dollar credit, I decided to take the plunge.  So far, I'm glad I did.Delivery was on the day promised, only a few days after ordering.  I upgraded from an old CRT TV hooked up to a DVD player and a home theater using an analog cable signal.  It took me a couple of hours to unpack the screen, attach the base, and connect all of the wiring to allow use with a digital/HD cable box and DVD player.  The instructions were clear and straightforward.  I discovered that to play audio through my receiver for the home theater I needed an optical audio cable (because my receiver has no HDMI input), but those are available for a few dollars through Amazon, or for literally five times as much from Radio Shack.  Consolidating most--not all--functions into one universal remote took another few minutes, and then I was enjoying my new set-up.I tweaked the image settings somewhat, as much for the fun of it as for any real need.  I've noticed something another reviewer pointed out:  the "soap opera effect" with some movies.  Hard to describe what this looks like, but you'll probably know it when you see it, and I don't really like it--it looks like the program was created on cheap videotape instead of film.  This is common to many HDTVs, but one can get rid of it on this one by switching the image setting to "game." Otherwise, I find the picture great--crisp, clear, bright, colors balanced, no strange lines or lag or whatnot.  How does it look side by side with a Samsung?  I don't know, and I don't care.  It looks great and I'm happy with it.Next I ran a long ethernet cable from the TV to my router so I can stream Netflix, etc.; otherwise you'll need to buy a dongle so the TV will receive wi-fi signals, and depend on the strength of your wi-fi, which I don't care to.  The TV comes with apps for Netflix, Huluplus, Youtube, and others, and you can access them as soon as you make the hardwired or wi-fi connection.  However, entering a search one letter at a time using the on-screen interface and the remote is very slow and inconvenient (and I had no luck at all trying to use the Android apps that supposedly turn your smartphone into a remote).  I see now why people say that if you want to stream, don't bother with a "smart" TV or Blu-Ray player, get a Roku or Apple TV box for the interface.

Reviews.Title: Superb quality, great as a PC monitor
Reviews.Author: Comp Expert "Comp"
Reviews.Content: Been using my set for a few days now and can suffice to say that you're getting a quality product here, unlike much of the no-name junk brands being sold today.  No high pitched whining noises, artifacting, bleeding, or any weird things that start to happen with the off-brands.  I primary wanted my 55" set to serve as a PC monitor from my couch lounging so I could primarily surf the web and use my PC as the media server (the best type of media server, hands down).  As anyone knows, text quality on tv sets are not quite the same as text quality on a true PC monitor.  That is, until I found this set.  The quality is right there up with the top standards.  Easy to read, no strange colors or excessive blinding brightness that hurts your eyes after reading the screen for a few minutes.Off-angle viewing is wildly awesome - I am honestly sitting at about 150 degrees out and there's no color shifts or anything like that - a true test of the real world strength of an IPS panel.  You're paying for that here folks and it throws back the results to you.There are really no cons with this set - it does have Internet connectivity with an ethernet cord.  The options are a little sparse compared to other set-top devices but as I use my PC, none of this matters, and one can get a really cheap Roku box very inexpensively these days if you do not have a PC hookup but want far expanded Internet streaming options.  As for sound - true, it's not loud and pretty basic but that only means they spent less money on speakers and instead threw it into the visuals.  Tons of external soundbars out there, and this unit supports HDMI audio out with the VierraLink speakers so a big plus there too for simplified setup.Overall, like the old saying of You get what you pay for - this holds true here in the positive light.

Reviews.Title: Could I complain? Yes, but...
Reviews.Author: John L. Guest "Honest John"
Reviews.Content: Conclusions first:I would rate this as a 4.x star, but it is a darn good unit with a huge array of features for the money.One can nitpick almost any of the features for this unit, but I feel it would be just that. It is a huge screen for not much cash, and would be hard to beatI'd recommend this unit as a spectacular value for those wanting lots of features, a very nice picture and sound, and internet options.Some background:Finally LED-backlit LCD panels dropped to a price level I felt was acceptable. As implied by my nickname, I'm of the generation that doesn't pay for tv and I will admit that, as my eyesight weakens, the detail available in today's fine sets is somewhat wasted. Nonetheless after reading many reviews and watching over the last year or two, it was time for me to make the leap, and I selected this unit from among quite a few.I wanted to cut my electric bill.. I admit that, though I don't pay much attention to it most of the time, my tv is on much of the day and night.. so I thought I'd do a bit of my part for the environment and get rid of my huge, old analog crt tv that probably consumes on the order of 300 watts and additionally has a digital tuner that I bought when tv switched to digital a few years ago. This one uses a max of about 52 watts! Also, I thought a "real digital tuner" rather than the "add-on" for my old analog tv might give better reception.The purchase and setup experience:The purchase experience was wonderful as I have come to expect from Amazon. The set arrived in about three days. The box was a bit banged up, but the tv was in fine condition. I fumbled my way through the assembly and setup in about an hour (recall my eyesight is marginal).I had a bit of a problem finding a few of the parts.. be sure to CAREFULLY examine all the Styrofoam pieces and packing.. the parts are scattered throughout the packing material, not in a central bag or pack... Some was even taped to the inside of the box..  only a minor problem, just be aware.I hooked my antennae (remember, FREE TV!) and plugged in the set.. scanned channels and had it working. It was frankly beautiful..Next I hooked up my Ethernet (I did not buy a wireless connection for it) and briefly checked out the internet offerings. The tv updated it's software automatically as soon as it recognized the connection.I signed up for the "Amazon" network .. this was easy .. took maybe three minutes. Their free offerings are pretty lame, but I was doing it only to check out the internet experience. It was quite a nice result even if the navigation is a bit clunky .. not bad though. Once the movie or whatever is "online", all is well.Detail Overview:Pluses-Excellent 42inch picture at a very reasonable price.-Allows direct internet access.  For the "standard services" it seems fine. It is preconfigured for a large list of services for video, tv, games, etc-The internet (DLNA) connection also allows the tv to be a member of your home network, and therefore to act as a streaming object for music, video, pictures, or recorded tv programs (ie. from a TiVo-type device)-allows excellent connectivity with 4 HDMI inputs, a composite (vcr, etc), a direct pc input (DVI or use one of the HDMI) and of course an antennae/cable connection (coaxial cable)-2 USB connects and a card reader (microSDHC, etc) for reading from your camera videos or pictures or from files loaded onto a USB device. Some of the interfaces require alphanumeric inputs. A USB keyboard can be connected for these or the remote works with the "multi-punch" inputs like many non-qwerty cellphones use. A mouse isn't recognized.-I find that the I/O is reasonably placed with appropriate I/O on back or side to meet most needs-Offers a range of picture "modes" for movie, game-play (low lag) and custom setups for those picky about color setup-The remote is well laid-out with most buttons logically placed. (I have some minor complaints .. see later)-Has various timer modes including on/off at times and channels as you select and a feature I like that turns the tv off if for some reason it has no input for 10 minutes or if no one uses an interface for three hours (for example if you fall asleep watching it) And it has the normal "sleep" after x minutes.-Has nice options for those who need/want closed caption.. for example CC if you mute, control of text size, contrast, etc for the captions, language options, and of course various SAP options-The sound.. very competent for a tv..  I typically watch from my dining room while the set is in the living room and it is plenty loud with good sound... anyone wanting more would buy add-on units anyways. Connection is optical.-Viewing angles are quite acceptable.-A feature I very much appreciate (weak eyesight) is being able to get manuals and quick start documents online from the Panasonic website in pdf form which allows me to magnify the text and illustrations for much better visibility.-I think the set is quite attractive. Off, it is a large black rectangle framed in a thin Lucite-like rim. On, it has a thin, black frame around the picture with the Lucite-like edge and a single, red LED showing power on at the bottom.  The only other things on the front are the remote and C.A.T.S. sensors (not really visible). The power on light is clearly visible, but doesn't distract from the picture (to me)-The screen seems to be very low reflectance which is nice as that would distract from the pictureMinuses-The brightness does seem to  be a challenge for me.. I would love to use the "C.A.T.S." which is supposed to auto-adjust brightness and contrast as your room light changes, but it is just inadequate.. especially as it doesn't balance for light behind the tv (ie a window or whatever). It might be fine if you wall-mount it, but I didn't try that. Instead I have to adjust the contrast, brightness, or backlight now and then.. not difficult, but does require navigation through several buttons each time.-The remote requires detailed entry for channel navigation.. this is annoying. My old remote acted like your browser which would fill in options as you type and you could hit enter anytime saving a LOT of button pushing. As an example you have only one channel starting with a "2".. enter the 2 and that was all needed as it auto-completed the only entry.. or if you had 4 channels that started with a "3".. when you put the "3" in an onscreen menu would appear and you could "arrow" up or down to the one you wanted. This remote has little on-screen help and you must laboriously type every digit.edit: If you have selected a list of "favorites", the favorites button will call up a list of those and you may arrow up/down or punch the number of the item on the list (3 pages, 0-9 up to 30 channels) This does help.-The "info" given for my old tv adapter would show program info for current and next program across all channels.. this is only for current and only the one being watched.. this forces me to consult a tv listing a lot more than I had to before.. an inconvenience-The remote "cursor control" is surrounded with other buttons and in the dark by feel it is easy to hit wrong buttons.. seems this could have been more ergonomically done-Remote is not lighted in any way-The set on the back, right side has manual "input, channel up/down, volume up/down and power on/off buttons. If your remote isn't working or you're standing by the set, I suppose you could use these.. They are "blind".. i.e. you can't see them from the front, but have to go by feel. They also are a good hand's reach in from the edge. When you touch one, it puts a menu un the screen, near the buttons (they don't line up however!.. lol) Would be usable in a pinch, though; and I expect that's just what they're for.-It would be nice if some kind of elementary browser were built in.. given that even cell-phones do this now, it doesn't seem to ask muchFinally, with respect to my objectives, I'll be saving over 4kw-hrs PER DAY on electric (about $12 a month) and have a very flexible, enjoyable tv as well. The government "Energy Guide" says $11 annually. Oh, the tuner is rather better than the old add-on unit too.

Reviews.Title: Great TV; Lousy company
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "G. Babcock"
Reviews.Content: For the TV itself, I rate it a 5 star.  I give Amazon 5 stars for overnight shipping.  For the price it has an excellent picture.However, there is a reason that Panasonic is on the ropes as a company.  Here are two reasons.1. Packing of the TV could have been done better a kinder-gardener.  I was warned by other reviewers that the packing was poor.  It is almost non-existent.  So, while it is a great TV, it is hit or miss as to whether it will arrive in tact.  I have PRIME, and being forewarned, I ordered one-day shipping as I figured the fewer times it had to be handled by the shipper the better.  I hardily recommend one-day shipping if you are still willing to take the chance with a TV that will be rattling around inside the packaging when received.2. The power cord was missing.  The box was completely in tact, so the factory missed putting in the power cord.  No biggie, except that I am dealing with a company that is in dire straights.  The customer service Rep was so paranoid that I would be trying to steal a power cord from them that she went through a very thorough security type of investigation into whether I was a legitimate owner.  Was I the real owner of the TV?  Was it mine rather than a gift? What was the serial number (on the back of a wall mounted TV - unmount TV retrieve serial number, remount TV)?  Oh, too new to be a real serial number. Can I send in the receipt?  We are talking a 1 hour process to receive the power cord that was not in the box.  Then I was told that it would 4-6 weeks to receive the power cord.  So much for having my TV in time for Christmas.  What I should have done and may still do is buy the power cord from Amazon for $4.50 with two day shipping.You need to be a bit of a risk taker to buy this otherwise excellent TV.

Reviews.Title: Great picture limited inputs
Reviews.Author: Richard Graves "photo reader"
Reviews.Content: This set was easy to assemble and get running.  It has a very heavy duty stand which holds it very well on a cabinet.  The picture is very good but their are not many controls over it, so what you get is it.  The inputs on the back are fine if all you have are HDMI devices.  You can input ONE composite video OR ONE straight video out device at a time.  The device you connect for this is not marked as to what goes into the five connectors.  You have to look carefully at the wire paring into the plug on the tv side to see who is audio and who is video.

Reviews.Title: Love this Panasonic
Reviews.Author: AKN
Reviews.Content: Wow what a great picture!  I am a photographer, and I notice when things aren't right with a picture.  In particular, I notice when blacks aren't really a true black in a television screen.  Here is what I am seeing when watching this television:Once I had this set up and all adjustments properly made on it, I can see perfect brightness, saturation, contrast and sharpness of colors.  Colors are vivid but not overly loud as they can be on some other well known brands, that oversaturate.  In particular, I notice skin tones and faces. The skin tones are soft and natural looking without any uneven or harsh areas.Many televisions have a blurring that occurs when watching a movie.  Panasonic has corrected that tendency here by smoothing images out with additional frames.  Panasonic says it displays images with 96 frames instead of the original source 24-frame sequence.  I can tell you, it works.  There is zero blur while watching movies on this set.As far as aesthetics goes, this is a pretty television.  It is basic looking, uncluttered, and does not seem to pick up fingerprints easily.  The stand is attractive and unobtrusive.  It has a matte black screen when off so that it doesn't pick up glare from our bright sunny room that we have it in, which was important to me.I love this set and it is delivering a great picture and movie watching experience.  I have always loved Panasonic and this set it perfect. I'm very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Product great but packaging lacking!
Reviews.Author: Joe L. Welsh
Reviews.Content: The television works great but the packaging was short two critical screws required to fasten the TV to its base.  I had to go to 2 different stores to find screws that would work.  A little more attention to this small detail would have saved me a lot of time.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality, average sound
Reviews.Author: Jerry Y
Reviews.Content: The quality of the picture is great, though it might take you a while to find you the color and tone you want, but it has them all so no worry about the picture quality. However the sound quality isn't that satisfying. You might want to set up your theater stereo to balance that. Overall it is a good quality HDtv indeed.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, less than exemplary support
Reviews.Author: Colton Finch
Reviews.Content: I finally decided to buckle down and purchase an HDTV, and after reading a lot of reviews and doing a lot of research I decided on the Panasonic VIERA series. It isn't a perfect device, but it isn't a poor purchase either.Good:1) The picture quality is excellent. I will admit forthrightly that I am not an audio/video junkie. I would be hard pressed to talk about the depths of black and how vibrant colors appear, but for my part, I like the picture.2) It communicates with my home theater (also by Panasonic) very well, as it should.3) It is well-built, with a metal stand and back panel.Bad:1) I don't know if this is the fault of Panasonic, Amazon, or FedEx, but the tv arrived with a dent in the ventilation screen in the back. Not going to affect performance, and it is on the back so you can only see it when you are arranging cables, etc, but after paying this much money for a brand new television it would be nice if it arrived in new condition.2) There are no optical cable hookups. I have a Nintendo wii, and I can't use it because the television only has a plethora (x4) of HDMI ports. I had to buy an HDMI converter to use my wii with this television (which hasn't arrived from Amazon yet, so I don't even know if it will work). You'd think they could include at least one port to connect the little white/red/yellow cables that come from older devices like VCRs, the wii, etc.3) The sound from the television itself isn't on par with the picture. This was complicated by the fact that it took me a while and some frustration before I figured out how to get the sound to play through my home theater (make sure the HDMI cable for the player is plugged in the second HDMI port on the tv that says "ARC" underneath it). Again, my home theater negates this, but if you don't have one or you can't figure out how to work it at first, you get less than awesome sound.Overall, I don't regret my purchase, and it was nice to not have to figure out how to get it home from the store and/or get hassled by the people trying to up-sell their expensive featured junk at a brick-and-mortar store.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality but some minor disappointments
Reviews.Author: DevilSmith
Reviews.Content: This TV has great picture quality, it is thin, elegant, and easy to use. However, in order to connect it to a Wifi network, one needs to buy a specialized USB device that enables the connection. Also, my TV is connected to a home-teather system that has Dolby Surround 5.1. When playing a video that doesn't support 5.1 through my PS3, there is no sound. I am almost positively sure that it is related to the TV, since my older TV was able to adjust the sound automatically.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic l42E50
Reviews.Author: Rasmaxwell
Reviews.Content: Congratulations to Panasonic for making an LED HDTV with very good picture quality and black levels.  The picture quality is not quite as deep and smooth as their top line plasmas, nonetheless it still is a very good HDTV.  I own 2 Panasonic plasmas and this LED HDTV, and I expect all of them to last longer than a Samsung or LG flat panel.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality!
Reviews.Author: Jerry Unger
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my 10 year old big screen (47")rear projection TV. I was a little apprehensive to buy such a big item from Amazon.com, and to have it delivered. When it came, it was just left at the door. There was a rather nasty hole/gash from shipping. However, there was no damage to the TV inside. This TV is so much crisper and clearer than my old one. The wife has commented several times on how sharp the images are. The older black and white TV shows really pop. The sound is on the weak side(probably a common deficiency with newer TV's)...it sounds monotone. I do have a surround sound system to use during movies though. Set up was very easy and quick. Bonuses...I won't have anymore repair costs to a convergence board (my old TV), and with an Energy Guide estimate of only $11/yr, I think this one will pay for itself before it needs replacing. I'm very happy with the purchase which was during a promotional period (May-June 2012) where Amazon.com sold it for $699. On top of that, I got a $100 credit to my Amazon.com account.

Reviews.Title: Excellent choice
Reviews.Author: lrmartinez
Reviews.Content: I decided to get this Tv because I really like Panasonic Viera Tvs. I received it on two (02) days. Based on what I need and my budget It was the best choices

Reviews.Title: Great tv @ a great price. No problems with Packaging or Delivery
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Just got the Panasonic VIERA TC-L47E50 47-Inch 1080p Full HD IPS LED-LCD TV on sale direct from amazon for $759 (June 13, 2012). It was delivered by UPS with no damage to the outer box or the tv insisde. A small strip of non critical syrofoam had broken lose with the remote lose at the bottom of the box but the TV and remote were left unscaved. No amount of styrofoam or cushioning can protect a package or it's contents from shippers and delivery personal that don't take pride in their job.I'm really happy with this set and the price was great. I don't need or want 3D so spending more for that isn't something I was interested in doing.I haven't seen any flashlighting or clouding on my set. The Motion Processing can be adjusted in the Picture > Advanced picture > Motion Picture Setting and set to; Off, Weak, Medium and Strong. Personally I think the SOE is quite hilarious as it almost completely changes your perspective on what you are watching. It makes scripted movie like dramas look like a reality or Soap Opera series. Compared to my 5 year old Sammy the black levels and Constrast are great. Scenes that would otherwise be too dark and hard to view are clear as day and can be seen as they were intended.I have the TV connected to my PC using ICS to share the Internet Connection. The Netflix App is great as it lets me access and add items to my Instant Queue and is comparable to the Xbox 360 Netflix App. Updating the firmware for the tv was quite easy and can be done from the Menu.I've had no issues using the remote in the dark as button positions are quite easy to memorize.A great tv for a great price. No regrets.

Reviews.Title: Best TV ever.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I use this TV for watching TV and playing video games. It looks great at all angles (which is what the IPS is advertised as doing). Games look and play great. Thanks Panasonic for putting out awesome products and thanks Amazon for running great deals!

Reviews.Title: Great if you don't watch or play dark things.
Reviews.Author: Tim Henry
Reviews.Content: I took a gamble and chose the Amazon reviewers' opinions over the CNET nay-sayers and my unit arrived today. It's a mixed bag, in my opinion. I have the following to say, starting with the good news first.Pros:-Compared to other models I've looked at in this size/price range, this thing has the most inputs. 4 HDMI, 2 USB, SD, coax, ethernet, even a VGA. It only has one split-personality component/composite jack, but that's par for the course these days.-One I fiddled with the settings, I agree with the Amazon folks. Bright and colorful things look bright, colorful, and sharp.-You can have multiple picture presets. Being able to separate my game settings from Roku settings is a great thing.-Soap Opera Effect is fully adjustable between the aforementioned presets. Never fear.-There's an easy setup process that it mercifully allows you to skip if you're not using Smart TV features.Cons:-Absolutely atrocious black levels and backlight bleeding (or pressure marks maybe?) from the corners during dark scenes. Turning the energy saving mode to "Saving" and turning the backlight down even further helps quite a bit. The uneven blacks reminds me of the "fog" those old rear-projection TVs generated. Not a deal breaker, but I'm not happy about it.-The presets that come with the TV are garbage, adjust them before passing judgement. It does get better.-The shiny glossy screen finish is annoying if you have windows in the room.-The packaging was terrible. The box looked like it'd been dragged around and punched. The punch damage was on the screen side, but thankfully the blow didn't connect with the TV inside the box. I do have a couple of dents in the back of my unit, but I don't think the internals were harmed.Not cons, but you should be aware of these and prepare accordingly:-This is a Smart TV, but NO WIFI. From what I can tell from other reviews, the built in apps suck anyway. Buy a Roku, it's the same price as a wifi dongle for this TV and probably has better features.-No analog audio output for my old stereo system (optical only), but again, I think that's par for the course. Crisis averted: I bought a $30 DAC that converts the optical jack to the RCA I need. Just make sure you pick stereo mode, not Dolby/surround on your appliances. Analog input from my Wii passes through the digital out just fine, in case you were worried about that.-I am not taking the built-in sound into consideration. I just assumed a flat panel would sound crappy and immediately routed to my stereo receiver.Conclusion:If I were to do it all again, I would see if there was another model with a better picture in the same price range. I have a feeling a plasma would've been the better choice. The biggest flaw is the cloudy blacks. It's terrible, but it's really not worth returning it over. The TV is great otherwise. If you love bright pictures no matter what the cost, this TV is super bright and will fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: Bang for the buck!!
Reviews.Author: mineswap
Reviews.Content: Buying a LED/LCD TV was a big deal for me and much of my confusion was whether to go for a: LCD or an LED TV 60 Hz or 120 HzThe cost of the TV was also a major factor in making a decision and I was stuck between taking a LCD/120 Hz or an LED/60 Hz which comes to about the same price. This was when I came across the deal in Amazon for the "Panasonic VIERA TC-L42E50 42-Inch 1080p Full HD IPS LED-LCD TV" and the great reviews for this model. I went for the deal, blindly believing in the reviews and I was not disappointed. The following are its standout features:1. LED screen with IPS panel: The TV is quite slim and the picture clarity is awesome right out of the box. Because of the IPS panel, you can watch it from a wide angle without any loss of clarity.2. Viera Connect: Though the TV does not support wifi connectivity, just connect a ethernet cable and you are all set. Netflix, Amazon Prime, Huluplus come right out of the box. You can also configure Facebook, Twitter and Google Picasa. Just login to Picasa and you can watch all your photo albums right on TV. You wouldn't need a Roku/Apple TV.3. Sound: The sound is powerful enough for a small living room unless you want your eardrums to break. If you are an audiophile and look for a theater effect, then I suggest you buy a separate sound system. Otherwise, the default sound will suffice.4. 120 Hz: Seriously, this is one of the most overrated features of TVs these days. The TV is set to run at 120 Hz right out of the box, and you can actually notice the difference - the soap opera effect. So, I actually turned it off. Maybe you might need it for sports and animated movies. But other than that, you wouldn't need it at all.It gives you a great picture [but not exceptional], great Internet connectivity [but not wifi]. All in all, this TV is a good worth for the money you invest if you don't expect the world in return.

Reviews.Title: Simply Wonderful
Reviews.Author: vrpj
Reviews.Content: Read the other reviews for comments on the Way above average picture. They cover it all very well. This HDTV is amazing for the money. Far superior to every Samsung I considered. I bought the 47-inch model and added the WiFi dongle. The Hulu Plus, Netflix, and Amazon Prime apps work very well. I hooked up my 1080 Apple TV and our Blu-ray player. But with all the digital options these days, I think the player will be gathering dust. I plan to rip our DVDs and Blu-rays and sell the little silver discs (along with our CDs, thanks to iTunes Match).Honestly, this unit is just a placeholder until Apple ships their Apple TV HDTV (this Fall, please Apple). Then this baby moves to the bedroom. Oh, and I don't need 3D. It's a gimmick. Get rid of the glasses and get back to me, Hollywood.Read the other reviews and don't hesitate to buy.

Reviews.Title: need a lot of accessories
Reviews.Author: T. Wu
Reviews.Content: First of all the TV quality is good. Nothing to complain right now. Probably the brightness is not super high.I was more interested in many fancy technologies it provides when I decided to purchase.However, to make full use of these it cost much more to get the accessories.The wifi capability requires a adapter, which only 1 or 2 can work and costs around $60.The skype app requires external cam, otherwise it can not make or answer a call, even the pure audio call!The compatible cam only comes from panasonic, which costs like $130.And if you want to connect to external sound system, the digital audio output port is kind of unique.I have not figured out how to get a audio output adapter yet.I believe the marketing strategy of Panasonic is to get more profit from the accessories rather than the TV itself.So do consider these aspects when you make the decision!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic - Totally Satisfied!
Reviews.Author: Gentle_Ben
Reviews.Content: I haven't been this satisfied with a TV purchase in a long time.I watched the price on this TV and purchased when I saw it drop.  It is the perfect size for the application I have it in.I am very impressed with the installed software like YouTube, Netflix and a few others, but what really impressed me was the DLNA software which allowed me to access all of the files on my media server.  I have hardware on my other TV's used specifically for this task, and this TV handles it far better and faster.I have 3 Panasonic VIERA TV's in my house now, and I don't think I will be changing to any other brands, these TV's are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: I am very pleased with my TV. I only wish that I had bought the next bigger size.
Reviews.Author: Four eye Tex
Reviews.Content: I have just finished watching many hours of the Olympics. I watch 3-5 hours a day, which I can do because I am retired.Even though my TV has 720p resolution much of the time rather than the 1080p as it is supposed to have, the picture is very sharp even with fast-moving sports. I think that the LED-LCD accounts for this.My TV sits on a stand and does not hang on the wall. I use wireless headphones for stereo sound because I live in an apartment and do not wish to bother my neighbors. The sound, through the headphones, is excellent.I do have a Blu-Ray player and this TV will play them flawlessly.I have nothing to complain about regarding this TV. I have other Panasonic things and they also work very well. I am well pleased except for the size of the screen. I determined that and not Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Defective TV, display panel problems after only 18 months of operation.
Reviews.Author: A. Frank
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV in July 2012. It was working fine for 18 months when suddenly horizontal lines began forming on the screen and the picture started freezing, although the sound worked correctly. The online Panasonic support, they had me do a hard reset on the TV, which did not work. Then, I hired a local company to do come to my house (at my own expense, because it was out of warranty). The tech diagnosed the problem and said the entire display panel would need to be replaced. This is a huge expense and not worth it, I might as well junk the TV and buy a new one! However, the tech did call Panasonic and they said they would be able to replace the display panel because this a major problem and the warranty had only expired a few months ago. However, when I called Panasonic myself, they refused to do this and referred me to another authorized Panasonic service center, more than an hour away from my house! So I would have to pay another diagnostic fee, another repair fee, and the cost of the new display panel. Forget it, I am never buying another Panasonic product again. Their support is awful and they give you a different result each time you call.

Reviews.Title: The best TV !
Reviews.Author: Robert Guma
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic TV. It is simple, great definition, excellent connectivity, very good fit at any living or family room.

Reviews.Title: Best TV ever.
Reviews.Author: Ned Flanders "A left-handed Diddly-Doh! to yo...
Reviews.Content: I love this TV.  The video quality cannot be beat.  THe best thing I liked about it compared to other TVs is that it would keep up with me flicking through channels as fast as I could go.  You don't find that with many TVs.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey L Wyatt
Reviews.Content: Bought this tv from amazon warehouse used for few years now and it still is great.  No problems at all. Easy set up.

Reviews.Title: great picture quality
Reviews.Author: rogerh
Reviews.Content: This has all the adjustments needed to have nice sharp blacks and grays and not overpowering whites.Picture clarity is great and no motion or blur problems.  Another nice IPS panel.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic VIERA TC-L47E50 47-Inch 1080p FAKE 120hz
Reviews.Author: B. Scheib
Reviews.Content: I didn't like the tv because I got suckered by their false advertisement by thinking the tv was 120hz.  In truth, the tv is 60hz with their GIMMICK "backlight scanning" of an extra 60hz giving the tv a fake 120hz.All sporting events were horrid.  For example, there was a lot of blurring and faint fine black vertical line while the camera panned on fast moving objects.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture so so sound.
Reviews.Author: Tank "pinkjr"
Reviews.Content: Very good TV at a great price. No rca audio out jacks. Only way is digital optical ( toslink cable) for audio out. I used headphones and had to order a dac coverter that was fifty dollars.

Reviews.Title: Amazon must have read your reviews...

Reviews.Title: Great TV

Reviews.Content: This TV Replaced a Samsung UN40EH6000 TV which I liked better and thought I would try something else after accidentally breaking my screen.  This TV is great but the Samsung seemed to be a small bit ahead.

Reviews.Title: RETURNED

Reviews.Content: The contrrol was missing and the TV was dented. It was returned and the money was reinburesed BUT I was NOT reinbured for the return mailing costs....I think it to be unfaire for me to have to cover that cost...

Reviews.Title: Wonderful!

Reviews.Content: Am loving watching movies, both DVD and streaming. Picture is excellent. It is so clear that I can even watch without my glasses. And it works perfectly. I am really enjoying this TV.

Unable to obtain picture or sound. Amazon promptly sent me another ,at no cost to me. William Carter

Reviews.Author: james
Reviews.Content: at first it looks great, but after watching sports and movies therestarts to appear to be vertical lines that bleed through picture bad

Reviews.Title: Another VIERA, another satisfying buy
Reviews.Author: Peter Funk
Reviews.Content: This is my second VIERA, and it is accurate to say it is because I bought the first one.  The picture quality of the the first set, a plasma HDTV, was excellent with vivid colors and true black.  It was easy to set up, and easy to adjust.  We continue to be blown away by the incredible quality and depth of image when we watch the HD channels.  So we bought another one.  The deal was on an LED-LCD set, but because of our previous experience, we didn't hesitate.  The set is in the bonus room, and is used primarily by our son.  He's a gamer, and has been raving ever since we got it about the quality of the display when he plays his XBOX 360.  Be sure to get an HDMI cable to connect the XBOX, because, according to my son, that makes all the difference.  If you want top quality, a reasonable price, and ease of operation, I say you should VIERA.

Reviews.Title: excellent Picture
Reviews.Author: Duane Felton
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is great even though we are using it as a "2nd" TV with a Dish network 722 receiver that doesn't support HD.

Reviews.Title: No RCA Audio Output!
Reviews.Author: J. Mclin "Marana Jack"
Reviews.Content: Nice TV, just have had for 1 day w/o probs.My only complaint is that there is only "1" Audio Output and it is Digital Audio.I've had to order an active adapter (Dig-to-RCA) and Optical cable to get my older sound system to work (another $23).Also a 'flunky' Components/PC cable (2 non-std mini-conns)comes with it, but a separate interface cable (RCA-to-3.5mm) is needed to hook PC audio up!

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: Laurence Chan
Reviews.Content: This is a good entry level TV.  After some color calibration and adjustment the picture quality is very satisfying for and LED panel.The TV has good viewing angle and a nice array of ports.The sound is decent for a thin panel but nothing special.If you are looking to add a soundbar, be aware that the IR receiver is located at the center bottom of the TV set.It has only about a height clearance of about 2.5" (according to my measurements).If the TV isn't wall mounted, most sound bar will block the IR receiver.  Just be aware.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic NOTHING BETTER
Reviews.Author: M. Hoffman "melawman"
Reviews.Content: I am now 64 years of age and have purchased Panasonic products for more than 30 years. EACH of them has provided exceptional service and the product support has been outstanding. This tv is no exception. GREAT.  For example, I have purchased four televisions, a stereo receiver, toaster oven, breadmaker, still AND video cameras, clock radio, CD and ipod player, portable radios, etc, etc. This television is truly miraculous for the price I paid. Now for service. More than 5 years ago I purchased a 42 inch Panasonic plasma tv which has a beautiful picture. After 4 years it developed a problem. I telephoned Panasonic. Even though it was more than 3 years out of warranty, they sent a repairman who diagnosed a $300 plus repair. Panasonic paid the charge and the television now works like new (perfect). This was the only Panasonic product which ever failed in ANY manner, and Panasonic fixed it for nothing. I will continue to buy Panasonic products. Skip the junk. Price shop for a current Panasonic product. You may pay a small amount more, or maybe not, but you will get every penny's worth.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: j chandler
Reviews.Content: I'm not the biggest tv credited, but my wife and I really like this TV.  The TV had a very good picture out of the box and has only gotten better with burn in time.

Reviews.Title: Not a bad TV, but no plasma
Reviews.Author: Kid
Reviews.Content: Some background: Primary set right now is a Panasonic Plasma TH-50PX60U 720p/1080i resolution (MY 2006 or 2007). It's a "dumb" set, lacking any apps or internet connectivity, but I have always been satisfied with the picture quality.The best way to summarize the picture quality on this TV is this - If a person is used to watching LED/LCD displays, the picture on this set is probably just fine.  But if a person is used to watching plasma displays (especially higher-end ones like Panasonic or Pioneer), they will probably be disappointed with the picture.  In general, the set simply can't display the black levels, detail and colors that make plasma displays the gold standard and so pleasing to watch.  It's not that the picture quality on this set looks poor, in fact with high-quality source material and some setting-tweaking the picture can be quite pleasing.  But with poorer source material (Netflix and some other streaming services) the picture quality suffers, especially if you aren't a fan of the 'Soap Opera Effect' (more below).  At the end of the day the set lacks the black levels, detail and "pop" of PDPs, so if you are shopping for a great picture above all else, you are probably better off looking at Panasonic's plasma line (We just returned this set and ordered the Panasonic TC-P55S60 as a replacement, for example).Some more thoughts on the set if the above paragraph didn't scare you away:With higher-quality source material the picture quality on this set is nice, what I'd call a "B" or so.  I had a chance to watch 'Prometheus' on BD, 'The Dark Knight Rises' on BD and 'Django Unchained' on Vudu [HDX], and in all three cases the set provided a nice picture, if a bit light on the black levels and overall color.  The picture was smooth, clear and detailed.  In fact I would have probably kept the set if the picture quality with poorer-quality source material didn't suffer so badly.  I watched two or three older (ca. 2000) episodes of "Law & Order: SVU" on this set using Netflix streaming and was disappointed with the picture quality.  What I observed while using this set is that turning the Motion Picture Setting (MPS) to "Strong", which enables the highest-degree of the controversial "Soap Opera Effect", also yielded the best picture.  For some, this won't be a problem.  Personally?  I don't like the SOE, and would prefer to keep it set to "Off/Weak" at all times.  Unfortunately, doing so with this set means watching a picture that is grainier/less detailed than when having the MPS on strong, and that is a compromise that I was unwilling to make (you may feel differently).  Additionally, there was a chase scene on SVU (with MPS set to "Strong") which caused the set to exhibit some pretty strong judder/jaggie tendencies, which is more of an annoyance than anything else.  I assumed that the issue with with the set, not the source material, as we've watched hundreds of hours of Netflix streaming content on my current 50" PDP and always been extremely happy with the picture quality; black levels, details, color and fidelity have always been great.  On the other hand, my wife watched 10 minutes or so of "Glee", streamed via Hulu, and the picture quality seemed fine, on par for what I saw with the BD/Vudu experience.  This might be related to the native format of the content, and I'm not an expert in that so I won't weigh in.  But for serious buyers who understand these things I would advise making sure that the content you want to watch on this set will display acceptably for you.  If you like watching older shows/films, I cannot recommend this set.Features-wise, the set is very nice, with a handsome design, 4X HDMI ports (side-mounted instead of back-mounted, which I really like), and all of the Smart TV bounses.  If you aren't a stickler for PQ the set is very nice looking with very good connectivity.  But if you are looking for "A" level PQ, I unfortunately cannot recommend this set.I hope that this helps some of you shopping for a new TV.EDIT: 4/27/2013.The set we ordered as a replacement for the TC-L55E50, the TC-P55S60 (plasma), showed up this morning.  After a few hours of so of watching a few different sources (Again, "TDKR" on BD and some Netflix/Hulu content), I can absolutely say that the PQ on the S60 is superior to the E50.  The black levels on the S60 are remarkably deep for the price (Amazon has it for around $1K), and overall it is simply a better picture.  Other nice things about the S60 are the built-in WiFi and Hulu/Vudu/Nexflix/AmazonOD apps, the styling and the picture adjustments.  Bad things are the highly reflective screen and just 2x HDMI ports.  I thought that the lack of HDMI ports would be a problem, until I realized that I didn't even need to hook up the Roku anymore because the set has all of the apps for which we use the Roku, anyway.  Overall, the S60 is a very nice set for anybody looking for a comparable replacement to the E50 in terms of price and screen size.

Reviews.Title: Happy with purchase
Reviews.Author: Rocky
Reviews.Content: Couldn't be happier with this tv. Picture is great , simple to set up and with a coupon I paid just under $500. I haven't connected it to the Internet because I just ordered a  LAN module from Panasonic. I wanted to find a Japan made tv for under $500 and I did on Amazon!!

Reviews.Title: It's as if the actors are in the room with me!
Reviews.Author: LinuxMan03 "Jib"
Reviews.Content: Pros:Great price!Absolutely phenomenal picture quality!4 HDMI inputsGreat sound qualityConsLoading webpages can be a bit slow.  This is likely due to a lightweight processor.  But I'm being nit-picky.  The picture quality on Netflix is phenomenal.... no really, phenomenalOther points:My interent connection is gigabit all the way, but if you have a system that is using a slower router/switch you may not get high picture quality.  Keep in mind that the internet connection is giving you the picture, so the slower your interent, the worse your picture will be.  You can get a low cost gigabit router or you can wire this in for a strong connection.  Look for a 10/100/1000 LAN connection (that's gigabit).

Reviews.Title: Medium to average picture quality ..
Reviews.Author: dockster
Reviews.Content: This unit  has a great number of available preferences relative to picture and sound quality ..However  with all the time and effort I invested, I was not able to create a truly sharp, clear,crisp,  like  image .. The image is O.K. and much like the image on my smaller 33" Vizio ..  I had expected something better .. The sound was acceptable. I was able to enhance it considerably buy the use of a sound bar .. Over all it is an average  large screen TV .. Nothing spectacular or unusual..

Reviews.Title: Great price for a very good television
Reviews.Author: M Hughes
Reviews.Content: I was concerned after reading the CNET review on this set that the picture would be subpar.  But after looking at a set and reading the reviews I thought this was worth a try at the price that this television has fallen to.  I have not been disappointed!  It took some adjusting to get the picture set up, but now the picture is great.  The sound isn't bad at all after adjusting the bass way up and turning surround on.Blacks are not as good as plasma, but they are really good considering the lack of local dimming, which would cost considerably more.  It is nice being able to stream Amazon prime through the set.  WiFi requires an additional adapter, but I went with hard wire Ethernet and movies stream HD without issue.  I do wish the Amazon app had some better control of fast forward and reverse, as when you try these, the timeline moves way too quickly to effectively use it.Overall, I found this a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: Thrilled with it.
Reviews.Author: Wilson Phillips
Reviews.Content: I had a 50" Panasonic plasma TV that I bought in 2006 and I really did not expect this LED TV to be able to compare with it. I was wrong. I calibrated it with the Disney World Of Wonder disc and it looks just as good as the plasma did.

Reviews.Title: like looking out a window
Reviews.Author: slim
Reviews.Content: slim, light, perfect picture using hd cable box and hdmi cable. everything works off 1 remote. The picture is so clear and bright it feels like you are looking out a window. can't wait to catch baseball on it!

Reviews.Title: AWSOME! PICTURE AND PRICE are AMAZING!
Reviews.Author: Pierre "Pierre"
Reviews.Content: AWSOME! PICTURE AND PRICE are AMAZING!The best TV I've ever owned.  The colors and picture are amazing.  Definitely worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic tv
Reviews.Author: finishline
Reviews.Content: This tv was easy to set up and the factory settings were great. It has an incredible picture. Very happy.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, Only 1  Audio In,  Looks bad on Dark Scenes
Reviews.Author: Jacob Blumberg "jakeb16"
Reviews.Content: The Spec sheet speaks for the TV pretty well , here are the important parts and my take on the featuresOut of the box everything was in good working order. It took me a few minutes to figure out how to assemble the base (there is a hook that base has to go over)Once assembled everything worked great, except the sound. I had a 32" CRT with great sound and I couldn't even hear the TV across the room. But I expected this TV and other LED TVs to have bad sound.Initially I didn't have any HDMI cables so I used the PC input (VGA) and component audio.  Note the VGA input does not support 1080p I think it was around 720p but I forgot what I ended up setting it to.The "Smart TV" features are pretty slow. Easy to use but slow, and I kept hitting them on the remote. BTW when in the smart mode your source button doesn't work you have to press X first a bit annoying. I used a wired connection and had no problems (worked seamless)The on screen help is pretty sweet and a very nice feature. Along with the ability to disable and name input sources.I got Samsung HW-E450 Wireless AirTrack Sound Bar and connected it with a HDMI cable using ARC. After a bit of configuration I got it working great, with the TV remote power button turning the sound bar and TV off and on.The 4 HDMI ports are really nice, however I wish there was more composite inputs, the only way to input audio is composite audio, (and if it is included in a HDMI connection like xbox).  I am using a DVI to HDMI cable with composite audio in for my computer and that takes up 2 input sources. The HDMI does support full 1080p.  The composite input needs an included adapter which is ugly and could be easily lost in a move.To get my computer to display correctly you have to adjust the picture settings to size 2, with eliminates the overscan so you can see the full screen.The remote is pretty nice and easy to use, with the exception hitting the internet button too much by accident.The Picture quality is good,  Halo 4 looked sooo good! But dark scenes don't come out so great. I had no issues with viewing angle. My guess is that other more expensive TVs look nicer, but for a budget TV its pretty good.I don't really like the picture presets and its not clear how to turn 120hz off, I think game mode will do that. Speaking of which I still don't understand whats up with changing the title of the product. Its not true 120hz Refresh Rate but it defiantly processes the single because I see the soap opera effect.There are ads displayed in the volume control but its super easy to turn it off.Overall it seems like it has the most inputs for its class and a nice set of easy to use well working features. You will need a sound bar or external speakers but other than that it's a good TV.

Reviews.Title: Bought this when it was listed as a 120Hz
Reviews.Author: Johnny Jung
Reviews.Content: I was ready to give this 5 stars, I originally ordered this when it was listed as a 120Hz but now that it's listed as a 60Hz I feel misled.The sound is okay, but a sound bar is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Good TV.
Reviews.Author: HBBR
Reviews.Content: The TV is very good. It is connected to a SD signal but except for some scenes it feels close to HD quality. I did play with settings to get a better picture. The sound is ok for a thin TV. The con so far is a missing headphone jack. The only audio out is optical out. The smart application are few but are responsive and simple to use. The applications look exactly the same on all panasonic VERIA models. I am using a hardwired connections and software update was quick. I don't like the amazon app because it lacks bookmarks or recent searched/watched list but then I had the same complaint with my Panasonic blue-ray. E50 uses an not-so-common 400x400 wall mount pattern that makes it hard to upgrade from existing older mounts.there is some confusion regarding the refresh rate . I think the confusion is caused by E5 being 60hz and E50 being "most likely" 120hz. Look at the backlight scanning spec. backlight scanning = refresh rate X number of sections. so 360 translates to 120 X 3. Both ET5 and E50 's backlight scanning spec out as 360 while WT50 specs as 1920 (240 x 8).So regardless the refresh rate, I am happy with the TV.

Reviews.Title: In credible
Reviews.Author: Patrick T. Ditaranto "cargonator"
Reviews.Content: Thus is an an incredible TV. Very crisp,clear and super easy setup. This was an incredible value,compares to LEDs twice the price

Reviews.Title: Stunning picture quality
Reviews.Author: Tamae E. Ishii
Reviews.Content: Got this tv for my living room & I must say the picture quality is just stunning! Everything is so clear, vibrant & sharp. The resolution is so good that you get the "soap opera" effect where the prime time shows & movies look like soap opera sets or someone's home video. Very weird. I'm wondering if there is a setting that allows you to turn that effect off. Otherwise great tv. Sound not so great when streaming Netflix but I think that's an issue with Netflix as the sound is fine when I'm watching tv. Highly recommend this tv!!!  Much better than my friend's Samsung LED!

Reviews.Title: great picture
Reviews.Author: Sharon Faloni "sheri"
Reviews.Content: I know nothing about TV's, I just watch them.I know nothing about TV's, I just watch them.  We have several TV's including HD's and I have never seen the difference in the picture that the men in my family talk about.  The picture quality all seemed pretty much the same to me until this TV.  The picture is so clear that I feel as though I am at the actual filming of what ever I am watching. This is a first for me and it didn't cost an arm and a leg either

Reviews.Title: Very nice t.v. Great color ,easy set-up
Reviews.Author: Patricia Brooks
Reviews.Content: Love this t.v. very good quality for the money.  It sets off our living room ,put above fireplace stunning. Panasonic always does it right!

Reviews.Title: We love it!
Reviews.Author: D Bertke
Reviews.Content: Great TV - sharp picture, excellent sound and features that I look forward to exploring. My daughter was very excited about how much larger the screen was than our old TV and my wife, who I expected to push back on the grounds that this was an "unnecessary expense" was excited about it too.I shopped a lot for this specific TV - we have an armoire that limited the horizontal dimension to under 39.5", and I was happy to find a 42" diagonal that would fit. Little did I know that I would be getting so much more than a close fit.

Reviews.Title: Great but....
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love this tv but am having trouble with picture cut off on side of screens.  It is like the picture is in zoom mode but is not.  I don't know if this is a Dish issue or the tv.  Plan to call Dish to come and see if the DVR needs adjusting.  Other than that one issue and the sound, but I did the recommended fixes for that, I do like this tv.

Reviews.Title: Great value and picture
Reviews.Author: Tamim - Florida
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product for my lanai and it works perfectly for my needs.  The picture quality is outstanding.  For the price, you can't go wrong with an LED TV.

Reviews.Title: Great value LED
Reviews.Author: NPA77
Reviews.Content: Great tv for the price. Probably the best deal out there. Bought this LED as a second tv for my bedroom and I am not disappointed. Definately worth the upgrade for 120hrz, I wouldn't buy an LED with less. Blacks not as deep as my plasma but worth it to not have the image retentionPros - Blu Ray and PS3 looks amazing. Smart features are pretty coolCons - picture quality suffers if not presented in 1080. I have to change picture settings between blu ray and games (if using ps3 for both) but none of these are a big deal.I would recommend this tv to anyone, best deal for LED IMO

Reviews.Title: Pleased so far, Wii games look good, Prime shows too, PROMO ALERT
Reviews.Author: Brian S.
Reviews.Content: I saw this had a heavily reduced price compared to other TVs and the consumer impulse kicked into motion (in spite of the fear of horrible shipping).  To date, this still beats other prices.  I like to buy my TVs from Sears in person and inspect the box before I take it home.  Sears did not have this TV in stock.  Compared to other smart TVs, this is cheap - especially with the $100 promotional from Amazon.Risky Shipping WarningI ordered the TV (new) on a Sunday evening and received it on Tuesday Morning via UPS.  The box by Panasonic was sturdy (unlike the thin boxes used by Sony).  However, this box had several small poked holes in it, two big surface cuts, and looked like it went through a bad conveyer belt.  Looked like original tape/sealing was on it.  When opening from the top I noticed the tape was broken, pressed in, and someone could have put their hand in the box.  The Styrofoam had been broken, pushed to the side.  I think this put 3 marks on the screen that I thought I wiped away with a tissue, but which appeared later (not seeable when TV is on).  There was also a scuff mark on the back metal piece.  Either the Amazon warehouse or the UPS guys messed the box up.  ***Amazon ships this in the original TV box.***TV Can Survive the ShippingThankfully, the TV works great.  Where the three lines were/are located on the right corner - I do not notice them anymore (but they're still there) when the TV is off or on.  No backlit bleeding like other reviewers mentioned.  Black tones look fine (comparing to my Sony 32 inch LCD).  I noticed some choppiness when people were running on an Amazon Prime show (digital HD), but it may have just been because of the particular British show from a few years ago and/or my lack of fine-tuning settings.  Also, I've never had a TV this big.  Animation looks phenomenal on this TV.  While flipping channels, a Batman Beyond episode from 1999 was on the HUB HD channel.  It looked very sharp.  I have not watched any sports on it yet.Four HDMI ports on this TV - hard to beat that in this price range!Ethernet Cable for Internet ConnectionInternet to the TV is via the Ethernet cable from the modem (pulled it from the tower).  I am still able to surf the web, and use my computer, on the TV as a monitor.  Either the TV is allowing this because of the HDMI between the TV and tower or maybe the wireless in the desktop finally started working?Amazon Prime Instant VideoShows I watched were in HD and looked great.  Linking to Amazon should only take a few minutes.Video GamesWii video games (Metal Slug, etc.) look great on the TV.  I have not hooked up the Xbox yet.  I also played Age of Empires 2 (computer game) on the big screen and it looked very nice.Computer via HDMI ConnectionI hooked my computer/tower via HDMI cable to the TV.  Use the remote (navigate the settings) to fix your desktop resolution being too large for the screen.  You can surf the net from your couch (I boosted the browser page view to 150% and the text to "Larger").  This eliminates some white-space while not losing any words.  You need to still have good eyes or glasses for this as well.OtherThe TV is actually kind of heavy I think (especially compared to a Sony LCD).  The back of the TV feels and sounds like a flimsy piece of thin metal.  It also heats up to be quite hot.So Far So GoodBasically:-Shipping is risky but worth it!-TV picture is sharp in my opinion-TV is a great buy for the price-Probably a good fit for you unless you must have Sony specifications (more $$$)-Perfect for streaming Amazon Prime Instant media-Perfect for surfing the web from your living room-Hard to find a TV with 4 HDMIs in this price rangeUPDATE 2/2/13Some people are saying the TV is 60 hrz and not 120 as advertised.  I have to check my box.  I did not notice when watching some football that the refresh rate was not as good as my older Sonys.  This still may be adjustable.  Overall, I'm still satisfied with the TV.POMOTION ISSUES with AmazonAmazon offered a $100 promo to be sent within 7 says of product shipping (excluded tablets and I think Apple products).  Amazon told me wait up to 7 says from shipping.  It still didn't come at 9 days.  Customer service said and gave me a code that needed to be "Activated" by Marketing department.  So I had to wait another day.  I got another code that did not work.  I called for a third time, at this point (approx 1/31/13) this product was taken off the Amazon website and would not  come up when I clicked on my own previous review of it (Today, 2/2/13, it is back).  On this third call, Amazon tried to tell me the $100 promo was only for certain products and not the books sold by amazon in my cart.  This was incorrect b/c the promo covered books and products held by and sold by Amazon, except for tablets, etc.  At this point Amazon told me they would just rebate me a $100.  The next day I had a payment option that went up to a $100.Amazon customer service told me at various times the promo was only for  digital products or not what was in my cart (books mainly).  But, I knew that was not correct.  I made sure not to buy tablets, computer products, or Apple products.Stay on Amazon to guarantee you get your $100!

Reviews.Title: Great Deal!
Reviews.Author: Kat
Reviews.Content: We ordered this TV (42') on a Sunday evening and it arrived on Wednesday in great shape.  Due to us being a prime member, shipping was free and we got a $100 credit to our account when we ordered this tv.  We were about to order this same TV form Sears, but found the price here to be $200 cheaper than sears sale price, so basically w/ the credit we saved $300! My husband set it up in about 15 minutes.  Its working great, picture is solid, viewing range is broad as indicated.  We also bought the recommended Panasonic adapter, working great, although have yet to stream a movie. We have wireless in another room a bit down the hall and around the corner via Comcast. Seems to be working fine.  Sound is so-so, but plenty o.k. for our needs. I did quite a bit of research b4 selecting this tv on consumer reports etc. Its our first flat screen, very happy esp. for the price and quality.  It was scored high on consumer reports, but wasn't one of their pics, but they really didn't say why...maybe a point threshold? Panasonic looks to be among the lowest in terms of repairs for TV's.  Looking fwd to enjoying this!!  Other Amazon reviews on this TV were very helpful to us making our final decision - thanks!!

Reviews.Title: Perfect Christmas gift!
Reviews.Author: Wenceslao Martinez "Beach comber"
Reviews.Content: My daughter and son-in-law are absolutely satisfied with this TV. They like the sharp definition and full colors, plus the crisp sound. I consider this a very good purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great television
Reviews.Author: J. A. King
Reviews.Content: Purchased the 47' Panasonic to replace a 42' Vizio that developed vertical lines.Shipping was on time and free. Packaging was not a problem.Set-up was quick.Used an HDMI feed out of a Motorola cable box on high-definition channels.  Tried different settings for the picture from "standard" to "custom" to "vivid" etc.  All of them seemed a little odd.  Now I recognize it to be the "soap opera effect" that adds a perceived smoothing or blurring effect to the picture.  It's hard to describe but for those that like really crisp sharp pictures, it's annoying.Solution: As mentioned in other posts, change the picture setting to "game".  This turns off the smoothing program and reveals a more classic high definition picture.In the "gaming" mode the picture is as bright, sharp and crisp of any high def TV I know.The speakers are not very impressive so you will want to connect the digital audio out to a stereo or surround amplifier with speakers and woofer, or use a sound bar.All in all, a great picture once you tweek the set-up

Reviews.Title: very good deal
Reviews.Author: YVON A RESPLANDY
Reviews.Content: Very easy set up, good and sturdy packaging, prompt delivery, nothing was missing.  This TV was advertised as "used but like new", in fact it was fully new, had never been turned on and the plastic wrapping on the edges of the screen and other parts were still untouched.  So we saved quite a bit of money by taking a used TV.We cinsidered taking the insurance offered on Amazon site but at the end decided not to do so.  The main reason for not taking the insurance was the in fine print of the insurance contract. the insurance coverage start only 60 days after purchased of the TV, since the vast majority of malfunctions of any electronic equipment show up within few days of usage, the insurance is in fact not covering much.  It is better to take only the manufacturer warranty (generally one year) which is included in the purchase price.

Reviews.Title: DLNA/Built-in Wi-Fi, NOT
Reviews.Author: Duffy Mazan
Reviews.Content: Read the fine print.  Although the headline says "DLNA/Built-in Wi-Fi" the text says "WiFi ready" and that a separate WiFi adapter must be purchased.  So much for the great price.  If you need WiFi, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth VanValkenburg
Reviews.Content: This tv really ment all my expectations and was easy to set up.  I am an older senior citizen and had no problems.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Picture, so so sound
Reviews.Author: jiyoung Chin
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV one month ago for $850 (including $100 Amazon.com credit).  I read most of reviews here and worried a bit about delivery damage and poor quality control but I pull the trigger anyway as the price came down.  Third party delievery was on time and delivery man also set up the TV to make sure it has no initial issue.  Picture quality is excellent.  I have 4 year old Sharp LCD and it is not match to this Panasonic.  Regarding Picture quality, it is as good as or better than Samsung TVs I saw in Costco.  Amount of backlit bleeding of my unit was on par with several other LED TVs or my old Sharp, which is acceptable for me.  I can't compare this with plasma TVs since I have never owned one.  TV speaker sound is so so for any music or movie, probably OK for sports.  Took one star off for the sound.  I bought Boston Acoustic TVee25 sound bar (for $130) to replace TV sound and it works well with this TV.  Just turn off the TV sound from TV's manu and program TV remote's volume control for TVee25 sound bar.  I don't know how long the TV will last before any issue and only time will tell.  But for now, I am very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: This is the very I expected,
Reviews.Author: daneeuk1
Reviews.Content: Good; clear view in any angle, easy to set upNot good; limited Wi-Fi modem are abailable. I use air mac express

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT TELEVISION!
Reviews.Author: Hank Cupp
