Reviews.Content: I read reviews endlessly, and the Panasonic Viera kept coming up on top, so I bought one.  An excellent choice, in my opinion!The picture is great, and the unit works well.  Sets up easily and performs as it is supposed to.  I am so pleased  I bought another 32" Viera for my bedroom!

Reviews.Title: After some changing of the setting, one of the best tv's ever!
Reviews.Author: Ares
Reviews.Content: I got this tv to replace a 40" Samsung 60hz tv and was a little hesitant. So many positive reviews led me to believe it might be a good purchase. I got it a little later than the estimated arrival date (it was during the holiday season so I kind of expected it) and set it up. I was a little worried at first because I originally set the video settings to "game" and blacks or shadows would show a kind of "gradient". I eventually changed the settings to "custom" and turned up the color and brightness. Finally, I turned the "motion picture picture" to weak and this tv has one of the best pictures I've ever seen! I'm very satisfied with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: We purchased our tv this past November. We are pleased with the picture, sound and overall quality. We do have one complaint, but only a small one. The output for headphones is digital and you cannot hook up just any headphones to this tv, you need a converter. We finally found a pair of Sony that is suppose to be specifically for our tv. I posted a review on Amazon for them so I won't go through the trouble of rewriting it here.Panasonic needs to redesign their headphone output so it is easier to use instead of what they have now.I would recommend this tv to everyone who is looking for a good, quality, product.

Reviews.Title: PANASONIC
Reviews.Author: Timothy Gay "imaplinker"
Reviews.Content: ARRIVED IN GREAT CONDITION HAS SHARP VIVID COLOR VERY EASY TO SET UP AND WAS A GOOD VALUE FOR THE PRICE

Reviews.Title: Picture perfect
Reviews.Author: beelover
Reviews.Content: I looked at all the Top Brands and there was always a feature that gave them a lower rating. I went to the box stores to see the quality of picture displayed on all the Flat Screen TVs. The store has all the TVs displaying the same picture. I visited the store 3 times so I could really compare the picture quality. After standing at different angles for viewing,I narrowed my choices down to 3 Brands. Picture,new technology and price made the Panasonic VIERA my choice.Amazon beat the prices,even though I was a little worried about ordering a TV online and getting it shipped UNDAMAGED! Set up of the TV was simple.The picture was even better in my living room!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Value
Reviews.Author: PensFan99
Reviews.Content: I do not believe you can get a better TV for the price this is selling for; especially when you score the $100 Amazon credit on top of the great price.  Easy set up, awesome picture, and 4 HDMI inputs.  Could not be happier with Panasonic. Hooked up a Panasonic blu ray, and it really is incredible.  So glad my 9 year old 27 inch Sony Trinitron finally ate it.

Reviews.Title: Great image quality, but can be improved in audio
Reviews.Author: C. C. Chu "stockmarket14"
Reviews.Content: Bought this 42" to replace 5-7 ys old Samsung 36" LCD TV for our bedroom use.The image is very good, black level is reasonable, and wireless connection is easy to setup and runs smoothly with our Belkin N+ router via Time Warner Cable Road Runner.  Haven't hook up to a DVD/Blu-ray player via HDMI to assess its video performance.However, it does have some issues that can be improved.First, I agree with all those posted complains about poor audio volume.  I have to crank up to near 40-50 to have reason sound vol. Of course, no base as expected from any built-in speakers.  May consider to add a Zbox to improve the sound quality.Second, the available apps are quite poor with a few useful ones like Pandora, most of them are junk and useless and require paid subscriptions! No web browser either.  This is the worst aspect of this internet TV.If you want to use it as a pure TV instead of view web sites, it is fine.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for the Price
Reviews.Author: Mickey Crittenden
Reviews.Content: We needed a bigger TV since we remodeled and enlarged our family room/kitchen area.  I originally wanted a 55" Samsung LED because we've had great experience with our 40" Samsung.  However, the price and feature set of this Panasonic TV, coupled with positive reviews from multiple sources (including Consumer Reports), make this a better value than the comparable Samsung.  The Amazon price was incredibly lower than the brick and mortar stores.  I also purchased the Panasonic SC-HTB350 audio system, which is a great complementary sound option for this TV.  The TV picture is awesome, and you can turn-off the weird power-up banner ads that display.  I would not hesitate to recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding TV
Reviews.Author: ronsram
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up and outstanding from the start. Easy internet TV access My second new Panasonic in a year.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: Love love love this tv! I had concerns ordering it online w/o seeing it in person but couldn't beat the price considering all of the features. I'm so glad I went for it. The picture quality is excellent. I made a couple of tweaks to make the black darker & the colors more vivid. I also changed the cinema quality down a notch since it seems like the 120hz processor is too advanced for most shows I watch & I noticed the "soap opera effect" people were mentioning too. I'm bummed amazon was out of the USB adapters & won't have them in stock for another 1-2mos. So I can't review the apps but I'm excited to check it out & the amazon videos I can download for free too.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Brian S
Reviews.Content: This product is great. I highly recommend it.  The sound quality is wonderful and the picture is crisp.  My guests always marvel at how great the TV is and how good shows, movies, and sports look on it.The only thing I could nit-pick about would be that it is hard to reach the ports on the back of the TV after it has been mounted. While I realize this is also partially due to my mount, this is just a heads-up. I would suggest plugging everything in before mounting the TV.

Reviews.Title: Needs an adapter
Reviews.Author: Kristy Powell
Reviews.Content: The tv is really nice. Great picture. I bought it for Christmas for my son. Amazon Prime shipped so I received the next day! It was easy to setup, however the ad didn't say that a wireless adapter was needed. I am disappointed that Amazon didn't suggest"needs an adapter". I could've bought everything at once. Or looked for another tv with "built-in" WiFi, not "WiFi ready. I didn't know those  terms had different meanings.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: jon olivera
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a 50" Plasma that was a lower grade of HD and let me tell you the difference is as drastic as the change from no HD to HD.  The picture is outstanding, sharp, and is great for action shots in sports.  Could not be happier with the purchase.  It is very light and thin perfect for wall mounting.

Reviews.Title: GREAT picture
Reviews.Author: Terry E. Edwards "Terry Edwards"
Reviews.Content: I love this television! The picture is so clear and sharp.  Now when I watch football, I can find the ball!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great, with issues.
Reviews.Author: Michael Garrison
Reviews.Content: First TV was sent back. It arrived in Panasonic packaging that had no internal or external damage to box or packing. Upon unpacking it had a dinner plate sized dent in the upper brace section of the rear metal shell. The unit was new and must have been boxed with the damage. Amazon customer service was great. Had a replacement shipped the same day the damaged unit was received. UPS delivered the new unit and picked up damaged unit next working day. The Viera was purchased for my mother in another state and it was not an issue other than having to unpack and repack, she's 80yrs old, Once she got her cable provider technician to set up everything (Brighthouse- another great service provider). She loves it. Its her first LCD large screen TV and first time she's seen HD TV. She loves it. She's not a techie. I purchased The Viera because of the IPS screens wider viewing angle, mom never sits directly in front of the television. She said there's no fade or dimming of the picture. I also sent her the wired sound bar and woofer,  Panasonic SC-HTB20 Energy Star 2.1-Channel 240-Watt Multi-Positional Full HD 3D Audio System. It's VIERA Link Capable and was also set up by Brighthouse. Mom says she loves it so I give it 5 stars, Not based on the tech just a great lady's opinion.

Reviews.Title: No sound on 5.1 movies.
Reviews.Author: Larryd "LarryD"
Reviews.Content: Nice picture. BUT sound wise it will not play anything with 5.1 sound . No sound at all. Panasonic help line told me the TV was not designed to play 5.1 sound. No PS3 games no Netflix. I have a cheap old LED set that plays it all but not this $1000.00 Panasonic. So,if you watch movies or play video games with 5.1 sound , do NOT buy this Television set. If you do and figure out how to change the settings please let me and the tech support  people at Panasonic know.I hooked up with a HDMI cable..If I can't get it going I am afraid Amazon will be getting it back.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Rider
Reviews.Content: Purchased this HDTV a couple weeks ago and I love it. The picture quality is outstanding and the features included make this a very entertaining TV. Build quality is nice as well and it feels sturdy once attached to the stand. Everything from it's media player, games/apps, instant streaming, to YouTube and Facebook apps help make this a great TV and the VIERA app market leaves room for much expansion of this TV's features. The SD card slot and USB slots in combination with the media player make it easy to put your music, videos, and photos on this TV. I also got a Panasonic Blu-Ray player to go with this TV which includes it's own little features and things to add such as VIERA Link.Packaging was pretty good, the TV arrived with no damage and shipping speed was pretty quick. Only downside is you have to buy a separate USB adapter (Panasonic TY-WL20U Wireless Adapter) to connect the TV to your wireless router which runs about $60-$70 but it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: I love it.
Reviews.Author: William Jones
Reviews.Content: Great set.  I have a hard time (literally) believing the picture is as good as I'm seeing.  The clarity and detail is sometimes mesmerizing.  Once I figure out how to set up the router, I'll post again regarding the wi-fi and limited (?)  internet.The screen is large, but easy to get used to.  Friends told me that I wouldn't want anything smaller, and they were correct.The 49'ers looked great yesterday, and Charlie Rose was better than ever, if that is possible.  Try one out, I'll betcha like it.

Reviews.Title: Edge Bleeding Mars Dark Scenes
Reviews.Author: Bradford "oneiros11"
Reviews.Content: This is just a partial take on the E50 to complement what others have said.  At the outset, I will mention that I am loyal fan of Panasonic, having owned many of their products over the years, including a ten-year-old boom box and a 25-year old VCR that still works!  Now on to the E50 . . .First, the good.  This television produces wonderful images for ordinary daytime scenes.  Color is natural.  Movement is handled well - even without the motion smoothing, which you can turn off by going into Game Mode.  I did this to eliminate the unfortunate "soap opera" effect created by motion smoothing (which makes the image look like cheaply shot video).  Also, the menu is intuitive and easy to navigate.  There are plenty of in and outputs -- although analogue audio would have been a nice addition.Now for the bad.  Like most LED TVs, this Pany has trouble reproducing good black levels in darker scenes.  You don't really notice this in daylight scenes.  But in night scenes, this model spills irregular blotches of light across the screen.  This is true even with backlighting set at zero.  Detail is lost and contrast is muddied.  If you are a cinema lover as I am, you may find this very distracting.  I probably should have done more due diligence here, as this problem seems endemic to most edge-lit sets.The upshot is this.  I traded in E50 for the Panasonic plasma 50ST50.  Although it was more expensive, the images on the ST50 are drop-dead gorgeous, and I'm glad I made the switch.  I've heard that plasma sets are not ideal for well lit rooms -- I have yet to try this out, since I mostly watch after dark.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: koolkat
Reviews.Content: Sharp picture, brilliant colors, great viewing from any angle. Requires wireless adapter but hooked it up via ethernet. Cant beat the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Ew62
Reviews.Content: Great picture quality and features.  I was fooled by the "WiFi Ready" thinking it was WiFi enabled.  This TV is not enabled, therefore, you must have a direct internet connection or another means for accessing the internet.  Well worth the money even considering that oversight on my part.

Reviews.Title: Stunning !!!
Reviews.Author: C. Duncan "charlie"
Reviews.Content: That's the word for this one. Incredibly easy setup. I have an LG tv that people rave about and i have to say that this tv is probably better than mine. I gave this set as a gift. I wouldn't mind trading tv's now. The picture is incredible. There's no other word. The sound could use a little work but for this price that stuff is like ants at a picnic. I may get a soundbar, but other than that this is the perfect gift at half the cost my tv was listed at. Truly impressed.

Reviews.Title: Great picture - excellent value for backlit LED TV
Reviews.Author: game guy "GG"
Reviews.Content: This TV is all that I hoped it would be. Moving from an old CRT to the flat panel meant that even a mediocre picture was going to be an improvement. I spent a lot of time researching and when I found this on sale I took the plunge. I have not noticed any of the issues that others have mentioned here. I would buy this again! No analog audio output is a bit of a downer, but nonetheless it is a great buy.

Reviews.Title: I love it! More expensive than most but it has been worth it so far
Reviews.Author: tastygrapes
Reviews.Content: I got this on a nice sale so I am reviewing on a different price point but it's an excellent TV with loads of features, the picture is very clear and crisp and I trust the brand very much. Go ahead and get yourself a Canopy 4-Year TV Protection Plan with it though ;)

Reviews.Title: Great Picture Poor Speakers
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: I bought the TV for the picture and it is awesome. Just enough adjustment for me without an infite amount of options.The speakers are pretty poor. I have it connected with a digital cable to my Sony receiver and from there to my house surround sound so I really didn't care that much about the speakers. If you don't have additional speakers you might want to consider a different TV.

Reviews.Title: love this TV - sharp clear picture
Reviews.Author: zemzem
Reviews.Content: Love this TV - great picture, sound. Vivid colors, sharp image.One of the best parts about this TV is that you can connect it via ethernet cable to your router.Windows 7/8 recognizes the TV as a media center and allows you to stream movies to your TV from your PC.No additional software needed. I was pleasantly surprised by this feature.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the price
Reviews.Author: Burger
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a 46" or 47" to put in our living room, and after going to one of the local big box stores to compare various makes/models, I settled upon this TV and purchased it from Amazon thanks to the free shipping and no tax.The TV produces a great image in a room with some large windows.  You do need to do some tweaking of the image from the standard settings, but there are plenty of options to customize it however you need.  There can be some glare issues on the screen, but nothing like you'd experience with a plasma.  One of the other nice features is the viewing angle.  I've had no trouble watching it from higher/lower than the ideal height, and our loveseat is at about a 45 degree angle from straight on viewing, but you don't notice any degradation in the picture.  It had plenty of inputs and the TV is super thin.  It looks like a picture hanging on the wall when paired with an ultra-slim mount.All in all, I'm very happy with my choice.  I wanted a great TV that didn't have 3D, and this fit the bill perfectly.

Reviews.Title: TV
Reviews.Author: TAG
Reviews.Content: Product had a slight dent in the back but its used (Like New). Product works so I dont care about the small dent in the back. Great Deal for the PRICE. TYVM

Reviews.Title: Just what I was looking for...
Reviews.Author: jonnyboe
Reviews.Content: I was looking for my first large flat screen tv. The last tv I purchased was about 15 years ago. I did a lot of research and considered the one spot in my den that I could put a large tv. I wrestled with plasma vs. lcd. I saw the Amazon promotion on this set but read a less than stellar review on CNET. I visited a local Sears where this set was on display. I was impressed, though realized that the video was bumped way up for sales floor viewing. After reading the other Amazon reviews of this set I decided to take the plunge.I was able to set the delivery date to occur on a day when I was available and could narrow it down to a few hours span. It came right on time and was set up and connected correctly. I was pleased with its operation, though the picture did not blow me away at first. Then I re-read the reviews with several suggestions for set-up adjustments. This made all the difference in the world. The picture is magnificent!The sound was okay but I wanted to try a sound bar. I purchased an inexpensive Philips CSS2123/F7 SoundBar Home Cinema Speakers (Pair) and have been quite pleased with the sound enhancement. I also purchased the "dongle" that plugs into the usb port to provide wireless internet connection. I did not purchase the current one that is suggested (for over $50) but found the prior model on-line for about $25. It connected perfectly. The interface is pretty intuitive but the connection is s-l-o-w, which may be more about my wireless connection than the set or the dongle.One more cool thing, I downloaded an app to use on my android phone that replicates the remote so my wife and I can each have our own remote.One last thing: one of the cables that I needed to attach a dvd recorder to the set was supposed to be included with the set. It was a somewhat rare cable but I could not find it packaged with the rest of the materials. I finally dug through all the styrofoam packaging and found it taped to the inside of the box bottom, underneath the packaging. Glad I didn't have the delivery guys take the box away, as they offered.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV but could use a little more sound volume
Reviews.Author: D. Heymann
Reviews.Content: I love this TV. My Samsung 37" LCD on my bedroom wall died and I eventually replaced it with this TV. I am thrilled every time I walk in the bedroom and see this TV. It is beautiful when it is turned off.Pros:>Huge beautiful picture! Some will complain about the Soap Opera effect but you get used to that (it is the same on my 70" sharp). Note: you will want to change some settings to your preferences. For example I turned off the setting that checks the ambient light in the room and dims the TV to save power. This made the TV terrifically bright which I prefer. I watch sports and TV shows on it and am thrilled with what I see. You will want HDTV programming because SD looks awful by comparison.>Amazon instant video is available on this TV with no external device. Just connect it to your wired or wireless internet (both are built into TV) and you can watch any Amazon show you want. If you have purchased movies or TV in the past, all of your purchased shows are there. If you are a prime customer, you can watch free prime videos. Much better than using the cable company VOD. I use the wired connection which is very fast. Don't know if the wireless will work as fast.>Smart TV works with many other internet services like Netflix or Hulu plus.>Beautiful design. Though it doesn't show well in the pictures, the TV has a clear plastic frame around the outside edge. Sounds cheap (and probably is) but looks almost art deco and very cool. The black bezel is no more than an inch wide. I prefer the ones with no bezel but they are dramatically more expensive and this looks great.>Plenty of HDMI inputs plus a VGA computer input. It only has one input of the old fashion RCA component or composite (can be used for either but only has one). If you have HDMI, this will not be a drawback.>Because the TV is thin, it actually weighted about the same as the Samsung that was 10 inches smaller. I was able to mount it on the same VESA mount (by purchasing adapter plates on amazon).Cons:>the big one is the sound is not that loud. I am a little hard of hearing and that bothers me a little bit. Apparently most of the new LED TVs in this size range are meant to be used with home theaters so they put cheap laptop speakers in them. If you have normal hearing, it probably won't bother you. Even in my case, when I turn it to 100% volume, it is almost too loud, but at 100% it should be ear splitting. I solved buying a very small home theater for my bedroom and now the sound is great. I downgraded to four stars based on the fact that the volume wasn't that loud but with the stereo it is a 5 star TV for me.>power cable is proprietary. This meant I couldn't use the standard computer monitor cable I had run through the wall, but for $2 I bought an adapter on Amazon that solved the problem by converting my computer cable to a standard wall type socket.I am not an audiophile or a videophile but I would not accept anything less than a beautiful picture and this has it. I would buy this again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Carlos Astua
Reviews.Content: The TV is awesome. The image has very god quality, the view range is great and it has more features than what I need. I really recommend it...

Reviews.Title: Awesome 55" and looks great mounted on the wall
Reviews.Author: Zoran Jovanovic
Reviews.Content: Great TV with awesome colors and features.  The built in applications like pandora and netflix work great, however I misread when purchasing the TV.  Just because a TV is Wi-Fi ready doesn't mean it does Wi-Fi on its own, you need a USB wifi adapter.

Reviews.Title: Great tv except for sound quality
Reviews.Author: ebbjoelj
Reviews.Content: I like my new Panasonic very good overall. The set up was very simple with easy to navigate screen prompts. The picture is fantastic once you "dial it in". My only complaint is the sound. There is very little bass, kind of tinny sounding. I guess putting in cheap speakers is the norm anymore, but I don't want to mess with external speakers just to watch a tv show. Aside from the sound, I would have rated it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Lackluster picture - wireless not installed! (advertised as "ready" on in-store packaging) *updated
Reviews.Author: Calder
Reviews.Content: This simply is not a good option for the money - although the price has dropped since I originally purchased this set.  Read the professional review at CNET. I would do that before you take the word of consumers on this site who want to feel good about the $700-$1000 they shelled out for what is arguably an average set that is being marketed in stores in what I consider a misleading fashion. If it matters to you, I am well educated and would probably be best described as a prosumer level A/V enthusiast.Purchasers who bought this set and complain of no wireless are right to be ticked. Yes, Amazon has a chart on their site - but most people do not order their tvs of this size through the mail and do not have time to do a mountain of research on terminology. . .what's worse - in my opinion Panasonic is misusing accepted professional lingo! In the A/V business "wireless ready" generally means the equipment only needs a wireless network. In our brave new age of consumer exploitation where manufacturers can apparently say whatever they please, Panasonic has stamped a huge picture of a wireless signal on the box for this TV with wireless ready written on it. There is no chart from Amazon in most local or box stores to pick through how Panasonic decides to misuse professional terminology, nor should there need to be. Add to that additional wording about being a "smart" TV and lots of large web-based service logos such as Netflix and Hulu and you have quite questionable packaging.I have been buying Panasonic A/V products for twenty years. In the past they were one of my favorite companies. Some of their plasma TVs could not be beat (as far as plasmas go). In my opinion, this TV would have been spectacular in picture quality five or six years ago and still pretty useful "as is" - mechanically - six or more years ago when fiber optic cable lines were still widely used in homes. That Panasonic has this priced where it is, is advertising it in stores as "wireless ready" and apparently set up its firmware so it will not allow any other wireless adapter (including not working with the, in my opinion, rubbish adapters they required people buy for wireless service with some of their older generation blu-ray players), is ridiculous.If you have ethernet cabling instead of wireless in your house I would say this TV can meet your needs - but - should you support a product marketed in a way that seems, to me at least, meant to mislead the consumer? I have many other Panasonic products that have been great, but this is grey area marketing that is extremely poor. When we support it, we encourage more of it. Panasonic knows most people struggle mightely installing a TV. Many people have to hire a pro. Who is going to take this TV back once they realize it isn't wireless?. . .Only people with the time and knowledge to unhook it, transport it, and install a new one. My guess is Panasonic is unfortunately banking on that, and banking on the fact that consumers will then line up like sheep to buy the adapter they make (the only specific one that appears to work), in order to utlize the features they paid for, but cannot use.We have three (yes, overkill I know) surround systems in our home. I installed all of them and several others as well. I have compared and utilized many brands of TVs - though I am not a professional installer. I have seen this model alongside a 42" $500 60htz JVC. I felt the JVC produced better blacks. This Panny's blacks are somewhat washed out, even after adjustment, and reminded me of some of Samsung's lower end offerings - though the other hues of color reproduction are quite good. Well, they should be, right? The $500 JVC's looked good too. There is another review for this TV where some consumer is rudely making fun of someone for buying a Vizio. Well, the Vizio owner probably got a better performing TV for the money.At any rate, I tried this set in one of our rooms anyway, mostly because I like Panasonic. It was OK. . .but OK isn't good enough for this price point, and I was still disappointed by their choice of marketing strategy. Back to the store it went. . .and I am happy I returned it, because the replacement is a lot better. I bought a LG 47LM6400 for roughly what this TV could have cost (depending on where you buy it) if I had purchased it and the ridiculous wireless adapter. The LG also has 3D, which I do not really care about - but if you want 3D I mention it to show there are options at the same price point with 3D and other features the Panny lacks out of the box and the LG of course has built in Wi-Fi. What's ironic is the LG isn't even especially clear on the box that it has wireless built-in. The LG's blacks are much richer. The overall color reproduction is better. The web interface is better. The remote is better, although the Panny remote had a sturdier feel. The TV seems constructed better. I am not saying buy the LG, I am just pointing out you can get more features and (in my opinion) better performance for roughly what this Panny will cost you once you add in the wireless adapter. If you are shopping different models you can find comparison reviews at the site "Digital Trends." LG's 6700 series (6400 is a virtually identical new model) scored a 9/10. They are a bit gentler on the Panny than CNET. . .they reviewed a 42" from the same series and give it a 7.5/10.The biggest issue for me with this Panasonic, mechanically, was its HD picture quality in dark scenes, which I was not satisfied with. I am also very disappointed that Panasonic engaged in what I consider deceptive marketing.

Reviews.Title: Great T.V.
Reviews.Author: USCSW2010
Reviews.Content: I bought this t.v. for my husband.  I was concerned when I saw the packaging because there appeared to be some damage.  When we opened it, the t.v. was well protected and did not have any dents or scratches.  We mounted the t.v. on the wall and the picture quality is very good.  For the price its a great deal.  It was easy to set up as well.  The only compliant is that the sound quality is average, could be louder.  Overall we are very happy with out purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Hung
Reviews.Content: Nice TV for the bedroom. Just the perfect size. There is no WiFi, but you can get a USB adapter or hook it up to a Cat5 cable. Controls are easy to use. The TV itself looks sharp too

Reviews.Title: Clear
Reviews.Author: Just
Reviews.Content: I purchased the 55 inch. When I arrived home and unpacked it, it was damaged in the back due to the poor packing on panasonic. But when I received the new one it plays so clear. Hook up is very easy just as well as the set up. Great choice for the buck

Reviews.Title: Great Picture!  Fabulous price!
Reviews.Author: Internet Believer
Reviews.Content: The picture is great--the sound is a lot better than I expected.  There are a lot of purists in my family and they are VERY impressed.  I purchased this TV for $597--I did a lot of research, going to stores to see the actual pictures up close and personal.  In the mid-range price, there was no better picture.  There was an earlier review that said Amazon prime video is not available on this TV-it is-just go to the Viera Market APPs and download the Amazon APP.  I elected to hard wire to the Internet, since video streaming is always better with an Ethernet connection.  I also have a Roko box left over from the not-smart TV the Viera replaced and the wi-fi works fine using the roku box.  I am connected to cable via hdmi rather than the cable connection--big difference.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: tzarta
Reviews.Content: Great TV. Picture is clear. Sound is better than expected.  I set it up myself with no trouble.  It came on time an in perfect condition.  An earlier review makes note of the Game mode and how it affects the picture.  (please see his review). Absolutely right. Easy to adjust what situation you are viewing. Really like the ease of the apps and pic viewing straight from the sd card.  Linked to my wifi no trouble. Excellent buy.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Smog Tech
Reviews.Content: Arrived on time.  Very good picture right out of the box.  Sound is poor like all thin TV's.  Just remember it has no analog audio output terminals.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: K. Bruening
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace a plasma TV that got hit by lightning.  I'm pretty particular about my TV's and am very pleased with this one.  If you're going the LCD route, IPS is the way to go!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic TC-42E50
Reviews.Author: RDG Flyer
Reviews.Content: I received this Panasonic LED TV last week and I am really amazed on how easy it was to set up. All the internet features went smoother than ever could imagine. The only "CON" is that it didn't come with a Wi-Fi Adapter. But I knew that when I ordered this TV, so it isn't really a CON. The TV speakers are rather weak, but I have mine connected through my stereo system. The picture quality is amazing. This TV is sure worth it for the price. I am really happy with this model.

Reviews.Title: Exceeds expectations
Reviews.Author: Sleeper
Reviews.Content: I bought this because I wanted a good quality lcd/led backlit tv for a reasonable price. My biggest concern with the LED backlit televisions is the soap opera effect. I've seen some tvs where it was so bad I'd  rather use a tube television. Luckily this tv does not have it. The picture is unbelievable. I can not tell the difference between this and a comparable $1000 Sony or Samsung. Very happy with this product.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic VIERA TC-L42E50 42 inch 1080p Full HD IPS LED-LCD TV from Amazon
Reviews.Author: colum
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive about ordering a TV online after ordering a different brand from a different large discount company for in store delivery and, after setting everything up, having the TV simply turn on for 30 seconds and then go blank and be unable to turn on again.  Although the store accepted the TV return without question, it was a considerable hassle to re pack everything and bring it back to the store.  Only my past good experience with Amazon and the good price on this TV emboldened me to give it a try.  The TV was delivered promptly, the set up went smoothly, and the TV works great.  I am using an indoor antenna only and the few channels I pull in provide a beautiful picture in full HD.  Can't wait to get my outdoor antenna set up to pull in more channels.  The TV has the best quality picture that I have experienced with any TV and the sound seems fine to me.  In the reviews I read before purchasing, a few were critical of the sound.  I find the sound on this TV to be as good as on any TV I have heard in the past.  I have had good experiences with Panasonic TV's in the past and am happy to see their quality seems to remain high, unlike some other brands.  I would certainly recommend this TV to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: prashant
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a TV under $750. One which offers excellent picture, a 1080P. After seeing a dozen of TV sets at a local Best Buy and Costco store this one caught my eye, purely because of its picture quality. It beats the Samsung EH series in my opinion. I did a price comparison and found out that Amazon offers the 42" for $599 + Free Super Saver Shipping. Perfect for my need. I immediately placed the order which was delivered yesterday. The picture just blows you away. I am very happy that I bought this.Can't beat Amazon's price and excellent customer service. Thanks Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Great TV. Even Better Amazon Service. Poor Packaging.
Reviews.Author: Maloy
Reviews.Content: This TV is great. The picture quality is great and for the price you pay you cannot beat it. It has good features.  e.g. connecting to the internet and apps. To top it all off, Amazon's customer service is the best. They are better than the rest by a big margin. Hands down. I would recommend this TV to anyone who doesn't want to pay a fortune for a decent size tv. You won't be disappointed.I have one gripe with Panasonic. The packaging of this item could be improved. My box was torn when it arrived. After I opened it, it wasn't the best unpacking experience.

Reviews.Title: Decided to return it.
Reviews.Author: Ahmed
Reviews.Content: Decided to return it, the lighting bleed was too much for me to handle and the fact that it came in a worn out box and had a big dent on the back of it, I am glad I didn't wait past my 3 days, I am going to get a vizio since I already have 2 vizio tvs a 60 inch and a 32 inch and have not had one problem with those tvs and they have beautiful picture and no lighting bleed.

Reviews.Title: Awesome T.V. but very very bad packaging
Reviews.Author: Jharna Sen
Reviews.Content: Worst packaging I have ever seen in my life. the box had a lot of damages outside. The T.V. has a big bump on the back due to bad shipment. However, the picture quality of this tv is Very good. I would have kept the tv if it didn't have any physical damages. What's wrong Panasonic? they should spend more for packaging such a good quality tv.

Reviews.Title: Terrible customer service
Reviews.Author: Franklin Review
Reviews.Content: Product was missing four screws required to put the TV together. Made multiple calls to customer service, each time was unhelpful. After much hassle, I finally found out I have to fax my invoice from Amazon (seriously, fax?) to get these screws. Initial response was that I have to pay more money for screws that should have been included originally.I don't know if other TV brand's customer service is this appalling, but I do know that I won't be buying Panasonic anymore.

Reviews.Title: Great panel
Reviews.Author: BattleSwine
Reviews.Content: I didn't want a 3D HDTV.... didn't expect to fine so few.  That being said the IPS panel in this TV really what makes it great.  wide viewing angles and great color.  I love this TV's visuals, but I have to mark it down on audio.  for such a thin TV sound was better than I expected but not good enough.  No RCA or 3.5mm outs... it does have optical out, but missing the other outputs restricts flexibility.  Seeing as I have Roku I really haven't used the smart TV.  It has received several software updates.  So, at least there is ongoing support.

Reviews.Title: great picture, poor streaming support, ad supported
Reviews.Author: Jim smith
Reviews.Content: dark, vibrant picture - no complaints there.Support for streaming media is poor. No AVI just MP4, MKV. Seriously? Necessitates fiddly transcoding with DLNA servers.When you start up the TV you get an advert at the bottom of the screen (at least for internet connected tvs). It's not super-annoying, it goes away after a few seconds. But I just don't like the idea of being sold a product and then having to suffer adverts when that is not clearly announced.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality
Reviews.Author: qqblue
Reviews.Content: Well packed and arrived in perfect condition.  Set up was easy and the picture quality is excellent. Overall very happy with the product

Reviews.Title: Not exactly what I expected from Panasonic...
Reviews.Author: al
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased one of these from a local retailer for my new house to replace my 08'- 42 inch Panasonic plasma that I gave to a friend for helping me move. Before you get too far into my review I will mention I have had a few other HDTV's in the last 8 years so I have a decent understanding of the different technology the companies use and have used, I build tube guitar amps and while any modern tv is much more complex I have a basic understanding of how things in these tv's work. I was really impressed by the picture quality on this set in general. I was real happy for the first 30 minutes or so until I gave it the test of turning out the lights and seeing how it performed in the dark. Again in general the picture quality was excellent as long as the content was bright, the first few darker scenes however I noticed some areas were not as dark as others not only around the edges but in the innerparts of the screen as well. I immediatley suspected mura (clouding) as the problem. So I decided to try a input with no signal, I really was surprised how bad the clouding was. A couple of the areas were hand sized and others more band like, one vertical on the left side of the screen and a horizontal one in the upper right center part of the screen.Obviously I was more than a little bit unhappy to see this. I calibrated the set and got it much better when in standard mode but they were still easily visible in all the other modes- to be noted though only in a dimly lit or dark room. I really could not see the problem with all the lights in the room on. I realized it was going to continue to bother me anytime I viewed without the lights on and decided to return the set this morning and got a 50" UT series Panasonic plasma today which seems to be awesome just like my old 42" Panasonic plasma was. I will review the new 50" plasma TV seperately in the appropriate location here soon once I have a bit of time for a thorough review.I do not intend in any way to turn anyone away from this model. I just do know for a fact that LCD panels are still prone to mura, flashlighting and picture frame light leakage- google lcd+ any one of those 3 terms if you want a quick education on what it is and the possible causes. Some models in the past have been really prone to it and hopefully not many owners of this model experience what I did, Honestly I think 9 out of 10 people would not notice as quickly or care as much as I do, especially in a moderately or well lit viewing area. However I simply expect a consistent picture. I am happy with plasma so I'll leave this issue at that.I also find the 120 hz causes the "SOE- soap opera effect" - this drives me crazy. If you like this effect you might be into it. You can turn it off or the weak motion setting was not too bad. Also game mode disables this function, where basically the tv draws in the extra frames- any progressive scan content whether it be 480p 720p or 1080p is 60 frames per sec, which is pretty much 60hz in general. So the motion is artifically fluid at 120 hz. It really annoyed me. It looks real cool sometimes but it's just weird looking. You will notice it, whether you like it or not is a personal thing.Anyway The tv has a nice slim design. It also has a beautiful picture quality overall and the black levels are not too bad for lcd. I think Panasonic is trying to get into the lcd market and this is not a bad effort overall. I think the average person might not even notice the issues I had whether or not their set had or has them. Also The mura clouding thing is usually different with every set and probably a lot of folks got ones that are perfectly fine. It has plagued larger lcd's as long as I can remember. 4 years ago I went through 6 or more lcd's of the higher end brands and ended up with plasma. I see things have not changed all that much since then. I hope everyone who owns one of these is really enjoying theirs and not experiencing these problems. I'm just calling it like I see it.

Reviews.Title: Helpful Tips Before Ordering TV
Reviews.Author: Katie M
Reviews.Content: I just received my Panasonic VIERA TC-L47E50 47" inch TV and I absolutely love it!  However, there are a few things I wish I had known prior to its arrival so the set up would have been faster.FYI: I have wireless Internet, but I do not have cable.  I only use the local, free prime time channels (NBC, CBS, ABC, etc.)Here's what happened...I get my Internet connection through the cable outlet in my living room wall.  A cable wire comes out of the wall and connects to the Internet router/modem box.  During the setup of the Panasonic TV it became apparent that I would need to attach a cable wire to the back of the TV to get it to retrieve channels.  However, the minute I detached the cable wire from the Internet router/modem the Internet stopped working (however, the TV did start to search for available channels).It became clear pretty quickly that I would need to obtain a cable splitter and also two additional cable wires.  I was able to drive to Target that night and pick up those 3 items for about $20.  When I got home I took the cable wire that was coming out of the wall and at the end of that I attached the splitter.  Then I attached the two cable bundles I bought to the two splitter openings on the other side of the splitter.  One cable then connected to the back of the TV and the other cable connected to the Internet router/modem.  Viola, everything worked!But wait, I still couldn't get the TV to connect to my wireless Internet connection and that is when I finally realized that the Panasonic VIERA TVs do not, I repeat, DO NOT have the wireless adaptor technology built into them.  If you want to have the TV connect to the Internet wirelessly, you have to purchase the Panasonic TY-WL2OU Wireless Adaptor for Panasonic 2012 Internet Ready TVs.  A quick search on Amazon and you'll find it.  It currently costs $52.50.  I read on a different review that you can't find this in a retail store so I wouldn't bother looking.  Just order it at the same time you order your TV on Amazon.  (You can also connect the TV to the Internet via an Ethernet cord, but I don't use them anymore.)When all was said and done, it was super simple to get everything hooked up.  It only took me longer than I had hoped because I didn't have the proper cable splitter/cords that my personal situation required AND I had to wait 2 additional days for the adaptor to arrive from Amazon.I read on someone else's review that the TV is a little cheaper than other comparable brands/models because it doesn't come with the wireless adaptor built in.  In total, I spent $739.99 on the TV, $52.50 on the adaptor and $20 for the extra materials at Target.  Just over $800 for a 47" TV is a fantastic deal if you ask me!  I'd order it again in a heartbeat.If you are reading this and are still in your research phase for making a purchase know that if you are buying anything 40" or above you need to make sure the unit has 120Hz.  Also, it was important for me that the TV is able to connect to Netflix, Amazon and HuluPlus and this one does.  Note: you cannot stream regular Hulu (even with a Roku box).  Hulu's rules are that only HuluPlus can be streamed.  If you rely heavily on Hulu, I'd recommend just signing up for HuluPlus and paying the $8/month.Lastly, there's a lot of chatter on the reviews about the Soap Opera Effect (SOP), but I've been watching not for 2 days and haven't noticed it at all, so I really think it just depends on the person.I think that's all I can think of for now.  I hope this is helpful information to future buyers!

Reviews.Title: Cheap, and Good Picture Quality (120 Hz, NOT 60 Hz)
Reviews.Author: Jeff Gibson
Reviews.Content: Some reviews boo-hoo this TV as a mediocre set with poor contrast. I have to say, I don't know what they're talking about. This is a beautiful screen and it has worked great with my devices, with excellent color, refresh rate, and lighting. All the films I have watched have looked great, and at the price (got mine for $450), I could never complain. Granted, I've seen better picture quality, but not on sets below the $1000 mark, and that's too much for me right now. The "IPS" in the name says it all. Perhaps others got bad sets, but mine is great.

Reviews.Title: Changed Specs on TC-L42E50
Reviews.Author: Donald Termont
Reviews.Content: I ordered this TV with 120Hz screen refresh rate.  You changed the specs on this TV but retained the same model number...TC-L42E50.  How can you do that ?  I simply did not receive what I ordered.What are going to do about it ?  I have copies of your web page showing 120Hz.  I am just plain upset by this. Again, what are you going to do about this ?  And do not give me your standard return policy where I have pay the shipping charges and hope for a refund.  I will look for a reply soon !  D.E. Termont

Reviews.Title: READ THE FINE PRINT - NOT "WIFI READY"
Reviews.Author: Timothy Floyd
Reviews.Content: My rating is not necessarily about the TV itself, but more about the description.  I bought this TV because I had bought a "smart-tv" from Sony and really liked it.  Unfortunately, Sony does not make this model anymore, so I found this Panasonic, at a decent price.  However, what I did not realize until I have purchased, unwrapped, and setup, that the "WiFi Ready" feature means you have to spend an additionl $50+ on a wireless adapter in order to connect to your cablebox  wirelessly.  My Sony I did not have to this, and the price for the Sony was cheaper!  Also, the "digital ready" still requires a digital box.  You cannot just hook up a cable to the TV and get all your channels you get from the cable box.  I get some channels, mostly local stations in digital and home-shopping.  Very strange.  Maybe I did not read the fine print specs close enough, but the Sony TV allowed me to just connect the cable (no box) get all the stations I subscribe to, no wireless adapter required, and the internet options are not all that great.  I'm still figuring out the Netflix option, and the other services you must subscribe to.  Overall the tv is not bad, but I think if I could have found something from Target, Walmart or Best Buy, I would have been happier.

Reviews.Title: Not as advertised
Reviews.Author: arthur paul
Reviews.Content: When I purchased this television, the description read 120 Hz.  When I started using it, in particular watching sports, the tracking of a baseball hit off a bat for example, was difficult to watch.  The path and trajectory of the ball was very difficult to follow.  I now understand why.  This isn't a 120 Hz tv at all but a 60 Hz.In short, this television was not as advertised.Amazon should do something to rectify this problem.Time to do the right thing!!

Reviews.Title: Needs a wifi adapter
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: I like almost everything about the TV: picture quality, loads of inputs and outputs, the Viera interface for the smart TV apps. The TV also looks attractive even when it's turned off. The only reason I don't give this 5 stars is nowhere in the product description did I see that for wireless connection it REQUIRES a proprietary WiFi adapter, sold separately. That's right, unlike laptop manufacturers that figured out this neat trick ten years ago, Panasonic saw fit to ship an "internet ready" and "Wifi ready" (It says so on the box, "Wifi Ready")product that is actually not Wifi ready.Also, boo to Amazon for not making the wireless adapter a suggested product as other commenters have mentioned. By the way this adapter was backordered when I received my TV and realized it's shortcoming. Double boo.Due to the backorder at the time, I was inspired to make a workaround using an excellent product also available at Amazon, Diamond Multimedia 300Mbps 802.11n Wireless Range Extender (WR300N). As an added bonus this product is $10 cheaper than the Panasonic wifi adapter.Obviously, the Diamond Multimedia 300Mbps 802.11n Wireless Range Extender (WR300N) is a wifi range extender, meaning it is useful for filling out the dead or weak wifi spots in your home. I have had the good fortune of using this product for about a month prior to my purchase of this fine TV.Importantly, it can also be configured as a "Wireless Ethernet Bridge", a phrase that meant nothing to me until I had a fancy TV with a wired ethernet port, a router to connect it to the internet that happened to have a wall between it and the TV, and no apparent means of using decades old wireless technology as this was not included with the original purchase, a thought that still chaps me. Keep in mind, this TV requires a PROPRIETARY wifi adapter, shipped separately, don't even bother trying to use a generic USB wifi stick, they don't work on this.**No problem,** on a hunch, I took my Diamond WR300N, available from Amazon, reconfigured it to be a Wireless Ethernet Bridge as it is designed to do, connected it to my wifi signal, plugged it into the wired ethernet port on the back of my TV, and PRESTO, I now a wireless connected TV.Anyway, this workaround is no longer necessary as the proprietary Panasonic adapter is now available from Amazon for $10 more and probably requires less fiddling than I needed to do in its absence. But, I wanted to share this solution as this fine product Diamond Multimedia 300Mbps 802.11n Wireless Range Extender (WR300N) helped me turn a frustrating, dissatisfying situation of the nonexistent wireless connection into real enjoyment of this otherwise terrific TV.

Reviews.Title: The Best
Reviews.Author: Tony777
Reviews.Content: You cant go wrong with this TV awesome Tv... Easy to use and one thing I did not like but I still give them 5 stars is the sound ... the sound is not as loud as I thought it would be, but I still recommend this TV to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied
Reviews.Author: chuckie
Reviews.Content: Received my TC-L42E50 from Amazon on July 2nd.  Delivered by my favorite UPS driver.  Needless to say there was not a scratch on the box.  I know some people have complained about the packaging of the TV's, but I was impressed with the box the TV came in.  Seemed to be very sturdy.  No damage at all to TV.  Right out of the box the TV was very easy to set up and was watching the TV within 10 minutes.  Set-up of the internet and Viera Connect was even easier.  I am very happy with the TV and the damage free delivery.

Reviews.Title: After 18 months still happy with it
Reviews.Author: Opinions by Laura
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV about 18 months ago and are very pleased with our purchase.  Of course there are now new features available on televisions.  We won't be replacing it anytime soon, but when we do I would consider the Panasonic brand.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Does Not Stand Behind Their Product
Reviews.Author: cathy c
Reviews.Content: This is our first Panasonic TV.  We were impressed by the clear, crisp picture and competitive pricing. Unfortunately, the cons far outweigh the pros.  The internet / Netflix feature is not functional. You can't connect to the internet even with strong cable & wireless signals.  The Panasonic offshore customer service department is beyond frustrating.  After being placed on hold 15 minutes, providing all the details they will not help you unless you FAX them proof of purchase.  They refuse to troubleshoot issues without a $9.95 payment, despite the fact that a warranty card was filled out confirming the date of purchase. Shame on Panasonic.  I will not purchase another one of their products.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic TC L42E50 - Not a Quality Product
Reviews.Author: MJN
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Panasonic TC L42E50 from ABT Electronics in August 2012. In April 2013 the volume level would increase without input, and if you tried to mute the TV it would kick on back to full volume. ABT said the A board failed and replaced it under warranty. Now, a year later, the same problem has resurfaced. Diagnostic TV service visit = $149.00 plus parts. I'm not sure if all of the Panasonic TV's are lemons, but they definitely have a problem with their boards. If it didn't break once every two years, it would be a decent TV.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: KV Trout
Reviews.Content: We love our Veira. It has a much better picture than our previous Samsung. I really don't like Samsung tv's but other people do. To each his own.There are 2 things I don't like about this tv but they're nothing that would cause me to down-rate it:1) it does not swivel. I wish it did.2) the usb port is very inconvenient to get to, especially since it does not swivel. They should have put a usb port on the side or front.Other than those 2 minor criticisms this tv looks great and we like it very much.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality, poor service -- buyer beware
Reviews.Author: Patrick L. Hodges
Reviews.Content: I would strongly advise against purchasing ANY Panasonic Viera Plasm TV sets. I purchased the TC-P55GT30 Plasma set from Amazon less than 2 years ago and received the now well publicized 7 blinks of death.  A $150 part has been identified which, because of the massive issues with Panasonic TV's is virtually impossible to find.  Panasonic answered my initial calls, but now refuses to respond to inquiries around paying for the costs and/or helping to find the part replacement necessary to fix the television. After 4 weeks, my TV still sits in pieces at the repair shop referred to me by Panasonic support.  Honestly, I think I will just probably buy a new TV and NEVER purchase anything from them again.  Amazon, if you want to do right by your customers you should remove these sets from your website.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic VIERA TC-L42E50 42-Inch 1080p 120Hz Full HD IPS LED-LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Paul S.
Reviews.Content: Great picture. Lightweight. A great addition to our sun porch. Have bought Panasonic's my whole life and still have the first one I ever bought. Have 5 now and not needed any repairs on any of them.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Honest  John "Truth"
Reviews.Content: Had to return the first one I received.  The TV wouldn't operate correctly.  Took a chance and bought another one.  So far, so good. Purchase a  extended warranty for it, just in case.  Picture is very sharp.

Reviews.Title: its been a great tv and great price
Reviews.Author: C. Sonberg
Reviews.Content: I purchased it refurbished and its been a great tv.  no issues as of yet and Ive used it for a year.

Reviews.Title: TV Has Good picture decent sound
Reviews.Author: tigger55421
Reviews.Content: Received New L47E50 and set up which was simplehooking up to Comcast HD Has Nice PictureSound  only issue find is lacks stereo sound  and with one speaker still Have to say we Love it

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Viera TC-L42E50 LED/LCD TV.
Reviews.Author: John B.
Reviews.Content: The set has been trouble free and has a very good picture. The draw back on this set is the connectivity to other components.  Would like to see component/composite/S-video inputs besides the HDMI connections. The set has only ONE connection for component/composite and that is achieved through an adaptor from Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: happy
Reviews.Author: Kathleen l
Reviews.Content: I have been happy with my TV.  I have a Panasonic DVD player.  The sound automatically goes low when used with the DVD player. Sometimes even at the highest level I cant hear it and I have hearing aids.

Reviews.Title: great tv for the price
Reviews.Author: JCK
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV on sale after the holidays.  Very easy set up and the picture is amazing.  The Wi-Fi adapter is extra, but I connected it to a Wi-Fi enabled DVD player and it works great.

Reviews.Title: Best in class
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Best TV for the price.  I did a lot of research before purchasing this TV and felt this would have the best picture for the price in the 55" class.  Sound is okay but I plan on purchasing the Bose Solo to make it sound perfect.  Black finish is nice, remote and set-up are quite easy.  Great TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Lu
Reviews.Content: I bought over a year ago and still going strong.  Excellent picture, and not great sound, but ok for those tiny speakers.  Sound is better with a home theater set-up.  Liked it so much I bought a smaller size for another room!

Reviews.Title: Very good buy!
Reviews.Author: Jendrek
Reviews.Content: After using it just about one year, I claim that this is a great TV! The only complain is that it does not have WiFi, so I needed to buy an adapter for $70!I connected the TV to Denon AVR E300 through HDMI 2 that can pass sound and controls to the AVR in addition to be on the receiving side. My other sources (AppleTV and MacMini with EyeTV) are connected to the AVR using HDMI, so both audio and video go to and from the TV through a single cable.I would prefer a better integration through HDMI, but at least the power and the sound level can be controlled.BTW, a bit outdated set of 5.1 PolkAudio Monitor loudspeakers (2x60B, 2x30B, CSi25, PSW10) complete a very reasonably priced and as far as I can tell excellent Home Theater setup.

Reviews.Title: Great so far!
Reviews.Author: ET
Reviews.Content: Great TV so far (have had for 6 months now with no problems), love the built in apps... Pandora and Netflix (among others) right there built into the TV is wonderful. The picture is great without a whole lot of tweaking. Set up is a breeze. Why pay more?

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: Admin
Reviews.Content: I won't vomit tech specs at you...This is a great buy! incredible price and has for over a year maintained spectacular quality. Panasonic also is in bed with Amazon so you can stream amazon prime videos and such directly to you TV...it is Wifi ready. buy the blueray with it and use that to go online.Very happy with it!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: C.N,
Reviews.Content: Holy hell the packaging was absolutely the worst I have ever seen. There was only 4 Styrofoam blocks on the 4 corners. No protection for the middle of the TV at all. Mine was actually bent when I received it (not as bad as the picture in the gallery). There were two large dents in the metal panel on the back as well.However, other than those issues the TV is a great value. I followed the settings listed in one of the reviews and it produced good picture. The settings are not what you would find in a "Prosumer" TV but they are enough that you can adjust it to your liking.Watched a Blu-ray and was blown away by how clear it was. I could see the textures of everyone's skin and the most minute details that weren't really apparent before.The sound is not bad. My Vizios sound was terrible, this one is much better. Although most of the time I am using a surround sound the TV sound is adequate.Video games are also very pleasing to the eye. Play something pretty like Crysis 3 and you will be able to see every single detail in the game. It is much more enjoyable than my Vizio.I used a French Cleat to hang it on my wall. It weighs about 40lbs and the French Cleat has no trouble keeping it in place. If you don't need a swivel mount then I would highly recommend getting a French Cleat mount. Super simple design, low profile, and extremely easy to install, it is also much cheaper than other mounts. I think I paid about $20 for it 4 years ago.If you don't know what it is, this is what it looks like. But do not pay $80 for one. You will have to find one off of Amazon. The ones on here are overpriced.Hangman S-2060 Thin Screen TV Mount 400 & 600 VESA

Reviews.Title: Uneven illumination across the screen - not always noticeable, but when it is....
Reviews.Author: Jon Ares
Reviews.Content: There are perceptible vertical dark bands in the picture... most noticeable on panning shots across solid color pictures (like sky shots). I hadn't unpacked the unit until after the return window closed, so I just kept it (plus, it's such a pain returning big things like this.) I am disappointed in Panasonic on this one....

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Melinda Pagani
Reviews.Content: Great t.v for a great price the only thing bad i would say about it is the speaker level isn't the best

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Juvenal Llanes "Juvenal"
Reviews.Content: Great price for this unit. It has a sharp and clear image.Although you have to purchase a separate wireless adapterto be able to go online. Other brands have it incorporatedwithout having to spend more money.

Reviews.Title: tv is perfect
Reviews.Author: Chris Bedi
Reviews.Content: TV is awesome and all the apps and features are fantastic.  Like any LED tv, it has problems with sunlight, but that can be fixed...get blinds that work well.  Movies and tvs are crystal clear (make sure you turn off the motionflo as it is a bad feature

Reviews.Title: Better be connecting to a sound system
Reviews.Author: GT "GT"
Reviews.Content: SOu n d. I can turn it all the way up and not disturb my sleeping cat.Better if you are connecting it to a sound system.Stand is starting to let the TV tilt to the right.Better if you are mounting it to the wall.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: cfei
Reviews.Content: picture  quality is pretty good! It comes with WiFi support, but you have to buy a $60 USB WiFi adapter which made me uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, but the ads??
Reviews.Author: Morris Tabush
Reviews.Content: I needed a thin 47" TV for my office and this one had great reviews and a great price.Overall I'm very happy with it, just 2 complaints:1. When using as a computer monitor, there's about a 1" black border around the edge of the screen. I can't get the image to fill the entire screen unless i go to 1920x1080, but at that resolution the text is too small to read.2. Whenever I turn on the TV, there's an ad at the bottom of the screen for around 5 seconds. I assume this is downloaded from the internet (as I do have the TV connected). Really now? Ads from TV manufacturers? that's just low.but once the ad dissapears, it's just like any other TV. Being able to watch the occasional Amazon or Netflix video on the TV is nice.

Reviews.Title: Just works.
Reviews.Author: G703
Reviews.Content: After approximately 18 months of almost daily use it is just works with no problems. I followed the suggestions posted by online by other users, deselected energy saver mode and adjusted a few settings slightly.

Reviews.Title: Limited Connectivity
Reviews.Author: Carl Ratcliffe "Dr. Carl"
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic TV picture quality is really good and they are one of the few that still have the VGA connectivity.  My only complaint is the limited RGB connector which is wired with the component connection.  Limiting to those who have multiple systems they want to keep connected to the TV.

Reviews.Title: Gift for Grandma
Reviews.Author: Robzilla
Reviews.Content: This item was a gift and a significant upgrade for the new owner.  Her previous TV was a 27 or 32 CRT Sharp.  Yikes.  After reviewing <42" tvs for a couple days and experience purchasing a Panasonic 50" Plasma mid summer...I decided to spring for the LED/LCD.  I spoke with some colleagues whose parents are now older in age...and they noted that they too have LCD or LED/LCD and love them.In truth, I was indecisive about this and a Samsung product that Cnet had praised for value and performance.  There were reviews on amazon that depending what the serial number was, the glass was a much lower quality.  I dismissed the Samsung idea immediately to avoid that 1% chance of unfortunate circumstances.The extra features: Wireless capable/Apps, 2HDMI...all that great stuff didn't affect my decision so much as the quality of the product.  Luckily Best Buy had this item on display and I turned off the surrounding TVs to focus on this one.  Coincidentally the Samsung was very close and I found the picture less subtle.I purchased this last year just before Christmas while it was on sale ($548) and paired it with the  SEI Thomas Corner Media Stand, Black.  It was a blockbuster hit.  Her living area is very bright due to several windows in the open kitchen/living room area.The picture shows well but still gets washed out...I don't recall modify the settings very much.  She has a comcast cable box running to the TV and it works without any problem.  The sound I noticed you do have to turn very high...which others have noted and is a common problem with all new TVs. The 10w/20w speakers are not the best but serve their purpose in this case.  For others...it would leave you unsatisfied and wishing for surround sound.Myself and the rest of the family enjoy the TV thoroughly when visiting.  Anything larger would have been too excessive.At some point we will probably chip in for the wifi dongle and a logitech skype camera...updates for the futureCheers

Reviews.Title: Decent picture average sound
Reviews.Author: GamblingJim
Reviews.Content: This tv has a decent picture but the sound quality is not good.  If you are hooking it up it's a good idea to have it hooked up to a home theatre or stereo system. I originally bought it for my living room but decided it was too small so I mounted it on a wall in an upstairs bedroom that I use as a workout room.  It has 4 HD inputs which is nice so you can hook up a Roku, PS3, Dish network, Xbox...etc. I think this is a great set at the $500-$550 price range...but if you have a decent size living room you'll probably be better off buying a larger set.

Reviews.Title: Happy with purchase so far
Reviews.Author: B. Moore
Reviews.Content: I bought this television to place above a fireplace in a sunroom.  I was looking at the newer TC-L50E60, but then brand new units of this older model showed up on Amazon for considerably less.  I also learned this older model uses an IPS panel which is suppose to mean wider viewing angles (which I hoped meant vertically too).  I only have a few degrees of tilt on my mount above the fireplace, but this television still looks great.  I have not tested out the smart TV applications yet beyond watching a few YouTube videos (but that worked well).

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV
Reviews.Author: Christian McCord
Reviews.Content: even thinner and lighter than i anticipated this TV has been everything i wanted. I didnt even realize it came with 2 USB ports in the back and is capable of playing so far any video/audio format off them. i was particularly pleased its capable of playing MKV files smoothly though subtitles have some issues.

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied With This Tv
Reviews.Author: J. O'Brien
Reviews.Content: Have it now over one month and it works really well. Great picture quality and was very easy to set up. The speaker system is ok. I am considering buying a surround sound theatre system for it soon.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic VIERA TC-L47E50 TV
Reviews.Author: JLH
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing find; the picture is great, it has full HD and a plethora of setting to fine tune it for personal preferences or source variables.  My only complaints would be that it would be a minimal inclusion to either thow in the WiFi adaptor or just build it into the design; WiFi isn't just a luxury anymore and it's a complete waste to have all of the smart features unused because there is no easy way to route the ethernet cabling.  Also, the price of the Panasonic adapter is unreasonably high ($100).

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Irene "desert girl"
Reviews.Content: Great TV, at a great price.  The TV can do so much more than we are actually using, because we are not using all the smart features.  But, even without using all those extra features, it is perfect for your HD watching pleasure.

Reviews.Title: What can I say, It's a Panasonic.
Reviews.Author: Robert E. Darling
Reviews.Content: I had been looking at all the different models on the market and I kept being drawn to the Sony and Panasonic  It's just a great time to buy an HD TV.  Over many years I have tried quite a few different makes and models and haven't had a problem with any of them.  Now for the TV at hand.  Several friends have commented that they didn't care for it because tthe detail in all of the pictures was too clear. (joking of course)  When viewing a true 1080 picture the set is very impressive.  You have all the control of the sets functions you could ever want.  I also purchased the matching Blu-ray player and they make a winning combination

Reviews.Title: Great picture, easy to set up
Reviews.Author: Steven N.
Reviews.Content: This is a very good TV without all the features I would never use (3D, Internet links, etc.) at a very good price.Picture is very good, volume could be louder.Set up was extremely easy as they provided an hdmi connection which was very helpful.S

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Viera
Reviews.Author: Carol
Reviews.Content: The picture is very clear and crisp and it functions very well.  The sound is good, and all in all, I am very happy with theTV.

Reviews.Title: Great tv BUT the box is as cheap as they come
Reviews.Author: Myself
Reviews.Content: I had to order it myself to see how bad it was, my tv was completely trashed, however it worked but I will not keep it, I will try exchanging it for another one, if that doesnt work I will order another brand. This is a great quality TV but Panasonic was super cheap on the box. There is 0 protection. Good luck when ordering it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value for great TV - poor packaging
Reviews.Author: Somnambulist
Reviews.Content: I purchased this set when it dropped in price (the camelcamelcamel website alerted me) and the picture quality is outstanding. Before purchasing I saw the set in person at BestBuy compared to several others in the same price range, and several substantially higher in price. For the most part it displays true to life colors and contrast, and for some shows/movies it's a little off. This can be easily fixed with a little tweaking in the picture settings. I highly recommend disabling the "soap opera" setting if you are also bothered by the added frames (menu>picture>advanced picture settings>motion picture effect>off). The features are intuitive to change inputs, use media mode for USB attachments, and it streams from NetFlix and Amazon Video flawlessly with HD quality.There is a discrepancy with the refresh rate. 120Hz is the generally recognized value for the set, but other websites list the refresh at 60Hz. Having seen the TV side by side with both 120 and 240Hz sets, I can confidently say that this is clearer (no blur in fast-action scenes) than other 120Hz, and almost as nice as some of the 240Hz sets. Really an excellent value for the money!My only complaint was the packaging. It was shipped in the commercial box from Panasonic and arrived looking like it had fallen off the truck. Both sides were crushed, ripped, and there were holes torn into side where the screen rests. The molded styrofoam had been crushed into pieces, so the TV was free to move around in the box. Luckily, the only damage it incurred was a quarter-sized dent in the back of the set that doesn't seem to present any issues with picture quality. After contacting Amazon, the issue was resolved through their always outstanding customer service.Would definitely buy again!

Reviews.Title: A wonderful buy.
Reviews.Author: echolady
Reviews.Content: TV arrived just as we were going out of town. Once we got back from our trip we installed the Panasonic VIERATC-L47E50 tv set.  We are very pleased with the picture from all angles of the room. I would certainly tell everyone don't be afraid of this purchase.Only problem was trying to track the delivery.  We knew it had been shipped, but nothing recorded for us to trace its delivery. It did manage to arrive before we left town, but we were anxiously waiting. The TV arrived the afternoon right before we went out of town.

Reviews.Title: AMAZON = VALUE
Reviews.Author: Don
Reviews.Content: I gave this smart television only 5 stars cause I cannot add more stars!  First of all, the price I got was fantastic and the features are great.  One of my best buys ever!

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv, a great buy!
Reviews.Author: Kavitha Celentino
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an ultra thin tv to mount to a tiled wall in our coffee bar room, the tv is perfect, not only is it thin the picture is great and it is a beautiful tv. We are very happy with our purchase and would recommend this tv to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the Price
Reviews.Author: james hamil
Reviews.Content: Picture quality and features are top of the line. had it for a month. Very satisfied.Only supports digital audio out

Reviews.Title: Okay
Reviews.Author: Karen Ellwood "kar"
Reviews.Content: This works fine for me now in my living room but the picture quality could be better.  Sometimes it is too dark with not enough contrast and I assume it is the TV and not the satellite.  Also it is smart tV ready which means you need to buy an adaptor specifically for Panasonic and around eighty dollars or so.  if having a smart TV is important to you, you may want to research what it takes to do it.  I do not think it is hard, you just have to consider that in the price.

Reviews.Title: WOW PANASONIC DID IT AGAIN.
Reviews.Author: Frances Ficuciello
Reviews.Content: It is everything that I had expected from  Panasonic. I have always owed Panasonic TV's for years and never had a problem with any of them. That is the reason I bought this one and I am not sorry. When it was delivered took it out of the box plug it in and connected the satellite turned it on and didn't have to do another thing to it picture is beautiful. Panasonic is just a great product that is why I have owed them through the years.

Reviews.Title: double boxed, great TV
Reviews.Author: K. Schmidt
Reviews.Content: I think the TV has been well described by others, I just wanted to note that my TV came in a box in a box.  (Arriving in perfect condition)  I had the base assembled and surfing channels in less than 30 min.  The remote worked perfectly even controlling my Sony blue ray player and its web features.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, okay sound, great for networking, needs extra and special wireless adapter!
Reviews.Author: Galaxyhiker42
Reviews.Content: So I got this TV because it can be hooked up to the "internet" (it can only be hooked up to Vera app store.. so netflix and what not) BUT the big thing is, I can hook it up to my DLNA server! (All my movies on the big screen now!)The only reason I do not give this 5 stars is because it is wireless ready BUT in order to use wireless you have to buy an expensive Panasonic adapter. BUT do no fret. Simply buy a wireless gaming adapter, (I use this TRENDnet Wireless N Gaming Adapter TEW-647GA (Black)) and hook it up to your Ethernet port! (Saves you 50 dollars but you do have the extra cables)Over all, its not a bad TV.

Reviews.Title: Great mid-range unit
Reviews.Author: C. Steves
Reviews.Content: I bought the same model, but the 47" inch for my bed room and bought the 42" for my sister as a Christmas present for her apartment. The picture is great, the refresh rate is great, and it's a full IPS panel so I was sold on the specs.The one negative I have (and I'm not media expert or videophile) is that you do see a bit of flashlighting from the backlight and some cloudy bright spots in very dark scenes during a movie or TV show.As with any flat panel TV, the sound is not the best, but if you really want good sound you'll set up an independent sound system anyway.Other than that it's great, good remote, plenty of inputs.

Reviews.Title: TV IS NICE
Reviews.Author: DRINDAHOUSE4U
Reviews.Content: NICE PICTURE FOR BRAND NAME SO PRETTY HAPPY WITH IT  ONLY THINGIS I WISH IT CAME WITH  A WIRELESS INTERNAL DEVICE  I GUESS ILL BUY THE WIRLESS DONGLE SOON  OR MAY JUST HARD WIRE IT,,,FOR THE PRICE I PAID ITS GOOD 600

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: GT
Reviews.Content: I already have a Panasonic Viera 42-inch plasma TV so was interested to see how the LED would compare. The LED is not as sharp as the plasma, but it cost around 30% of what I paid for the plasma so I'm not complaining. Interestingly the picture seemed to get better the longer I used it so for the money this is a good TV. As I run the Internet through a Mac Mini I'm not interested in the TV's Internet connectivity.My only complaint was that the TV arrived in just its original packaging, which had a large cut where something sharp had struck the box. Luckily the damage to the box was cushioned by the internal packaging but I came close to sending it back.In summary the Panasonic VIERA TC-L42E50 42-Inch LED TV is a good buy at the price.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Sven-O
