Reviews.Title: broke after a month
Reviews.Author: nc
Reviews.Content: The TV broke after a month of light use.  I've never had a TV die before, much less after just a month.

Reviews.Title: good and bad
Reviews.Author: W. ZHU
Reviews.Content: the product is good, but on the price in three days the prices changed so fast, that makes me think that this is a factory restore item.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture but not for sports
Reviews.Author: erictepe
Reviews.Content: So, I purchased this TV for my birthday/Christmas gift for my "man room" in the basement. I purchased it for 3 things:1. To play Xbox on2. To watch sports on3. To stream an occasional movie the wife does not want to watch.This TV worked beautifully with my Xbox on games. Halo 4, Left4Dead and Rock Band 3 looked stellar. No faults there. For movies, again incredible picture, especially viewing some of the "Frozen Planet" episodes in HD. Where this TV really struggled was viewing football and basketball. The views after the plays, of the sidelines and of the halftime shows were great. When the networks would pan out to show the action of the plays, it had real issues. The picture would be pixelated sometimes so bad that you could not read the jersey numbers. The edges of the players during plays became very dull and "un-sharp" during those times. You would also see halos and artifacts around the players. You would also see "blobs" in the field where the turf was not sharp and looked like a green "blob. In watching basketball, I would notice the same issues. It had a real hard time staying sharp during sports action. My point of comparison when I started to notice this was my 2 year old Samsung 6500 series which has an excellent picture and none of these artifacts.In trying to improve the picture, I used some online calibration settings from various sites which were very similar but to no avail. I contacted Panasonic and they were absolutely no help as I could not access any of the other menu settings other than the simple ones under the "menu" button.Maybe I was missing something but overall I was not impressed. If you are a non-sports fan and only watch TV shows, movies and game, then this is a great set. If you watch sports at all, go with a Samsung or LG. I am going to use my refund on a Samsung 6100 series.

Reviews.Title: Great TV - Sound is not amazing
Reviews.Author: Joe Fox
Reviews.Content: 12.24.12 I changed my mind, this is a very good TV, the picture is Amazing, there is a learning curve with the features, take the time to play with it.The sound is not all that but if you have a sound bar you are good to go.One thing you should know -  Vera CONNECT Wi-Fi Ready =  NO WI-FI!!!! you need to buy an adapter.

Reviews.Title: L47E50 TV
Reviews.Author: Shuangxi Wang
Reviews.Content: Most of the functions are pretty good  based on its priceQuality of the picture is not very good and WI-FI internet  doesn't work.

Reviews.Title: Decent picture but poor design.
Reviews.Author: vr2006
Reviews.Content: Purchased due to respectable brand and famous Panasonc reliability history and was very uspet now.Pros: Decent pictureCons:1. USB port is absolutely useless for me, because most of the video files are not compatible and could not be watched.2.Tried to connect to PC through HDMI cable but could not adjust the the screen size properly even with the tech support.At the present time I have to use VGA input to watch videos from PC .2. Due to the same reason could not use ethernet(DLNA) to be connected to my PCs.That means I overpaid for unnecessary features and have to purchase DVD player or video box.Samsung TVs are compatible with most of the PC files and have better picture quality.Made a big mistake when purchased this model.I Can not recommend this item for purchasing. Buy another brand.

Reviews.Title: Picture great- internet apps terrible
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: The display is awesome. The internet connectivity is bad. The UI is sluggish and slow to load. Watching Panasonic TY-WL20U Wireless Adapter for Panasonic 2012 Internet Ready TVs over this wifi, it buffers longer and has more hiccups/rebuffers than the roku or xbox sitting right next to the TV. Rather than spend the 50$ for the panasonic USB wifi dongle, I strongly suggest just buying a Roku 2 XD Streaming Player 1080p. Same price, and way better experience.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic LCD
Reviews.Author: kim d. herring
Reviews.Content: This TV was a gift so I haven't actually seen it. The recipient however loves it and couldn't be happier with the picture quality and overall aesthetic.

Reviews.Title: Web browsing  not supported
Reviews.Author: Terri Simon
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv for several reasons, the vierra connect is of them,  I was excited about web browsing in a big screen but unfortunately this tv is not supported even is a 2012 tv. Can someone confirm this please.

Reviews.Title: Banner Ads?!
Reviews.Author: Damon
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is great, but it irks me that there are random banner ads displayed when I turn on the power or change the volume. I hate this and had I known about it, I would have purchased a different TV.

Reviews.Title: NO CLOSED CAPTION WITH HIGH DEFINITION.
Reviews.Author: Marvin
Reviews.Content: THE OPENING SCREEN SAYS TO USE THE HDMI ANTENNA CONNECTION #1 FOR HI DEFINITION RECEPTION BUT IT ALSO SAYS THAT THERE WILL BE NO CLOSED CAPTION IF YOU DO THAT.  I LIKE CC UNDER SOME CONDITIONS SO I WAS NOT PLEASED.  ALSO THE SHARPNESS CONTROL MOVED THE INDICATOR BAR BACK AND FORTH BUT DID NOT AFFECT THE PICTURE AT ALL. I RETURNED THIS ITEM BUT THE SERVICE FROM AMAZON WAS EXEMPLARY IN EVERY WAY.

Reviews.Title: Customer Service is a joke
Reviews.Author: paul fletcher
Reviews.Content: We ordered our television on May 30th and we got it one week later.  When I went to assemble the two-piece base I discovered that I was missing one package of the screws missing....no problem , I just called Panasonic Customer Service.....I had to answer a whole bunch of questions and was then told that I needed to prove that I had bought the television.....I had already supplied the model, serial number, where ordered, when ordered, how much I paid and  was then told that I was going to have to submit a copy of my receipt and some other item....I told the lady that the a receipt had not come with the television and that all I wanted were four screws worth about $0.50!  I told her that I wanted to speaik with a supervisor.  About 10 minutes later a unknown male got on the line and said that he was a supervisor....I had to ask him for his name......I then related what had been said with the other Customer Service person and that all I needed was the four screws to hold the two parts of the base togther.  I also told him that I had supplied all information requested....he then told me that I would have to prove that I had bought the television for a fifty cent item....I told him that I didnt have to supply proof of purchase when I bought and registered the television and that I wouldnt be recommending any item that Panasonic sells due to the worst experience that I have ever had with customer service.  I went to ACE got the screws and put the television together.  If you want to NOT BE BELIEVED AND BASICALLY BE CALLED a liar and a thief just call PANASONIC CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent LED TV with one stupid design flaw.
Reviews.Author: L. Ly
Reviews.Content: The power indicator underneath the Panasonic logo is ALWAYS on when the TV set is powered on and vice-versa thus causes distraction when I am watching TV. Also, the stereo sucks, it could have been better. 1 star off for the dumb indicator.

Reviews.Title: ORDERED A FLAT TV
Reviews.Author: Gene Kester
Reviews.Content: I ORDERED A FLAT TV AND RECEIVED A PANASONIC 47" FROM NEW YORK, WHICH WOULD BE WHAT I ORDEREDIF IT HAD NOT BEEN DAMAGED BEFORE DELIVERY.  IT APPEARS TO HAVE BEEN DROPPED, DAMAGING THETOP RIGHT CORNER, NOT QUITE ENOUGH TO INTERFERE WITH THE PERFORMANCE, BUT I AM EXPLAININGTO FRIENDS WHAT HAPPENED.  WELL, THE ONLY EXPLANATION IS CHECK YOUR DELIVERY BEFORE  FEDEXLEAVES YOUR AREA.  GENE

Reviews.Title: So far, so good.
Reviews.Author: JK
Reviews.Content: We purchased a Panasonic Viera a couple of years ago in a 46 inch and love it, so we knew we couldn't go wrong getting another one for another room.

Reviews.Title: not totally impressed.
Reviews.Author: A. Morris
Reviews.Content: This TV comes with the crappiest remote I've ever used. Whoever is responsible for designing it should be fired. The back is awkwardly shaped. Its really hard to tell if you're holding it right side up without looking at it - which is bad for lazy laying on the couch tv watching. the CONNECT TO THE INTERNET button is situated right next to a up arrow button and its easy to press the wrong one. The overall button layout is terrible.Also, the menu interface of the tv isnt that great either. Programing channels is a pain. It seems to be lacking a lot of options that my old tv had. blah blah blah. I hate the remote.If you are wondering about picture quality - that seems ok and I dont have any complaints about that.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Is Number ONE
Reviews.Author: franklin sylvia
Reviews.Content: I have a Panasonic 42" Plasma Viera, DVD players, and I really enjoy your products. I have research all electronics, and Panasonic in my book is Top of the line. I will always buy Panasonic products.

Reviews.Title: Not really the picture quality I expected.  Sound is much better than expected.
Reviews.Author: P. Carruth
Reviews.Content: The TV is a great looking TV with nice piano lacquer.  The sound for a flat screen is really much better than I expected.  The problem is with the picture quality.  No matter how it's adjusted you just can't seem to get it right.  The reds are too red and the blacks are to dark.  But, for the price I guess it's a OK buy.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic TC-L42E50
Reviews.Author: Tania
Reviews.Content: THIS IS A GREAT TV I WOULD DEFINITELY RECOMMEND THIS ITEM TO ANYONE ONLY ISSUE WAS SCREWS FROM EXISTING WALL MOUNT BRACKET DID NOT FIT THIS TV WE HAD TO BUY NEW SCREWS FROM HARDWARE STORE

Reviews.Title: NO ADS
Reviews.Author: william ross
Reviews.Content: I WOULD GIVE IT 5 STARS IF IT DIDN'T HAVE POP UP ADVERTISING EVERY TIME I TURN THE SET ON.

Reviews.Title: Not about the TV but Amazon's excellent customer service
Reviews.Author: Amy Vahmontah
Reviews.Content: This television was never opened as I stupidly ordered it in error when I saw a suddenly lower price from the one I actually wanted. Part of the confusion was there's only a difference of "50" instead of "5" in the model number. The order was placed on Thursday Dec. 6, and I realized my mistake on Friday the 7th. As it was already shipped, too late to do anything but hopefully refuse the delivery when UPS arrived. However, in spite of the notes I left, UPS screwed up and dropped it off on my front porch where it stayed for a week until they finally came and picked it up to return to Amazon. I had to make several calls to UPS (frustrating and angst-ridden) to make this happen and a couple of "live chat"s with Amazon's Customer Service just to make sure we were all on the same page. I fully expected to be charged for the return shipping but Amazon was sweet and didn't. I received my refund on 12/22 and the TV is back at Amazon. Big boo UPS, cheers to Amazon!!

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Yashesvini
Reviews.Content: I'm a stickler when it comes to sound quality.  It's a good tv (good picture and ok sound).  I've found that if I increase the sound to 3/4 of the way it sounds clear...wish it had Dolby.  Also wish it has wi-fi built-in.  It was easy to set up btw...just make sure you're careful not to throw away the parts...which we almost did.

Reviews.Title: Has trouble with motion
Reviews.Author: Dave Webb
Reviews.Content: So I have this TV for about 2 months and I have noticed that when people move somewhat quick, the image gets blurry.  I am not talking about fast moving sports players, I am currently watching Donnie Brasco and when those characters move somewhat quick, it gets blurry.I am not sure if I need to change the settings but, in my opinion, this shouldn't happen with a movie like Donnie Brasco.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't have a web browser and won't display same webpages on your phone or tablet.
Reviews.Author: Heather Anhalt
Reviews.Content: Under product description, in Viera Remote APP Support it says, " Display the same web pages on both your VIERA screen and your smartphone with a simple flick. Simply "swipe" and share your favorite photos, music, and movies from your smartphone to your VIERA TV anytime. "  After a few hours of working with the TV, I found out that this model does not have a web browser and does not support web pages.  The E50 is not a Viera remote compatible model for web pages.You can check out the compatible models at this site:  [...]

Reviews.Title: The TV picture quality is horrible!
Reviews.Author: W. Martin
Reviews.Content: I bought this product to replace my Samsung 47" LCD TV.  It had a beautiful picture quality and was 4 years old but bit the dust.  Because it only lasted 4 years I didn't buy Samsung again.BAD IDEA.  I went by the reviews on this Panasonic TV and I either got a lemon or all the reviews were from gamers that don't watch TV.  The color depth on this Panasonic is not vivid; all the optins I chose couldn't make the picture better.  Since I bought it on PRIME from Amazon I thought I could ship it back on their dollar.  NOT.So my advice is to buy something LOCALLY you can touch/feel and SEE with your own eyes instead of using Amazon for TVs. Reviews.Title: OK but not fantastic
Reviews.Author: doxtorray
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my parents, because they had read that it got high ratings in a consumer magazine that reports such things. Alas, my parents don't comparison shop and don't go to electronic stores weekly as I do. So, they had little actual knowledge of what to look for in a TV that would be in their particular viewing setting.This TV is an acceptable HDTV, but a nice picture and several HDMI inputs are no longer sufficient to be a great product. Here are some cons and pros of this particular model, based on my several day experience of setting up the TV and watching it with my parents:Cons:1) Very reflective screen- while not shiny glass, the matte of the screen is reflective enough that every light and every well-lit object in the room can be seen on the screen. This for me would be enough to send the TV back.2) Only one composite/component input - obviously, not so important if you have only digital sources to view, but my parents had a VCR and a non-HDMI DVD player, both of which they still use. OOOPS3) A lot of features require internet connection, which either requires ethernet wired to the TV or the special proprietary USB dongle4) Sound not very loud - this is common with thin TVs, but the problem is more pronounced in this set than in most of those I have seen or own.5) Banner "ads" that pop up when you turn on the set and do various things, unless you disable them (and my parents would NEVER have been able to play around long enough to find out how to do this).6) Remote switching of input devices could be easier (it is not terrible, but I had to run things through with my parents more times than I hoped would be necessary).Pros1) Decent picture (generally pretty dark for my taste, even on the brightest settings, I assume to mimic plasma)2) 4 HDMI inputs (one or two more than others I have seen of this screen size)3) Very thin form factor4) Built in internet features, including Netflix, if you either have an ethernet connection handy or want to spring for the optional USB-wifi dongle.My parents are happy with this TV, but then they watch in utter darkness in a very dark room. In those conditions, this is a fine TV, but if the viewing situation is anything different, you must either be quite tolerant of reflection or might be happier with another model/brand. For reference, the store/discount brands of two brick-and-mortar stores both offer units with less reflection and about as good a picture for a slightly lower price.

Reviews.Title: Not-Wi-Fi/Internet Ready and USB Plug Issues
Reviews.Author: Jeff - Supporting Elderly
Reviews.Content: It is NOT Wi-Fi / Internet Ready as advertised on Amazon.  That is not true.  You have to separately Panasonic TY-WL20U Wireless Adapter, or you do NOT have a Wi-Fi, Internet Ready television.  One of the key aspects of this is that you are buying a TV to be able to access the Internet, which you can only do by purchasing another Panasonic wireless  product.  That would seem OK, although it is at least another $100.  Here's the deal, while you can get it work that way, the two USB ports are so close together, that even though there is more than one USB port, the Panasonic wireless adapter is large that it takes up both USB ports.  So then once you have it connected to the Internet, if you want to link to Skype, etc, well you CAN NOT.  Why?  Because since the Internet is not BUILT-IN on this model, the Internet adapter takes up both USB ports, and by the way, if you try to get a bus or a cord to make more space, then the Viera won't work with the Panasonic Internet adapter.  So pay more and by one that will have built-in Internet.  This model does NOT have Built-in Wi-Fi/Internet and that is a BIG DEAL.

Reviews.Content: I didn't buy this through Amazon, but I was so annoyed with this TV I decided to write a review.I can't speak about the picture quality yet, as I've only ever had it streaming Netflix through a Samsung device.  (The picture quality was bad btw, but I'll leave my judgment about that until later).What I can speak about is the wifi capability.  I bought this TV for a spot which is far from a cable outlet.  I specifically bought this TV so I could stream shows from Netflix, Amazon Prime, etc; It was advertised as "wifi" capable.Well what they don't tell you is that you need a separate "wifi adapter" that connects to the TV via the USB port.  I've done my research and it seems that you can only use a Panasonic device (hard to find), which seems to sell at Amazon for between $60-120.Um yeah that's a lot of money, considering that I already paid a premium for this TV over other TVs that are not wifi capable.Actually with Panasonic's logic, EVERY TV is wifi capable.  I mean practically all TVs have HDMI ports through which you can connect a Roku device.So obviously - this left me with a bad taste in my mouth.  Panasonic is lucky I'm too lazy to put the tV back in the box and return it.  But I will not give them any more money, and I'm definitely not buying that Panasonic wifi adapter; I simply bought a Roku.And personally, I doubt I'll be buying any Panasonic devices in the near or distant future and any friend who asks me about my TV will certainly get an earful.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic LCD vs Plasma?
Reviews.Author: Hank
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic VIERA TC-P55ST50 55-Inch Plasma from Amazon was ultimately chosen over the VIERA TC-L47E50 LCD based on its ratings and numerous visits to home theater stores for product comparison with the LCD's.Returned the VIERA TC-L47E50 LCD after concluding it was just too bright and colors appeared sort of unnatural and a bit "cartoonish" for me. It should be noted however that this is based on my reaction to ALL the new LCD/LED's not just this particular one. I will still give the Panasonic LCD 4 stars though and is an excellent choice, especially with its brilliant IPS screen. The picture, while really good, was not quite as good as my Sony Bravia which died the same month as its warranty expired (like the 2 before it!). Goodbye Sony. While the LCD's look superior in stores with bright lights, the Panasonic Plasma had a strong edge in a Home Theater Stores with lighting more similar to my living room. On several occasions at the Home Theater Store I compared the Panasonic Plasma with the $2,700 Sony HD LCD across from it. To me the Panasonic Plasma had the edge in reproducing colors, especially blacks and easier on the eyes.The Panasonic Plasma is a fantastic TV. No problems at all were observed with any Plasma "noise" or screen reflections.In the old days people recommended Plasmas should be "broken-in" for 100 hours or so. I made no special effort to really do that but did stay away from fixed images, higher contrast, high brightness and bars during that time. It is now in full Custom mode and looks great.I am not yet using the 3D feature so can't provide a comment.The Viera Smart internet functions work fine but doubt I will use them much.If you like watching your programming in a normal to more dimly light room, you should strongly consider the Panasonic Viera Plasma. If you watch in a more strongly lit room with windows and bright sunlight you might prefer the Panasonic LCD.It's all a matter of preferences. Both are great choices.

Pretty soon they will be shipping their TVs in envelopes.What about my time spent unpacking and packing TVs and all of the frustration?The comments are about two 47" E50s and one 47" ET5.

Reviews.Title: Bad sound, so-so picture.
Reviews.Author: Larry K.
Reviews.Content: This set has terrible sound. Far worse than I expected, and I wasn't expecting much.Panasonic made things worse by not including analog output (some new TV's still have them), and then compounded the issue by not allowing the digital audio output format to be specified.  Other manufactures allow the output format to be specified as 2 ch stereo. Not Panasonic. Less expensive D/A converters and soundbars don't handle Dolby Digital. This rules out many sound bars and bumps the cost of a converter from $25 to $90.Bottom line: If you're expecting to simply replace an older set you need to plan on spending $$ on additional equipment (and have room for it). And, you need to be careful that what you get is compatible (hdmi or optical digital connections + built in dolby digital decoder).In addition, I can't figure out the reasoning behind their current lineup of sound bars. The best match for my setup are two from last year.Picture is OK, but not great when compared to 20+ year old CRT. Requires constant fiddling depending upon source material. Significant loss of contrast when viewed off angle, though color shift is minimal. Panasonic claims '178 degrees' viewing angle but this is defined as the range where contrast is 10:1 or higher. 10:1 is quite poor. Don't confuse this with a plasma! Black level is tough to get right. Dark areas tend to come out black. Cranking up the brightness does solve the black problem, but then objects that are actually black become gray.Closed captioning is very basic. Can't adjust font size or position, and will "zoom" off the screen under certain circumstances.TV is "wireless Internet ready"... this means it includes a Ethernet port for a wired connection, but does not have wireless (wifi) built-in. For wireless you must purchase TY-WL20U adapter which plugs into one of the two USB ports.The box that the TV arrived in had suffered some damage. The cardboard was rather thin and not much in the way of Styrofoam packaging material. However, the set itself appeared to be undamaged. These TV's appear to be somewhat fragile. I wouldn't think twice about returning if I saw *any* damage to the TV.Power consumption is quite low, but is somewhat negated by all of the extra gizmo's that are needed to get decent sound.I give it 1 star for sound, 3.5 for picture.

Reviews.Title: Internet Plasma not ready for primetime
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: I purchased a 42" Panasonic Plasma TV that is "internet ready". It is that in name only. I had to purchase the DY-WL10 Wireless LAN adapter to make it "sort of" work. The connection to Netflix constantly dropped out on HD movies. After a great deal of trouble shooting I found that the DY-WL10 was the cause of the problem. It does not have the range nor the bandwidth to solve to handle HD movies. I solved the problem by adding a Netgear range extender and coupling the signal from that into the TV using a 10/100 LAN cable. Now the DL-WL10 is in the junk box. My other problem with this rush-to-market TV is how dumb it's Netflix interface is. You have to use an external computer to put a show on your instant queue before you can find it on the Panasonic. My older Vizeo lets me search from the TV. Panasonic probably could fix the problems with an upgrade of their firmware.On the positive side the picture is great and with the Viero speaker system so is the the sound.
